Its historical significance is underscored by its recognition as a precursor to Marxist dialectics. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">2be40bedc401aa74026067cbca67b681,4424ff0552ddcfee2317f7caf01db070</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;DIALECTICAL MATERIALISM&quot;">\n      <data key="d0" />\n      <data key="d1">Dialectical Materialism is a philosophical system that serves as a foundational principle for Soviet military science.  It emphasizes historical analysis and change, acting as a key element in the Soviet understanding of war. This influence extends to their holistic approach to politics and conflict, shaping their view of war as an interconnected phenomenon. Dialectical materialism is presented as a philosophical system with three basic laws that guide this understanding. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">2a4b75db8fdd23483fc6c4f097c7f56f,2be40bedc401aa74026067cbca67b681,3cd3649d4d82b16c6d105090d8081f6e,4424ff0552ddcfee2317f7caf01db070,645ce27900f66a0b633be93f0e5d6399,8493f884b789159d96b7dab3a7202396,e8980bd806b32ffd5ad4b169a299338d,e90da29be1148d9844e3ed777db08bf6</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;KVACHKOV&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">KVACHKOV is an author and military theorist who proposes a new conception of war, emphasizing non-military means. He presents a new classification of war that includes both military and non-military means,  differing from Clausewitz\'s definition while sharing similarities with Serebryannikov\'s views on war. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">1507b417cf61f29030428f95a1c2dc08,4640d14036dc3924713f8e3da33466d6,86135dd72edc8f7cfa522d2093158942,990f73c5f878701d1f0eda068b4141f2,c4d611eafc5e900466e378a2742c03bf,e847464375c697471e8db8e76b49b6d1</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;SEREBRYANNIKOV&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Serebryannikov is a military theorist and scholar whose views on war are often compared to those of Kvachkov. He emphasizes the importance of armed conflict in warfare, believing that information-psychological warfare holds significant potential for influencing citizens.  Serebryannikov\'s conclusions align with Kvachkov\'s, suggesting both scholars prioritize the role of physical violence in achieving military objectives. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">2ea3da30a4c11ce53e27f0d4b749018c,4640d14036dc3924713f8e3da33466d6,489aeca592784f5f7be0a754beb4f575,48e310bd8a37fd938fc512819430d5f7,57424d7973e0b0ad452fc6115605d61f,818993a678a84051e60563bfd33f106a,c4d611eafc5e900466e378a2742c03bf,e847464375c697471e8db8e76b49b6d1</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;GAREYEV&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Mikhail Gareyev is a prominent Russian military theorist and expert on military science. He is recognized for his contributions to the understanding of war\'s evolution, particularly in light of modern non-military means of confrontation.  \n\nGareyev argues for a traditional definition of war while acknowledging the increasing importance of non-military forms of struggle, such as information warfare and "soft power," which he views as threats to Russia. He emphasizes the need to reevaluate the definition of war in the 21st century due to these evolving threats.  \n\nHis book, "Battles on the Military-Historical Front," endorsed by General Gerasimov, reflects Russia\'s perspective on information warfare. Gareyev has also written extensively about the changing nature of war, including the blurring of lines between military and non-military means, and the significance of moral superiority, technology, and doctrine in modern warfare. He is considered a leading figure in Russian military thought, comparable to Kartapolov and Gerasimov. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">068fed974175a4460923174d7ce00bbf,0e40df5d22db6584ec7e05b07c3d9b66,112509ae19803edd47655e5f2fc22ae1,147e97078c17806ecd33780d6451826f,26bcdb76c6596b963d2e36a4147ef816,2ed01d91a2d5804af478b65fbd4fff17,3335c606e0de431e14afc7e61f86dfa8,35f2eda2e0dde94f12831c18a3f5fa57,35fa4f03c6bbb412d22ff5f494e83329,3722261684591ed62374be49eb1b29a9,38e06a95c9c0cfb7005614fb378b4a28,3fe4dd62a032b1a281c925fbec9cbc6a,4640d14036dc3924713f8e3da33466d6,46560acff919ef6253fd1d861d00ae9c,483f10acb5879df6406474c706388bbb,4a4127fa2d140cfe4bba76e93169d035,4f7f4f6fe9d288255da50532faa25f53,518267175ed2900e7e23fd3a54bdf33f,5c79cd610c718db1aa2cf27f837d00c8,5cd9f4f78cb2dfdfcb512cc36ac0202f,62f74165e5942d3e5a65f9812140f735,651d70f1b96f83fb3e8a870528879b0f,68d539054aaa9dcc75ed59e59850468c,6bacaefd10a9194c28dfbec9e59620a1,7357dc206ba88482f202ea79850252f2,752e31eca4dc5d94da820c3cb84cf6e9,7567750cec0624c2e9f362f989d8b1bc,76afbf3e037f83e305f2431eddf52e38,803cf3c02920d14a7bb0447fc1c76140,84b65c4d676043766aeebfc93b776ae6,84fbeb27b48ec1426740369d4f5b851e,850631a820a8158d8c7bff68e8f7fea5,8beec46e554e40907188a8b4eadfb7f8,93ae7eb8b09d8dba110ee24dc8c2544c,9d9628ed6f319fa3c7a74e5a5971aad6,a8ab56e6e419d570a195fd2ea167899d,abe7dca7f715b3a56df70fa74b56aa30,ac4e19c9709c97775be647ede43818b5,b150f2af73252fedbdd595a3de157238,b561bc3a166d627669a12364a4a320b1,bbe1de76c191cb2a1148f1c4cc547644,bc02775c6811de9ca81bfb2af4207e24,bd400dbd8e753ab71c9394fe8b1f07ce,bfbbd058526ebede84405e2e4e3f47b5,c4d611eafc5e900466e378a2742c03bf,c57482161043b2c5d5a644c558fb2fa6,c6557d1800561000ed6c8db91857d73e,c8c68899e22ee8c693d6e73e47d38c9e,cdb1d6abbb222058b92413663953ef84,d67b112a958502c163b1c99c7ba13f8f,df08541749dd65fc3af06e736fdc5203,e0053ef676c35b3b5e2e0225190d6463,e0927b91be8f756165d5fca82ca84107,e847464375c697471e8db8e76b49b6d1,fa1f745b441f0a8da9c96e5184733ab7,fcf6292acd4060dcb8b6f555eeebabe3</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;OTSTAIVAYA NATSIONALNYYE INTERESY&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Otstaivaya natsionalnyye interesy" is a 2005 article by Gareyev, likely exploring the topic of national interests in relation to war."</data>\n      <data key="d2">62f74165e5942d3e5a65f9812140f735</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;KAZARIN&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Kazarin is an author who, in his work, argues that information struggle is a unique type of warfare inherent in all other forms of conflict. He first introduced this concept in 2002.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">41577e491a1539dcefa344bdfe5ecdf6,48e310bd8a37fd938fc512819430d5f7,60642b4264405ef39d55111c2feff3c4</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;VLADIMIR SEREBRYANNIKOV&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Lieutenant General Vladimir Serebryannikov argues against expanding the concept of "information struggle" because he believes it would blur the lines between war and peace.  He warns that including information warfare under the umbrella of war could have detrimental consequences for distinguishing peaceful activities from acts of aggression. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">48e310bd8a37fd938fc512819430d5f7,cfae2a9660e62a12a25d2678a2931f34</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;SUN TZU&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Sun Tzu is a historical military strategist from ancient times. His ideas on warfare are widely referenced, particularly by Gorbunov and Bogdanov who cite his writings.  Serebryannikov also mentions Sun Tzu as an authority figure, highlighting his suggestion about achieving victory in war without fighting. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">37215a6c4810a7b385fb17417f94fbe0,48e310bd8a37fd938fc512819430d5f7,5497fc2e9ef0c53f1b17d4b901c85832,6c276ef5c88e4f06e651dfab52e4f31a</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;INFORMATION STRUGGLE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0" />\n      <data key="d1">"Information Struggle" is a concept that has gained popularity alongside "Armed Struggle".  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">48e310bd8a37fd938fc512819430d5f7,b477b517d309b8c0ead048c621cce8c7</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;ARMED VIOLENCE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Armed Violence is widely recognized as a key element in defining war.  While various scholars emphasize its importance, there\'s also recognition that it\'s not the sole defining factor. Kalistratov argues that armed violence is a component of war but not the only one. Gerasimov and Serebryannikov both highlight armed violence as a crucial aspect of warfare. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">2ea3da30a4c11ce53e27f0d4b749018c,305962ed9f6bc11996bd9bee0803ed4f,313dc3be1190b1a10a2579c621091156,81610c5774616913fcb1d17e45b9c19b</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;WARFARE PROPER&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Warfare proper refers to traditional military conflict involving armed forces."</data>\n      <data key="d2">2ea3da30a4c11ce53e27f0d4b749018c</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;NONMILITARY ACTION&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Nonmilitary action encompasses strategies and tactics that do not involve direct combat."</data>\n      <data key="d2">2ea3da30a4c11ce53e27f0d4b749018c</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;MOSCOW&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"GEO"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Moscow is the capital of Russia and a key player in strategic decision-making. It is presented as the center of Russian decision-making regarding national security and military strategy, and the location from which hostile actions could be assessed. Moscow is also mentioned as a geopolitical entity whose efforts are being analyzed, and a location where the Russian military has demonstrated its capabilities. \n\nAs a key actor in international relations, Moscow engages in deterrence and coercion strategies, expressing frustration with Western perceptions and actions, as well as misperceptions. It perceives informational struggle as a way to counter US information warfare.  Moscow is also mentioned as the place of publication for K Novoi Redaktsii Voennoi Doktriny. The city serves as a point of interaction with the West, representing the Russian government or military leadership and its strategic community. \n\n\nPolicymaking discourse takes place in Moscow, and it is considered a location where actions can be assessed.  Moscow is also home to a strategic community, highlighting its geopolitical significance. Finally, Moscow is mentioned as the location or origin of the strategic calculus being discussed. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">00a8e6977b8cc35ff2706d718367759f,0f97ca1859706e3c7adde28565dbdfc9,1422855893cd2f75b13c9945dc9b4499,26123c88ed4eb5080379f3088a3359d6,2eec4248a3431cdb2dccff5f1d3bac61,317fb77f10175bd5aa2b7ba8103b25ad,3f38017cf23bc7563f3f91672438843d,4029a673e4a82185b802f0ac1cd07c9c,54c29f07a55c22a9e00bc4e9dc3677da,55dbadef5c541e211456244efc6a8b5d,61ac280201ff550c532fdc0a622b220c,8ae47a9c81c4c6fbf931669abf14bb19,8e19a67a1ae3b88f93b6c2d0e4c861c7,a4f7f4b3c3aaa2c4a28a4f9fc0d813a1,b396d1fc4c58ebeaf31c106290ae5cee,bcc65b2e28c6961542c9ec3723d8eed0,cf5dcbae87f58f73dad6c1bfbd73256a,d7db417821a9ecdbb04ad34de78b0244,dbec7ffa34212bcbbf7129724563c4f8,e2a5e39382c16958dda0da6127375f20,e39fb7abe3971a7b1e2ec226eb9a1e1f,f131e67e4b2ea2d98c5968dd6c57cda5</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;URSS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The URSS is a publishing house responsible for publishing "K Novoi Redaktsii Voennoi Doktriny".  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">1422855893cd2f75b13c9945dc9b4499,2eec4248a3431cdb2dccff5f1d3bac61</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;VIKTOR LITOVKIN&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Viktor Litovkin is a person and an author who wrote articles for NVO. He is also mentioned as a source of information. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">1422855893cd2f75b13c9945dc9b4499,2eec4248a3431cdb2dccff5f1d3bac61</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;NVO&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">NVO is an organization, likely a news outlet or publication, where Viktor Litovkin works.  It is also the publication where Viktor Litovkin published his articles. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">1422855893cd2f75b13c9945dc9b4499,2eec4248a3431cdb2dccff5f1d3bac61</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;ANDREI KOKOSHIN&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Andrei Kokoshin is a prominent Russian defense intellectual known for his critiques of Russian military theory.  A former high-ranking civilian official in the Ministry of Defense and former head of the Security Council, Kokoshin advocated for non-nuclear deterrence strategies. He is recognized as a leading figure who popularized the term "asymmetrical approach" within Russian military discourse. \n\nKokoshin\'s work, including his book "Asimetrichnyi otvet na SOI," focuses on highlighting the shortcomings of traditional Russian military theory in addressing strategic gestures.  He argues that Russian military theory requires greater elaboration on this crucial aspect of modern warfare. His insights have been widely cited and discussed, notably in Viktor Litovkin\'s articles and works. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">0f97ca1859706e3c7adde28565dbdfc9,1422855893cd2f75b13c9945dc9b4499,1838769a055e042d335b716b927ac517,2eec4248a3431cdb2dccff5f1d3bac61,32552e34b76feed065cdc69c8ac456eb,4c204df8ad672f0ac08e5f67507eaf18,9e035904f808f85d23d4e5ec8791c76d,eaf0d08dbd97c1a7311aa7c886044509</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;IGOR\' VARFOLOMEEV&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Igor\' Varfolomeev is an author known for writing articles for KZ. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">1422855893cd2f75b13c9945dc9b4499,2eec4248a3431cdb2dccff5f1d3bac61</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;KZ&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"KZ" is a publication where Igor\' Varfolomeev published his articles. It is also mentioned as a potential news outlet or publication serving as a source for information.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">1422855893cd2f75b13c9945dc9b4499,2eec4248a3431cdb2dccff5f1d3bac61</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;VIKTOR RUCHKIN&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Viktor Ruchkin is an author who wrote articles for KZ."</data>\n      <data key="d2">2eec4248a3431cdb2dccff5f1d3bac61</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;V.V. MATVICHIUK&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"V.V. Matvichiuk is an author who co-wrote a paper titled \'Sistema strategicheskogo sderzhivaniia\' with A.L. Khriapin."</data>\n      <data key="d2">049bb8a8d8e442cd08b522c3502de46b</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;A.L. KHRIAPIN&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">A.L. Khriapin is an author who co-wrote the paper "Sistema strategicheskogo sderzhivaniia" with V.V. Matvichiuk. The paper was published in VM.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">049bb8a8d8e442cd08b522c3502de46b,35a12b9e620c419b9d3709d8310e4e44</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;S.A. Gorbunov."</data>\n      <data key="d2">049bb8a8d8e442cd08b522c3502de46b</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;V.N. GORBUNOV&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"V.N. Gorbunov is an author who co-wrote a paper with S.A. Bogdanov."</data>\n      <data key="d2">049bb8a8d8e442cd08b522c3502de46b</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;SISTEMA STRATEGICHESKOGO SDERZHIVANIIA&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Sistema strategicheskogo sderzhivaniia\' is the title of a paper co-authored by V.V. Matvichiuk and A.L. Khriapin."</data>\n      <data key="d2">049bb8a8d8e442cd08b522c3502de46b</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;LENIN&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">## Lenin: A Revolutionary Redefining War\n\nLenin is a key figure in Marxist-Leninist theory, renowned for his contributions to shaping the Soviet understanding of war. He is cited as an authority on the militarization of social life under socialism and emphasized the connection between war and revolution.  Lenin viewed war as a necessary instrument for societal transformation and achieving socialism, arguing that imperialist wars are inevitable under capitalism. \n\nHe built upon the ideas of Marx and Engels, incorporating "violent" into the definition of war and defining it as the continuation of politics by violent means. This perspective, while influential, has been critiqued by scholars like Kirshin.  Lenin incorporated Clausewitz\'s ideas into Marxist theory, appreciating his use of dialectics and agreeing with his view that politics are superior to strategy. He also supported Svechin\'s similar stance on the primacy of politics over strategy. \n\nLenin\'s early writings serve as a foundational starting point for understanding Soviet military thought. His ideology emphasizes that peace is as much a continuation of politics as war, a notion further highlighted in The Soviet Military Encyclopedia.  His definition of war as an instrument of politics heavily influenced Soviet thought throughout history, even as the definition of war expanded to include non-military means. Lenin\'s writings on war became foundational for understanding warfare in both the Soviet Union and Russia. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">046f04af090c144a8bd1403c6c5879a4,11b09d5fddbfffd21c2a75e43b225a4a,137a23ec0a6c30f2d104480a42ca716b,13bea8189beda5cf3f185fddbe60600a,14442faf092eaecae58a72c1a981a33b,1b996f45c7b397759863385a53361eed,1cce175e6c7003db4a0791abde031a39,1d746c1fd3ea7d25a42568701611f772,2a4b75db8fdd23483fc6c4f097c7f56f,2be40bedc401aa74026067cbca67b681,2f7216242ac705ab8c989c77c74d477b,342381013c3f61db48a3a2b2bc77370c,38c01208da0359baa45c7640d7a2285c,3cd3649d4d82b16c6d105090d8081f6e,43cb0f2a8f89f287a9fa0308ed110a3f,4a45316e71cd0e0104c26095efef1a8b,51ed05a44ffcb6ce215b22d1c327ef23,51eee122c2ebcb8b0ffd820ac78cdc7b,62bc2728250038f93d0bc65c57c2385b,645ce27900f66a0b633be93f0e5d6399,6b7d21eb26a4ec94c42acbaaf3707f2e,82893599bbdf88d7635db30797b87987,897b3e3eedf4e832571846d6ff67fabe,9828b2e8c4e512e6982ce69d321d187b,a15ef9eda68738122db496f9962d6a9f,ad49a894ef8b75f1e79de5a63ec78b85,b161f86472b14d8aafd5240f60c4d0ea,b1b64ef207d42a2b81118c978ce1f222,b3aa1ac66a5e25e270fce196c19d325e,b8fd807f07f8a2af89aa236339a7bc45,bab940f0cf76af894b6edb440a57b5f8,beabdeed11a36088777fbee158b3a3f5,bfa15fcd5d4a19aa65f946d1af780d5f,c03cb503d15d806465177d74c09c8bbc,c4d14adb7bf6e96f2bcbd4de5958dcd8,cb8b8a24ee435442f42e5aa0feacb291,cc801e9b36ee6b6cbcb589ad5d6eb592,cca1605d479526e189239aac472c3e7e,d1330c3cbc7e7877db9ba902371af4d9,e54ed249cf4a821abfd0eec3959426c8,e90da29be1148d9844e3ed777db08bf6,f008ece3160552dbbd23842a0d13f1f7,fb8a4e3d89439bd18b6f6ecae81d6d7c,fb99597f638ca7706b382f31de64c0a7</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;TROTSKY&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">**TROTSKY** was a prominent Soviet military theorist and politician who significantly influenced early Soviet military thought. He held a deep admiration for Carl von Clausewitz, agreeing with his perspective on war as an extension of politics. Trotsky believed that the primary objective of war was to destroy the enemy\'s manpower through decisive blows, emphasizing the physically violent aspect of conflict.  \n\nHe is also recognized for his contributions to the concept of "not peace and not war," highlighting the interconnectedness of peace and war, a notion that influenced Messner\'s ideas on the blurring of lines between these two states. Trotsky saw violence as the defining characteristic of war, even in light of technological advancements, a view he shared with Lenin.  \n\nWhile emphasizing the importance of physical violence, Trotsky also recognized the artistic element inherent in military strategy, contrasting this with the scientific approach advocated by some theorists like Aleksandr Svechin, whom he acknowledged as influential. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">0b7f36c1efd528460ea8b64f4d00c6a9,1d746c1fd3ea7d25a42568701611f772,3215346816955c73a119fe8038088c8e,39b41cfcdca61ad353853416d904417f,43cb0f2a8f89f287a9fa0308ed110a3f,69ab3a134854d40cbd893d37335cd7a2,6e81ca9f9ef3229b5c0e79413b269e37,962347193b87926e833cb5e1de7ff4e2,9b9ff0b9cc19b0ace380f06dff0ce7bd,b1b64ef207d42a2b81118c978ce1f222,bfa15fcd5d4a19aa65f946d1af780d5f,c4d14adb7bf6e96f2bcbd4de5958dcd8,eedc4b402e5b2b94dc3ffc578b96791b</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;SVECHIN&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">SVECHIN is a seminal Soviet military theorist known for his emphasis on historical analysis in military theory.  His most notable work, *Strategiya* (Strategy), solidified his position as a leading figure in the field. Svechin believed that war is fundamentally a conflict characterized by violence and argued that it is waged on both armed and economic fronts. He stressed the crucial role of military history in understanding strategy, advocating for a deep understanding of past conflicts to inform present-day military planning. While recognizing the importance of strategy, Svechin ultimately placed politics above strategic considerations, believing them to be the driving force behind warfare. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">11b09d5fddbfffd21c2a75e43b225a4a,1d746c1fd3ea7d25a42568701611f772,2be40bedc401aa74026067cbca67b681,2e7d136c6f4eaf9ce15bbde35a5bda23,6bb6801ed3016e00efcce4b92ed4763d,bfa15fcd5d4a19aa65f946d1af780d5f,e76184cff7bad45cbad7c9b1d3777f30</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;ALEKSANDR SVECHIN&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Aleksandr Svechin was a leading Soviet military theorist known for his influential work, "Strategiya" (Strategy). He is widely recognized for his belief that politics hold supremacy over strategy in the realm of military affairs.  Svechin advocated for a scientifically developed approach to military thought, emphasizing the importance of political considerations in shaping strategic decisions. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">0b7f36c1efd528460ea8b64f4d00c6a9,2553587dc45018c99ef96b7e7bb2637d,3215346816955c73a119fe8038088c8e,6e81ca9f9ef3229b5c0e79413b269e37,d1330c3cbc7e7877db9ba902371af4d9,eedc4b402e5b2b94dc3ffc578b96791b</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;SOVIET&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Soviet refers to the former Union of Soviet Socialist Republics (USSR), highlighting its historical and geopolitical context.  The Soviet perspective on war and peace is presented, emphasizing their distinct understanding of these concepts as inherently political. The text also indicates that the Soviet Union held a deep understanding of Western military-technological innovations and had a different view on war compared to the 1993 doctrine. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">004c0e044652c7853c755fca938857f2,08b5b9a81f792e1a63e929dc06a81d50,1cce175e6c7003db4a0791abde031a39,3215346816955c73a119fe8038088c8e,5430e32b1beaf2a36fbde8a1b9b3074f,beabdeed11a36088777fbee158b3a3f5,c14363837da220e50f2cbf6793eb94d2,c224c7a93362b03f8db7d3e34d1bffc1,e8d8461aeecbc6801361ca4fa5c3e2e2</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;PUTIN&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">## Vladimir Putin: A Leader Focused on Security and Information Warfare\n\nVladimir Putin, the President of Russia, has been a key figure in shaping Russia\'s political landscape since assuming the office of presidency in 1999. He is deeply concerned about external threats to Russia\'s security and stability, viewing Western influence and "color revolutions" as significant dangers.  Putin believes that information warfare can be used to manipulate values, culture, and ultimately lead to political or economic crises. He has criticized foreign governments for using NGOs and democracy promotion as tools to destabilize post-Soviet states, arguing that these actions often exceed legal and constitutional boundaries.\n\nPutin\'s vision for Russia emphasizes a strong national defense, outlining his strategy in an article titled "Byt silnymi: Garantii natsionalnoy bezopasnosti dlya Rossii" (Being Strong: Guaranteeing National Security for Russia). He sees information technology as crucial to modern conflict, equating its importance to new military means.  \n\nPutin has been vocal about his disapproval of Western interventions, particularly the 2011 intervention in Libya, which he labeled a "crusade." He also expressed disagreement with former Prime Minister Dmitry Medvedev regarding this intervention. Putin has accused the US of interfering in Russia\'s domestic policies and criticized their role in events like the Orange Revolution.  \n\nWhile cautious about directly blaming Western governments for "color revolutions," Putin believes they are orchestrated by external forces, often using NGOs as proxies. He sees election monitors as a potential threat to Russian elections, believing they are used to disrupt the democratic process. \n\n\nPutin\'s leadership has faced criticism for its increasingly autocratic nature and his actions in Ukraine, including the annexation of Crimea and the ongoing invasion.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">02a6df0665914ec51da4921e5dd94d40,046b1edf8fbc5d1fbd1a79f8a887a374,0a20fca212149a5c275431feaaf62872,181231ad89fa361ed50977f8c31ba68e,19d9f093df260f1df1d036a42926a00d,1b2ff8a47843f9eaa296b8dbc90d9179,1c170b6b1c8851bba14e24b8af15b481,1dabe4b6c1c6784c25fb3e21c5e41d22,20d87cdf1f465c50311a5731b700eb92,21a07c1b9dcad76a185aa038ee84add1,29a46f13633e4ddfb2338626c0e0a4c8,2b383cf8d68e36bef55be0a53df63999,3060e5a3570413999878edce8065dc2b,34b0078e74299e6a200a4ef43f0bdc9c,3747b8d7981bef88cd93023a9282583b,3972337bda3ba01f49da971ec696ce50,3f1469dfb6c218c8c3c64069b7a2495c,41e4c3296d7d78d51200037f4bccd7ff,47cbbe56d55fbd552f238ecfef64e24b,4f7f4f6fe9d288255da50532faa25f53,5049e837c0dd71c0a6348a2bf0eb1d93,5140c89116bf2a284b9b14b06732515a,6868f009e28c0d98518a108a15141a47,68e7972f85fd6fc2109534ff86630800,74fc1d4777e569e70cae27ded8161c9c,7f0ec47ed2088572385dcc53d6704c97,80977716c22c59d3eca92f04f08f0a53,8178d352e32cb271d8f2c52c29bf60a3,85e5e3514a004553e41c0c93fc4c5f0a,90103cb4f23e3f665cb8e7a0b7cc6bf1,947a8459acffd10caa21cb928f64a02c,9a2dcbe9b0d27f8917dd3fe660260425,9efadc7c0ff965fcd39d3ba70a376642,b3066af57efb89b0569dbadaba8b79bc,b50799a7304451430d84c0212b504cf4,ba4314d7dde31a9a3de140b03d964db0,c3a70df47396b839b38318aa06ce1cab,c8abe64a0759c36ce7cef99c1d6d8e62,cdb1d6abbb222058b92413663953ef84,d47f2d497de875578bdabc88b41d9d6d,dccb84a71d03372398587d309d2898aa,e0d765d0aa64f3c5fa134e12f9523747,f1524ed26c5d48cf8a616bb767a51ee4,f3489109e196578634fad718c775549e,f377212178ff5952443726ce112faac6,f9e4382c52fba95f15cc189f5e210b03,fd24a983ae975cadc842ce8fa5eea97c</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;VIKTOR YUSHCHENKO&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Viktor Yushchenko was elected president of Ukraine in 2004 after a rerun of the second round of voting. He served as president during the Orange Revolution, a period marked by pro-democracy protests and political upheaval.  While Yushchenko himself was not directly involved with Russian opposition groups, Putin claimed that some members of the Russian opposition had advised him during this time. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">046b1edf8fbc5d1fbd1a79f8a887a374,2b383cf8d68e36bef55be0a53df63999,85e5e3514a004553e41c0c93fc4c5f0a,931a3799d962bbcfc294a670caa94cdc,c8abe64a0759c36ce7cef99c1d6d8e62</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;HILLARY CLINTON&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Hillary Clinton, who served as the US Secretary of State at the time, was accused by Vladimir Putin of signaling to Russian opposition protesters.  Putin alleged that Clinton\'s actions conveyed a message of support to the demonstrators. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">2b383cf8d68e36bef55be0a53df63999,85e5e3514a004553e41c0c93fc4c5f0a,c8abe64a0759c36ce7cef99c1d6d8e62</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;BORIS NEMTSOV&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Boris Nemtsov was a Russian opposition leader who participated in the Orange Revolution."</data>\n      <data key="d2">2b383cf8d68e36bef55be0a53df63999</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;ILYA YASHIN&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Ilya Yashin was a Russian opposition leader who participated in the Orange Revolution and became the leader of Oborona."</data>\n      <data key="d2">2b383cf8d68e36bef55be0a53df63999</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;ORANGE REVOLUTION&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The **Orange Revolution** was a significant pro-democracy movement in Ukraine that took place in 2004, leading to a change in government.  It is considered a historical event that has influenced the passing of new laws and is often referenced as a potential model for color revolutions, both admired and feared by various parties. While some view it as a positive example of popular resistance and Western influence, others, such as Markov, present it as a negative example of foreign interference intended to subordinate Ukraine.  The Orange Revolution\'s impact extends beyond Ukrainian borders, with its experiences and techniques being shared with Russian youth organizations and even being connected by Putin to the Russian protests. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">046b1edf8fbc5d1fbd1a79f8a887a374,1dabe4b6c1c6784c25fb3e21c5e41d22,1eef68cba1ae051b37f22f0f0ca7f0db,2b383cf8d68e36bef55be0a53df63999,3ecc874d513039a384221cb07d625267,7c2ddfba3167a0d0ec8a949e6ee0bae4,84d20e611e44736afcc090a5dc3209ef,931a3799d962bbcfc294a670caa94cdc,97d19d636709e4074673576a37260b94,c8abe64a0759c36ce7cef99c1d6d8e62,ddeb1ebdd49c6838e2b7396a635666f9,fbc7a2df818769e5a910c5bb3976be37</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;RUSSIAN PROTESTS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"The Russian protests were demonstrations against Putin\'s government, which Putin claimed were instigated by the US."</data>\n      <data key="d2">2b383cf8d68e36bef55be0a53df63999</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;US&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The **United States (US)** is portrayed as a dominant force in global affairs, often contrasted with Russia. The US is a member of the West and actively participates in sanctions against Russia.  \n\nRussian sources accuse the US of militarizing the informational domain, provoking the removal of Ukraine\'s legitimate president, engaging in "political engineering" and interfering in Russian elections, organizing a "color revolution" in Ukraine, and using hybrid warfare tactics to threaten Russia. They also claim the US lags behind Russia in developing escalation management concepts and focuses primarily on warfighting capabilities. \n\nThe US is identified as a key player in potential conflicts with Russia, particularly regarding target selection, and its methods of warfare are used as examples in discussions about the changing character of war and the debate on new generation warfare (NGW).  \n\nFurthermore, the US is mentioned as a potential participant in nuclear conflicts, whose interests might be unclear in certain situations. Russian sources also suggest the US could be an external influence in Russia\'s social unrest. \n\nDespite these accusations, the US is also presented as a country that should pay attention to Russia\'s military ideas and as a key actor promoting democracy globally.  The US was involved in an election interference event in 2016 which drew attention to Russian military thought.\n\n\nIt\'s important to note that these descriptions come from a single source, and may not represent a balanced or complete picture of the US\'s role in international relations. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">0b053af0a82e321c5ad32e0e5014114d,0d30b8ab46b9f341eae428a79714b86c,21a07c1b9dcad76a185aa038ee84add1,26123c88ed4eb5080379f3088a3359d6,2b383cf8d68e36bef55be0a53df63999,30032f8bc461471f2472db1803deb493,3858893d4e6c348056e49fd3ae011704,5c2f2ed6b167d0c17fcd87e51d62ab85,5e6fb3a3adc710bacf237b23b8de5cdb,5eea4913c132500b62e2f7d79380593e,69da29b34db5c9f27d5af9de34c7a138,7cc72471bf4edd02ae4d6b43dd505467,7f29c6f20448813b7813c49b4dc2cc0c,806203f9ac3bb5daf5713237ac7d114e,882b4c6f36a621d123f340e538aff0c0,988815ea3f96b42cbe7dc83869db7588,a43f5e6fd71202a7ed7c45243f550e1e,b45be955e924377403f02def4244bbcf,b97617707d0f13c32b85f07ae1407b77,c03a3c2ac32840f0834fab9a991c0251,cb50fafd31d07b9e8f9e52f658937913,dd68126420b24cd563d457fdb5356a33,e35da413f411f97254dceda35d51b8bd,ed5d6fd72ab9c8ddfc773830620174ab,ee04ae10c40b706b74a05b7fffa01876,f1524ed26c5d48cf8a616bb767a51ee4,f3100a3b7eda755b429622097891e3a0,f377212178ff5952443726ce112faac6</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;RUSSIAN YOUTH ORGANIZATIONS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Russian youth organizations participated in protests and gained experience and techniques from the Orange Revolution.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">84d20e611e44736afcc090a5dc3209ef,97d19d636709e4074673576a37260b94</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;UNITED STATES&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"GEO"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The **UNITED STATES** is a Western country and a major player in international relations. It is identified as a participant in conflicts, such as the Kosovo War, where it deployed troops and shifted from fourth-generation warfare tactics to a more traditional approach. The U.S. is also accused by Russia of providing support to Ukraine that led to war and of supporting the overthrow of the Ukrainian government and inciting conflict.  \n\nPresident Putin criticizes the United States for its support of democracy movements, its use of force in international relations, and what he perceives as double standards in promoting democracy. The U.S. is also accused by Russia of waging a hybrid war against other countries and interfering in Russian elections. \n\nThe U.S. has been involved in supporting regime change through color revolutions, such as the Orange Revolution, and is mentioned as a potential instigator of the Arab Spring. It is also accused of engaging in information warfare, non-contact warfare, and psychological offensives.  \n\nFurthermore, the U.S. is described as a country capable of inflicting significant economic damage on adversaries and a potential target of Russian military strategy. The U.S. has funded Russian youth organizations and is mentioned as a potential actor influencing events in Russia. It is also presented as a nation that exerted pressure on the OSCE to monitor Russian elections and is one of the actors imposing sanctions on Russia.  \n\nThe U.S. is recognized as a recipient of communication from the Russian state and is mentioned as a geographical entity where this book is written. The U.S. has diplomatic relations with Russia, including a period known as the "reset." \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">02a6df0665914ec51da4921e5dd94d40,046b1edf8fbc5d1fbd1a79f8a887a374,04b87a5b565ec557540bb2b0bf38763f,0afa143d52dacb7c41e7fa780362e6f4,1eef68cba1ae051b37f22f0f0ca7f0db,1fdbdba8c71554268a8e4cacad9c056a,2528b45270d95680a57bc9094766201c,31c36375a76ddae90fef30da9e17ed10,398eeca696092e2043e85b335804a06b,3d2c478ea1bd96c710021bcff36cbddb,3ecc874d513039a384221cb07d625267,4825db8d9e31e39efc9a58ed4d38e842,4b4ca426d52b18a71e7dffc4e2b585a1,6cd14cb301caba80aed605f5aad6fc2e,78e0d14c1d381cdf093e4f7873c77b1c,84ac1ed20f03c3394c67671cb479f7db,84d20e611e44736afcc090a5dc3209ef,90103cb4f23e3f665cb8e7a0b7cc6bf1,97d19d636709e4074673576a37260b94,9efadc7c0ff965fcd39d3ba70a376642,a3793e3636208105dfe212679c69fe6c,abc257dcd1028c05d93bbb27d136e4f3,b6478283fa7c46af4ca180dfbfe4fb8b,b7d2323e75cae9a4221b0eb05c65b171,c1fde4292cf13cc0042a258ed0932fb6,c2736d15fad21b52584eeabefdf7f2da,c3a70df47396b839b38318aa06ce1cab,c8300f4f7d5b7c124ffba537f3e9d2f8,cd472d2664acb377dd498e88b7ed8d58,cfae2a9660e62a12a25d2678a2931f34,d42b29aa1834c31d91de6f4e73a98edd,e0bc114dfaebe00d71bbcf19b4d41f1d,e422579fa9c3017302c510d218e0fc09,f35ced22e0b916ab11822dd7acc16502</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;EUROPEAN STATES&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"GEO"</data>\n      <data key="d1">European states have been involved in both supporting and potentially influencing political movements and organizations within Russia.  They provided funding to support the Orange Revolution, a pro-democracy movement in Ukraine. However, there are also reports that European states funded Russian youth organizations, which could indicate an attempt to influence domestic politics within Russia. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">84d20e611e44736afcc090a5dc3209ef,97d19d636709e4074673576a37260b94</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;NATIONAL ENDOWMENT FOR DEMOCRACY (NED)&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The NATIONAL ENDOWMENT FOR DEMOCRACY (NED) is a pro-democracy organization primarily funded by Congress.  It has been involved in supporting various democratic movements, including the Orange Revolution in Ukraine and Russian youth organizations. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">84d20e611e44736afcc090a5dc3209ef,97d19d636709e4074673576a37260b94</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;NATIONAL DEMOCRATIC INSTITUTE (NDI)&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The NATIONAL DEMOCRATIC INSTITUTE (NDI) is a pro-democracy organization primarily associated with the Democratic Party.  It has been involved in supporting democratic movements, including the Orange Revolution, and has also provided support to youth organizations in Russia. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">84d20e611e44736afcc090a5dc3209ef,97d19d636709e4074673576a37260b94</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;INTERNATIONAL REPUBLICAN INSTITUTE (IRI)&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The INTERNATIONAL REPUBLICAN INSTITUTE (IRI) is a pro-democracy organization primarily associated with the Republican Party.  It has been involved in supporting democratic movements, including the Orange Revolution, and has also provided support to youth organizations in Russia. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">84d20e611e44736afcc090a5dc3209ef,97d19d636709e4074673576a37260b94</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;KHRUSHCHEV&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Khrushchev was a historical figure and Soviet leader who is widely recognized for his advocacy of peaceful coexistence between different political systems. He argued that wars were not inevitable after the advent of nuclear weapons, believing that coexistence represented a continuation of the struggle between two social systems but through peaceful means.  \n\nThis view on war as avoidable was maintained by Khrushchev himself and was also reflected in the Soviet Military Encyclopedia. Despite advocating for peace, Khrushchev recognized the importance of military strength, stating that nuclear weapons were the primary armament of the Soviet armed forces. He is considered a key figure in discussions about both armed struggle and the transition to socialism.  Khrushchev\'s ideas on peaceful coexistence gained prominence in 1959 and continue to be studied and debated today. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">046f04af090c144a8bd1403c6c5879a4,119a757f57ecf77109dc530e4339a65a,2090f56414eebaeb642f4296f8762613,29f93a094c1a402300a4534f45b1e2a2,416064aa4bb13a27367fc86744672bdf,4596b3ba180d2dc0cfa66745038b5cee,4d3bd4beec226501211dcd3560fd6fba,5fc5a6b5aebd3d100c1491fc135bc6da,6bf1c34951771fcd9f2560d72d1dec62,91056b62e7f13dbe730a526d696cbf28,942df564c917634c14e664feb79e1d02,ce0f551566143f746d8ff46f4a021065,d62c24f2a958cdd90af90b2fee315132</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;NATO&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">NATO (North Atlantic Treaty Organization) is a political and military alliance of North American and European countries formed during the Cold War to counter the Soviet Union.  It defines and addresses hybrid warfare threats, having adopted this concept to understand contemporary Russian warfare tactics. NATO employs a flexible response strategy involving both conventional and nuclear means. \n\nNATO\'s expansion has been perceived as a threat by Russia, leading to increased tensions between the two entities. The alliance is viewed by Russia as a major challenge in its military doctrine and a potential adversary in future conflicts.  Russia has also identified NATO as a potential target for asymmetrical warfare and surprise reactions. \n\nDespite these tensions, NATO views Russia as a new threat and has received communication from the Russian state.  NATO\'s actions, including participation in the US operation in Afghanistan and its adoption of a new deployment concept in 1999 allowing operations outside its area of influence, are seen by some analysts as contributing to the discussion on New Generation Warfare (NGW). \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">0b053af0a82e321c5ad32e0e5014114d,0d30b8ab46b9f341eae428a79714b86c,1d1f8fd7a97b7aca3ba71380fbbaa90c,2090f56414eebaeb642f4296f8762613,2a9ea3821d8338184917053353e5d977,3304c86daf67046c27cb5947f9a9483d,3cea7335e7b74d7398ebe782234fd833,3f1469dfb6c218c8c3c64069b7a2495c,4825db8d9e31e39efc9a58ed4d38e842,48992c1ff17a8a786ad467a773402407,606328f81d69fee27f0d5b308252d4db,730c4f20ab1db06c8867021b10267a04,7357dc206ba88482f202ea79850252f2,84b65c4d676043766aeebfc93b776ae6,882b4c6f36a621d123f340e538aff0c0,9748ee1545e37e649955834c94e84e4c,a2023cafb796baf9facb3660049c9663,a3793e3636208105dfe212679c69fe6c,b14b8167f871a2a2122ee05c9d77be10,b3db7caea69de418d71078fbb5676d15,b5fb1a4994ee06089911bc7a4b2bd7c8,b6c3e0690d7a726e219124a91c516e65,c8300f4f7d5b7c124ffba537f3e9d2f8,df2540cf569ce35f7b90708e5da0b01d,e2a5e39382c16958dda0da6127375f20,e39fb7abe3971a7b1e2ec226eb9a1e1f,ee04ae10c40b706b74a05b7fffa01876,f1861d38ef28e9efef8df52eaedaaf94,f3286050de3ac7fdc74f33ed1403c501,fcf6292acd4060dcb8b6f555eeebabe3</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;CUBAN MISSILE CRISIS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"The Cuban Missile Crisis was a major confrontation between the US and the Soviet Union, leading to a shift in NATO\'s strategic concept."</data>\n      <data key="d2">2090f56414eebaeb642f4296f8762613</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;FLEXIBLE RESPONSE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0" />\n      <data key="d1" />\n      <data key="d2">2090f56414eebaeb642f4296f8762613</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;NATO\'S STRATEGIC CONCEPT&quot;">\n      <data key="d0" />\n      <data key="d1" />\n      <data key="d2">2090f56414eebaeb642f4296f8762613</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;SOVIET MILITARY DOCTRINE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Soviet military doctrine initially believed in inevitable nuclear war as the main form of combat in a world war."</data>\n      <data key="d2">b5fb1a4994ee06089911bc7a4b2bd7c8</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;MARKSIZM-LENINIZM O VOINE I ARMII&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"**Marksizm-Leninizm o voine i armii**" is a book that serves as a key source for understanding Soviet ideology on war.  While it dismisses the possibility of economic, diplomatic, and other forms of struggle as part of war, it also acknowledges the potential for non-nuclear combat strategies following NATO\'s strategic shift. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">3d90ffe5fbb2fe4d1036ef242b8830be,65495eb1bdee1fa1abc9d070c27380fa,b5fb1a4994ee06089911bc7a4b2bd7c8</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;1997 VERSION&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"The 1997 version of the Military Doctrine is mentioned as a predecessor to the 2000 version."</data>\n      <data key="d2">38a5a22d04aa221997f0aa343f0a29ac</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;2000 VERSION&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"The 2000 version of the Military Doctrine is the focus of the text, highlighting its changes and perspectives."</data>\n      <data key="d2">38a5a22d04aa221997f0aa343f0a29ac</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;2000 MILITARY DOCTRINE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The **2000 Military Doctrine** is a document that outlines military strategy and views on war and military operations.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">30ff2b3a1ac3fddc8b200986ef1f24f4,a9f11317bfb1cbac1d72052738a6bfd0</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;1993 DOCTRINE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The **1993 Doctrine** was a previous military doctrine that provided context for the 2000 version.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">30ff2b3a1ac3fddc8b200986ef1f24f4,a9f11317bfb1cbac1d72052738a6bfd0</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;RUSSIAN MILITARY TRADITION&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"The text describes the long-standing Russian military tradition of \'military cunningness\', emphasizing indirectness and exploiting weaknesses."</data>\n      <data key="d2">9e035904f808f85d23d4e5ec8791c76d</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;MILITARY CUNNINGNESS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Military cunningness is a key principle in Russian military tradition. It refers to a strategic approach that emphasizes indirectness, deception, and exploiting the weaknesses of opponents.  This concept involves using indirect tactics to mislead and outmaneuver enemies, ultimately aiming to achieve victory through clever strategy rather than brute force. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">689d2c1edd348f5fda63da0a6d1ef5b9,9e035904f808f85d23d4e5ec8791c76d</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;TSARIST TRADITION&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"The Tsarist tradition is mentioned as part of the historical context of \'military cunningness\'."</data>\n      <data key="d2">9e035904f808f85d23d4e5ec8791c76d</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;SOVIET TRADITION&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Soviet Tradition is referenced as a model for military doctrines, demonstrating its influence on the analyzed content.  It is also considered part of the historical context of "military cunningness". \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">9e035904f808f85d23d4e5ec8791c76d,d83d4c575c030dbe44fe08e6297fa82c</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;RUSSIAN TRADITION&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"The Russian tradition, both in its contemporary and historical forms, emphasizes \'military cunningness\' as a core element."</data>\n      <data key="d2">9e035904f808f85d23d4e5ec8791c76d</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;US STRATEGIC DEFENSE INITIATIVE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"The US Strategic Defense Initiative (SDI) prompted Soviet experts to explore asymmetrical countermeasures."</data>\n      <data key="d2">9e035904f808f85d23d4e5ec8791c76d</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;RUSSIAN MILITARY DOCTRINE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Russian Military Doctrine is a document that outlines Russia\'s approach to national security and military strategy.  First established in the 1990s, it has evolved to emphasize asymmetrical warfare and indirect approaches as key elements of its strategy. The 2014 iteration of the doctrine specifically acknowledges nonmilitary means as significant threats to Russia, reflecting a broader understanding of security challenges. While reaffirming Russia\'s first-use policy, the 2014 document lacked a codified procedure for damage assessment following the initial use of force.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">12fc5a689ffb68311335cf90182c0456,273d16ede7c2ef0b280a8c35ddd2ad71,62184cc3276096431c580f794a557f41,eaf0d08dbd97c1a7311aa7c886044509,fcf6292acd4060dcb8b6f555eeebabe3</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;MILITARY BRASS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Military brass refers to high-ranking military officers who participate in discussions about strategy and tactics."</data>\n      <data key="d2">12fc5a689ffb68311335cf90182c0456</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;POLITICAL LEADERSHIP&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Political leadership encompasses individuals who hold positions of power within governments and are responsible for making strategic decisions.  These leaders often face complex challenges, particularly when their state is involved in a crisis with a nuclear peer, requiring them to navigate intricate political and military considerations. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">12fc5a689ffb68311335cf90182c0456,19d9f093df260f1df1d036a42926a00d,1ada0fbd5cbd2b629b6d11e082bf88fc</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;INFORMATION WARFARE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">## Information Warfare: A Comprehensive Summary\n\n**Information Warfare** is a multifaceted concept widely recognized as a crucial element in modern warfare and security doctrines. It involves the strategic utilization of information and communication technologies (ICTs) to influence perceptions, decision-making, and ultimately achieve specific objectives. \n\nWhile primarily considered a non-military tactic, Information Warfare can be employed by both state and non-state actors to destabilize nations, sway public opinion, and gain a competitive advantage.  It encompasses a range of techniques, including propaganda, cyberattacks, deception, and manipulation, often blurring the lines between internal and external security threats.\n\nInformation Warfare is presented as a powerful tool, potentially as effective as nuclear weapons but with greater societal acceptance. It challenges traditional definitions of war by emphasizing the importance of information dominance in achieving strategic goals. \n\nThe concept has gained significant traction within Russian military strategy, where it is viewed as a key element in achieving victory and shaping the understanding of modern conflict.  Experts highlight its evolving nature, driven by advancements in technology, and emphasize the need to address its legal and ethical implications.\n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">0f6caa8f2e4b146cbd71b583add938f8,12575d1b6f02a59280ed0326b418f907,16a295a1b82cfcc452e208d5c3376783,17ec79bdb3de589c18eab04fab860d2c,1907c51ffd4a90ea75fb1ba62cee3e69,1b2ff8a47843f9eaa296b8dbc90d9179,225b0cff903c251046636fb4bfe2e8ff,2d96d25d0022a1193382ea88b904435a,2ed01d91a2d5804af478b65fbd4fff17,30e696da641c144eac33994ba0518ccf,3db1db2951506b532f7777cda28bb8b2,4640d14036dc3924713f8e3da33466d6,4b3b407bbe1ac2b90a3980545cb66a39,4f7f4f6fe9d288255da50532faa25f53,5599962db5be274ac157280f1faa4590,5e5d2822696305f7d2d1a58999f83655,5e6fb3a3adc710bacf237b23b8de5cdb,641dba1d5b7b52f8b0e286f427afecc3,677c7a0f4f60503badb0a4d899c21d74,6d223c86a361242683a4bd296d60b502,757d82782cf6930b803cbaa29e0f5a1a,8196d4fb9caac5c7ffd87f465eac8c12,833fcef2d336802f17cac21855d9386e,83d8321db4baeb9dd56aa1e91eb29a39,8beec46e554e40907188a8b4eadfb7f8,8cbc35e22aa8edad712072d4efe491f1,903acba04eef215a12972c10ee95560b,94ad18024a3545fd895f5193db1fd0c5,9976fb85179c1c48e3cfe309be6108c7,a1c7cc7a633d4eb0010929797ae264c5,a1d5b70180c35b1c12fa0a5a6e0f0a8a,ab85b02c7dac7ba1d7aedf091ca78d90,ba7d00a57435b3269ef53ee366988f5e,ee529e2d08063744d6a3cc51b8b4775b,ee8b623e9bc68c40d46e1f05a42fac54,f07be9fd08a9903ad5197e3c7a250ca0,f1ea10917ad6f50fda3a92586fe998dc,f9b181b3ff2171e547897575c5e4d562,fcf6292acd4060dcb8b6f555eeebabe3,fdc2c2b29672f18ffe9ae9fb2f1da756</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;MODERN CONDITIONS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Modern conditions are described as having radically transformed the nature of war."</data>\n      <data key="d2">a5ccc3b4de720472fb0ba6dbc764cdba</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;ARMED STRUGGLE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0" />\n      <data key="d1">**Armed Struggle** is defined as a form of conflict involving the use of military violence. It is characterized as organized armed conflict between states, nations, or social groups.  According to Gerasimov, it is a key feature of war, identified as both the primary content and the primary type of confrontation in wars. Armed struggle refers to a conflict involving the use of force, likely a war or rebellion. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">2836f2f0365794d9fae3abfa350f2311,342381013c3f61db48a3a2b2bc77370c,672950e46eaf1ef3e60e7be1bb7dfebb,a5ccc3b4de720472fb0ba6dbc764cdba,abe7dca7f715b3a56df70fa74b56aa30,b39e3b697d5d9ed3835d622486095c96,b477b517d309b8c0ead048c621cce8c7,e89037639c79dd9077a756282d6c2a7d,f6e01d03f8c01910c2d8de5e8dd3a40f</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;PRESIDENT OF THE RUSSIAN FEDERATION&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The **President of the Russian Federation** is a key figure in shaping and communicating Russia\'s national security strategy.  \n\nThey are cited as the source for various documents, including the 2009 National Security Strategy and a concept outlining national security threats published in 1997. The President is also responsible for issuing statements regarding common interests between Russia and other states, as well as outlining information warfare concepts and threats. They have been vocal about perceived political interference, support for Ukraine, and the increasing practice of regime change and conflict provocation.  Furthermore, the President is recognized as the leader who has articulated Russia\'s security strategy and provided insights into internal contradictions and foreign intelligence threats facing the nation. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">0e40df5d22db6584ec7e05b07c3d9b66,20e164d99233ce34ea8ce381d30b106c,2629bcda8b7f4f253acfd0d116bd739d,37ad1da7cb686f78c11e043f10ecc1e4,398eeca696092e2043e85b335804a06b,52788eb4a502bd9fae3098a9fead4ce8,6b631b800942b76a464afab8e48c63da,6c9995389575e775e4e9a11e3b34c924,9748ee1545e37e649955834c94e84e4c,98feec5ff3b77b05b471596a90b0968a,c2736d15fad21b52584eeabefdf7f2da,d1270b1668a34228056151a7c64babb1,d67b112a958502c163b1c99c7ba13f8f</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;VLADIMIR MIKRYUKOV&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Vladimir Mikryukov is a professor at the Academy of Military Science. He authored a study exploring the nature and content of war. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">071a706dfd6647edd4993031ec85beb9,2629bcda8b7f4f253acfd0d116bd739d,da02795f9d537326bfadcd006a8bcc92</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;2010&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">In 2010, Vladimir Mikryukov published a study on war. This study focused on the concept of hybrid warfare.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">071a706dfd6647edd4993031ec85beb9,f9cd1d8b7cbb13deeabb75de223a5c6c</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;RUSSIAN DETERRENCE THEORY&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">**RUSSIAN DETERRENCE THEORY** is analyzed and critiqued in an article that focuses on its history and evolution.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">b9de036d327b58b5254cfe8e9300f073,d31c15c78cfa583e309caa22b9f1df8a</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;WESTERN STRATEGIC THOUGHT&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Western strategic thought is a dominant force in traditional deterrence theory, contrasting with Russian deterrence theory by emphasizing distinct ideational contexts.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">b9de036d327b58b5254cfe8e9300f073,d31c15c78cfa583e309caa22b9f1df8a</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;CROSS-DOMAIN COERCION THEORY&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Cross-Domain Coercion Theory is a field of study that seeks to understand how coercion can be applied across different domains.  A recent article aims to advance this field by analyzing the Russian approach to cross-domain coercion. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">b9de036d327b58b5254cfe8e9300f073,d31c15c78cfa583e309caa22b9f1df8a</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;MOSCOW\'S APPROACH&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Moscow\'s approach to deterrence is highlighted as posing challenges for theory development, particularly in cross-domain coercion."</data>\n      <data key="d2">d31c15c78cfa583e309caa22b9f1df8a</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;RUSSIAN COERCION PARADIGM&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The **"RUSSIAN COERCION PARADIGM"** is a concept that reflects Russian strategic culture and involves using coercion as a means to achieve national interests. This distinct approach is heavily influenced by cultural factors.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">558207770cb5dccc0f915097041b60bc,db516a1ced78fde051a32a1c881c6b6b</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;RUSSIAN STRATEGIC CULTURE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">**RUSSIAN STRATEGIC CULTURE** is a term used to describe the set of beliefs, values, traditions, and practices that influence Russia\'s military thinking and approach to both military strategy and international relations. Understanding this "strategic culture" is crucial for comprehending Russia\'s actions, particularly its use of coercion in global affairs. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">558207770cb5dccc0f915097041b60bc,689d2c1edd348f5fda63da0a6d1ef5b9,db516a1ced78fde051a32a1c881c6b6b</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;PAVEL GRECHKO&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Pavel Grechko was the Minister of Defense and nominally edited The Soviet Military Encyclopedia."</data>\n      <data key="d2">13bea8189beda5cf3f185fddbe60600a</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;NIKOLAI OGARKOV&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Nikolai Ogarkov was the Chief of Staff and co-edited The Soviet Military Encyclopedia with Pavel Grechko."</data>\n      <data key="d2">13bea8189beda5cf3f185fddbe60600a</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;THE SOVIET MILITARY ENCYCLOPEDIA&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"THE SOVIET MILITARY ENCYCLOPEDIA" is a publication nominally edited by Pavel Grechko and Nikolai Ogarkov. It outlines the Soviet view on war and its nature, serving as a source that provides the Soviet perspective on warfare.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">13bea8189beda5cf3f185fddbe60600a,29f93a094c1a402300a4534f45b1e2a2,ce0f551566143f746d8ff46f4a021065</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;OGARKOV&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Ogarkov is a military expert known for his contributions to military encyclopedias. In 1993, he published work exploring the role of armed forces in warfare.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">9828b2e8c4e512e6982ce69d321d187b,c03cb503d15d806465177d74c09c8bbc</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;GRECHKO&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Grechko is mentioned as a co-author of a military encyclopedia."</data>\n      <data key="d2">9828b2e8c4e512e6982ce69d321d187b</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;MILITARY ENCYCLOPEDIA&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">According to the **MILITARY ENCYCLOPEDIA**, war is defined as a military-political phenomenon resolved through violence. This definition was published in the encyclopedia\'s 1994 version, which serves as a reference work for understanding war and its various aspects. The MILITARY ENCYCLOPEDIA is cited as a source of information about war, providing definitions and insights into this complex subject.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">2a9ea3821d8338184917053353e5d977,60642b4264405ef39d55111c2feff3c4,9828b2e8c4e512e6982ce69d321d187b,def7760b684f6f3110fc8b387dcc9b09,f196fc7516d60a5e95b2a477d1f0b3f7</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;SECOND CHECHEN WAR&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The Second Chechen War was a conflict that Russia survived, facing international criticism for its conduct.  Following perceived losses in the First Chechen War, Russia implemented strategies during the Second Chechen War such as restricting broadcasting and utilizing loyal journalists to control the narrative surrounding the conflict. The war is often cited as a historical event that Russia endured and navigated despite external scrutiny. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">2bc9d3ed7ef2f3bc4a23a0492e44352b,46a8120d658a422a13cbf4af4bac874c,52788eb4a502bd9fae3098a9fead4ce8,651d70f1b96f83fb3e8a870528879b0f,d1270b1668a34228056151a7c64babb1</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;STRATEGY&quot;">\n      <data key="d0" />\n      <data key="d1">"STRATEGY" can refer to two distinct concepts. \n\nFirstly, it can describe **a strategy document** that outlines Russia\'s approach to various issues. This document serves as a guide for Russia\'s actions and policies on the international stage. \n\nSecondly, "STRATEGY" can also be the title of **a book written by Edward Luttwak**.  This book likely delves into strategic thinking and analysis, offering insights into military strategy, political maneuvering, and other aspects of achieving goals in a complex world. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">0e30f66c2fff8cbe583b5d61a229ae9f,52788eb4a502bd9fae3098a9fead4ce8,d1270b1668a34228056151a7c64babb1</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;2009&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"2009 refers to the year in which the statement about policies and threats was made."</data>\n      <data key="d2">37ad1da7cb686f78c11e043f10ecc1e4</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;SECURITY SERVICES&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Security services are mentioned as a threat to state security."</data>\n      <data key="d2">37ad1da7cb686f78c11e043f10ecc1e4</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;BARTOSH&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Bartosh is an expert who analyzes and describes color revolutions as part of armed struggle and hybrid warfare."</data>\n      <data key="d2">6e050b4fa47547d59d934e304f199d4a</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;EUROMAIDAN&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">EuroMaidan was a pro-European protest movement in Ukraine that began in late 2013.  It is considered a significant example of a "color revolution," a term often used to describe political upheavals attributed to Western influence.  This view, however, is contested, with some, like Putin, seeing EuroMaidan as a "controlled color revolution." \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">21a07c1b9dcad76a185aa038ee84add1,6e050b4fa47547d59d934e304f199d4a,a409f2a7387dfcf28254ec97943e7eaf,f5693f51d4c418b01643d1524837e46b</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;KORYBKO&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Korybko is an author and analyst who specializes in hybrid warfare, unconventional warfare, and color revolutions. He is recognized as an expert on these topics, providing insights, recommendations, and analyses. Korybko proposes a new theory of warfare that encompasses both nonviolent and violent overthrow methods.  He believes color revolutions are a form of indirect warfare and sees a common framework connecting them from the "Bulldozer Revolution" in Serbia to events like the Arab Spring and EuroMaidan. His work delves into information campaigns, reflexive control, and the strategies employed in regime change. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">22b661e49114bda37400701e79292197,4a396711762b9d23dfa301a027d2737e,4b92e85ab4c7750d8abad2a94187df42,576201edef6effef1d8b0f7f8ab4fa70,6b82eafaf18f777bfa19dd36a0a5c327,6e050b4fa47547d59d934e304f199d4a,788b86755c01b24e39ed41a0dd120038,8c2f6d76df8b90387042bddf4655bca3,9740ecb753f750df5d967fa22f4b16c0,a66026abef50d4b6b00ca0f933f6be0f,b45be955e924377403f02def4244bbcf</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;ANDREW KORYBKO&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Andrew Korybko is a theorist who specializes in the concept of hybrid war. He argues that color revolutions and unconventional warfare represent a new type of warfare, which he analyzes and provides insights into.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">2d96d25d0022a1193382ea88b904435a,a409f2a7387dfcf28254ec97943e7eaf</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;COLOR REVOLUTION&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">A Color Revolution is a type of political upheaval characterized by popular protests and often leading to regime change. It is a nonviolent method of achieving this goal, also known as a soft coup. These revolutions are orchestrated through information campaigns and public dissent, utilizing specific infrastructure, strategies, and goals. Some describe it as a non-military approach used by Western countries to achieve their political ambitions. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">0130a2e44046b07aa1a2eac85562f8aa,576201edef6effef1d8b0f7f8ab4fa70,788b86755c01b24e39ed41a0dd120038,7bd9c23eac62c28747da3ef1d093f293,8c2f6d76df8b90387042bddf4655bca3,a409f2a7387dfcf28254ec97943e7eaf</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;STRATEGIYA (STRATEGY)&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"BOOK"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Strategiya (Strategy) is a seminal book by Aleksandr Svechin."</data>\n      <data key="d2">0b7f36c1efd528460ea8b64f4d00c6a9</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;STATES&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">**STATES** are key actors in international conflicts, often engaging in war with other states or groups.  The concept of "information wars" further highlights their involvement, as multiple states collaborate in developing these strategies, indicating a significant geopolitical dimension to their actions. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">5544a73c36bca1539aa5ea6ad7f5e013,6c9995389575e775e4e9a11e3b34c924,8258163684c3a3818b26452a49f704d7</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;INFORMATION WARS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Information Wars" refers to the concept of utilizing information as a weapon to exert influence on other countries and disrupt their systems. This involves dangerous actions such as manipulating information spheres, disrupting established systems, and gaining unauthorized access to sensitive data.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">6c9995389575e775e4e9a11e3b34c924,98feec5ff3b77b05b471596a90b0968a</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;COUNTRIES&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"GEO"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Countries are mentioned as potential targets of \'information wars\', highlighting the international scope of the issue."</data>\n      <data key="d2">6c9995389575e775e4e9a11e3b34c924</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;CHARAP&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">CHARAP is an author who specializes in writing about war and its evolving nature.  They have published research on hybrid warfare and the Gerasimov doctrine, a concept that describes the use of unconventional tactics alongside traditional military force. CHARAP\'s work explores how modern warfare is changing and the implications of these shifts. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">597b96f29d47f44fa260f97ed43bcb31,74abf737631531a56e8f3e9456798f10,e5172fc8ab5577ed794a9225b1eb26f3,f3286050de3ac7fdc74f33ed1403c501</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;COLTON&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Colton is an author who has published research on hybrid warfare and the Gerasimov doctrine. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">e5172fc8ab5577ed794a9225b1eb26f3,f3286050de3ac7fdc74f33ed1403c501</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;WESTERLUND&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Westerlund is an author who has published research on hybrid warfare and the Gerasimov doctrine. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">e5172fc8ab5577ed794a9225b1eb26f3,f3286050de3ac7fdc74f33ed1403c501</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;NORBERG&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">NORBERG is an author who has published research on hybrid warfare and the Gerasimov doctrine. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">e5172fc8ab5577ed794a9225b1eb26f3,f3286050de3ac7fdc74f33ed1403c501</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;KOFMAN&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Kofman is an author who specializes in writing about war and its evolving nature. id="&quot;GALEOTTI&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">GALEOTTI is a military writer and analyst who specializes in the changing nature of warfare. He is an author who has written extensively about hybrid warfare, the Gerasimov doctrine, and Russian military strategy. Galeotti\'s work also addresses the contradictions within the Russian debate surrounding the term "political war."  He is potentially affiliated with an organization that publishes works on war and its evolution. Notably, while Galeotti coined the term "Gerasimov Doctrine," he later expressed regret over its widespread use. Additionally, he emphasizes the perceived cultural offensive from the West in his analyses. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">0fa028b232510c552f26de29d99b145b,497a16d8349c548069afaf4be6732760,4c6ec63e5dab5e8bb7cf12bc8d40f415,597b96f29d47f44fa260f97ed43bcb31,74abf737631531a56e8f3e9456798f10,c0ae1b35d101dd5c80796ebcaaa52998,e97880df6b33eecb3147aea6e798be7d,f3286050de3ac7fdc74f33ed1403c501</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;GILES&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Giles is a Western analyst who specializes in observing Russia\'s perspective on current events and information warfare. Giles suggests that Russia\'s understanding of war extends beyond armed violence, and his publications explore how war is changing. He published research on this topic in 2012 and continues to be recognized as an expert who analyzes Russian information warfare strategies and their impact on NATO. His insights into Russian military strategy and information warfare are highly valued.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">0e067e05f9650b52c2d5a35f0b338517,44e43dd2540c2ccc21e73b54d34affb7,4a613c1d2300f0daf7688d2a667bd6b2,597b96f29d47f44fa260f97ed43bcb31,61fe19114215de9edf4b2df2fb6f0fb0,74abf737631531a56e8f3e9456798f10,e2a5e39382c16958dda0da6127375f20,e39fb7abe3971a7b1e2ec226eb9a1e1f,f3286050de3ac7fdc74f33ed1403c501</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;RENZ&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">RENZ is an author who specializes in analyzing modern warfare and its evolving concepts. Bartles\' work delves into the Russian military\'s understanding of conflict, including their recognition of information means and NGOs as crucial nonmilitary tools in contemporary strategy. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">03141fcff229613c697eaeb333fc00ed,273d16ede7c2ef0b280a8c35ddd2ad71,3d9254865502f679af6fa7a0b77a6cbe,4b4ca426d52b18a71e7dffc4e2b585a1,597b96f29d47f44fa260f97ed43bcb31,74abf737631531a56e8f3e9456798f10,94523d994b1f98cfdb10589452955c12,e422579fa9c3017302c510d218e0fc09,f3286050de3ac7fdc74f33ed1403c501</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;KOFMAN AND ROJANSKY&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Kofman and Rojansky are authors who have written about hybrid warfare and the Gerasimov doctrine."</data>\n      <data key="d2">f3286050de3ac7fdc74f33ed1403c501</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;HYBRID WARFARE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0" />\n      <data key="d1">**Hybrid Warfare** is a military strategy that combines conventional and unconventional tactics.  \n\nIt encompasses a range of methods, including political, economic, informational, cyber, and traditional military action. The term "Hybrid Warfare" was popularized by Western experts to describe Russia\'s approach to conflict, which incorporates these diverse tools. While the concept has gained traction in the West, it has also entered Russian discourse, with figures like Gerasimov characterizing it as a modern form of warfare utilizing unconventional tactics.  \n\nThe strategy aims to achieve strategic objectives through a combination of overt and covert actions, blurring the lines between war and peace. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">0e067e05f9650b52c2d5a35f0b338517,39936b87b632c096c061641c0490c2af,3cea7335e7b74d7398ebe782234fd833,452741c3c9d866e070dc0fcef9650ce1,5bb2f411436cd9fd01cf7697e33fec75,6b408afcf04121f1365ead7989dc8265,803cf3c02920d14a7bb0447fc1c76140,92697f6a162cf0b8f900c0eb43d28c12,9a70b285557b0524306162d74f497e03,ac08e98f560a5dcdd378a622eca69f06,b11c3e5c041763bf480a5b17676c7ef3,c6f139f4eaa3828baab624dad7b83c88,d760565312fa739ff154c8ebd38fe95d,e5172fc8ab5577ed794a9225b1eb26f3,f3286050de3ac7fdc74f33ed1403c501</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;ROJANSKY&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Rojansky is an author who writes about the evolving nature of war.  Their works explore how warfare is changing over time. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">597b96f29d47f44fa260f97ed43bcb31,74abf737631531a56e8f3e9456798f10</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;RUSSIAN APPROACH&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The **RUSSIAN APPROACH** is a multifaceted strategy utilized by Russia to attain its strategic objectives. This approach encompasses a blend of military, clandestine, and special operations, as outlined in its doctrines and practices.  While it combines both "soft" and "hard" power elements, the text also highlights three key deficits within the Russian approach to warfare: an inability to effectively assess battlefield damage (both direct and indirect), a lack of capability to signal or act coercively without escalating situations, and a deficiency in strategic theory development. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">1c8fed726b2eb22fb2e268caa1aa9993,4e1b5455146da4530dbebcab63ccad40,536b48540ca934fd046a103198ab417e,54c29f07a55c22a9e00bc4e9dc3677da,689d2c1edd348f5fda63da0a6d1ef5b9</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;CULMINATING POINT&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"**CULMINATING POINT**" refers to a critical juncture in warfare where military force reaches its peak.  Strategists assess this situation as a potential turning point, considering it a limit to the effectiveness of their current strategy. This is often seen as a moment where ending conflict becomes a viable option. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">54c29f07a55c22a9e00bc4e9dc3677da,bcc65b2e28c6961542c9ec3723d8eed0</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;O.
