They specialize in analyzing Russia\'s \'strategic deterrence\' system, as evidenced by their work featured in Military Thought. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">d443a6cb4e5386264541f38044a8c249,f57761743fd7554cce9898a907d202b8</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;MILITARY THOUGHT&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PUBLICATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">**MILITARY THOUGHT** is a flagship publication of the General Staff (GS) in Russia. It serves as a forum for military professionals and intellectuals to discuss strategy, operational art, and force build-up.  The journal has been used by prominent figures like Yuri Baluyevsky to publish their views. Analysts from 27 TsNII, a Russian military research institute, regularly contribute to MILITARY THOUGHT, including articles on topics such as Russia\'s strategic deterrence system and informational struggle. The publication disproportionately covers both the "soft" and "hard" aspects of informational warfare, reflecting its importance in contemporary Russian military doctrine.  MILITARY THOUGHT represents the strategic ideas and doctrines held by the Russian nation. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">5eea4913c132500b62e2f7d79380593e,64eeb118488aef964197bf29f3a0adb4,8ce5f5bfef751b07721a9bdf7c956bba,cbad03251a174d87dc9c103d0a260763,d443a6cb4e5386264541f38044a8c249,f3100a3b7eda755b429622097891e3a0,f57761743fd7554cce9898a907d202b8</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;STRATEGIC DETERRENCE SYSTEM&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Russia\'s **STRATEGIC DETERRENCE SYSTEM** is a complex network of military capabilities designed to prevent conflict and ensure national security. This system serves as the foundation for Russia\'s military strategy, which aims to deter potential adversaries through its formidable arsenal and readiness.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">d443a6cb4e5386264541f38044a8c249,f57761743fd7554cce9898a907d202b8</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;MILITARY SCIENCE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">**MILITARY SCIENCE** is the study of war as a whole, encompassing armed struggle and the use of both direct and indirect violence. It involves understanding the principles, strategies, and tactics employed in warfare, as well as the historical, political, and social contexts surrounding conflict.  Military Science also encompasses the study and practice of warfare, covering both direct actions like combat operations and indirect actions such as intelligence gathering and psychological warfare. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">112509ae19803edd47655e5f2fc22ae1,7567750cec0624c2e9f362f989d8b1bc,abe7dca7f715b3a56df70fa74b56aa30</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;LONG-RANGE PRECISION This includes details on how to choose targets effectively. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">0c1b37708d3475212b1f7c0b196ebfa4,8a6bc654ca308f2716cc1b21c9c2a7a2</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;VITALLY IMPORTANT OBJECTS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"**Vitally Important Objects** are targets that cause significant economic and population losses when damaged.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">0c1b37708d3475212b1f7c0b196ebfa4,8a6bc654ca308f2716cc1b21c9c2a7a2</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;TARGETS OF SIGNIFICANT VALUE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Targets of Significant Value are military-economic targets that cause economic losses and disrupt command and control but with less loss of life."</data>\n      <data key="d2">8a6bc654ca308f2716cc1b21c9c2a7a2</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;&#1056;&#1054;&#1051;&#1044;&#1059;&#1043;&#1048;&#1053;&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Roldugin is an author who specializes in military strategy. He has written about choosing targets for critical objects of the enemy and contributed to a work on strategic deterrence.  He has also co-authored a work on choosing targets for military action. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">74a6b948abf6e4cbeffa17366e046b24,84dec9951e7f6a2e24693d831630a387,cecb14f6d735cc6920fdf727bfca305d,e776344e89fbb011cc110c0ef8e0e731</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;&#1050;&#1054;&#1051;&#1054;&#1044;&#1068;&#1050;&#1054;&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Kolodkko is an author who specializes in military strategy. Additionally, Kolodkko has co-authored a work on selecting targets for military action. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">74a6b948abf6e4cbeffa17366e046b24,84dec9951e7f6a2e24693d831630a387,cecb14f6d735cc6920fdf727bfca305d,e776344e89fbb011cc110c0ef8e0e731</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;GORBUNOV AND BOGDANOV&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Gorbunov and Bogdanov are authors who have made significant contributions to understanding the evolving nature of warfare. They are known for their theory about war, which emphasizes the increasing importance of information warfare and argues that conventional military operations will hold little significance in future conflicts.  \n\nTheir writings, including a study on 21st-century armed confrontation and the potential of non-nuclear weapons, highlight the growing influence of nonmilitary tactics in weakening states. Notably, their work from 2009 aligns with Putin\'s views on the crucial role of information technology in modern conflict, suggesting their ideas have influenced prominent political figures.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">37215a6c4810a7b385fb17417f94fbe0,4e2896fd5b6f31d006ca18e1a3299553,5497fc2e9ef0c53f1b17d4b901c85832,68e7972f85fd6fc2109534ff86630800,6c276ef5c88e4f06e651dfab52e4f31a,7aef3b8e0c0a9cd9f240dfbe12e02c38,d0795c516b3c5af83173ca70b07fb02d,d0ecd460d53c457bc525cf4f3ba940d2,ef55602335bea29d08150b6649fad897,fd24a983ae975cadc842ce8fa5eea97c</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;STUDY&quot;">\n      <data key="d0" />\n      <data key="d1">The STUDY is a research project that examines armed confrontations in the twenty-first century.  It focuses specifically on identifying novelties and trends within this field of conflict. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">5497fc2e9ef0c53f1b17d4b901c85832,d0795c516b3c5af83173ca70b07fb02d</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;21ST CENTURY&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"GEO"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"The 21st century is the period under study by Gorbunov and Bogdanov."</data>\n      <data key="d2">5497fc2e9ef0c53f1b17d4b901c85832</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;ARMED CONFRONTATION&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Armed confrontation is the subject of Gorbunov and Bogdanov\'s study."</data>\n      <data key="d2">5497fc2e9ef0c53f1b17d4b901c85832</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;FIRST CHECHEN WAR&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The First Chechen War, a conflict between Russia and the Chechen Republic, concluded in 1996 with a cease-fire. This outcome left Russia without control of its territory, significantly impacting its perception of terrorism as a threat. The war is recognized as a pivotal historical event that shaped Russia\'s military doctrine and domestic media landscape.  \n\nThe conflict highlighted the potential for domestic media to be involved in propaganda, both against the state (as alleged during the First Chechen War) and as a tool used by the state itself. Some argue that open media coverage during the war contributed to low morale within Russian forces, leading to a sense of defeat for Russia despite achieving a ceasefire.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">0bd7b3e4a1e43992b5b9213bdd92272d,20e164d99233ce34ea8ce381d30b106c,28cb703fdc157a4e1b984d6601e37170,3db1db2951506b532f7777cda28bb8b2,46a8120d658a422a13cbf4af4bac874c,5fe78f79b74aaf92a89687fd492be682,98d0fa6298be2a61d9cff2a2acb23924</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;CHECHEN SIDE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The **Chechen Side** refers to the group opposing Russia in the conflict.  Initially driven by nationalist separatism, their ideology shifted towards jihadism and terrorism following the First Chechen War. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">0bd7b3e4a1e43992b5b9213bdd92272d,20e164d99233ce34ea8ce381d30b106c</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;FOREIGN INTELLIGENCE SERVICES&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Foreign Intelligence Services are identified as a threat to Russia, engaging in agent and operational-technical penetration."</data>\n      <data key="d2">6b631b800942b76a464afab8e48c63da</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;ALEKSANDR KALISTRATOV&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Aleksandr Kalistratov is a professor at the Combined Arms Academy of the Armed Forces. He is known for offering an alternative definition of armed conflict and disagreeing with Serebryannikov\'s view on nonmilitary means.  Kalistratov was also a prominent Soviet military theorist who believed that there was broad agreement to treat armed conflict and war synonymously. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">489aeca592784f5f7be0a754beb4f575,57424d7973e0b0ad452fc6115605d61f,818993a678a84051e60563bfd33f106a,b90af97596777a0400f9c331a5d96a40</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;COMBINED ARMS ACADEMY OF THE ARMED FORCES&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The Combined Arms Academy of the Armed Forces is an educational institution for military personnel where military theory is taught.  Aleksandr Kalistratov works at the academy. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">489aeca592784f5f7be0a754beb4f575,57424d7973e0b0ad452fc6115605d61f,818993a678a84051e60563bfd33f106a</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;RUSSIAN THINKING&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"RUSSIAN THINKING" refers to the strategic thought and approaches employed by Russia. It encompasses the strategic and geopolitical ideas held by Russia, shaping its actions on a global scale.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">0f11f27d252b4419076b47cf4dfcb20d,cf70ea3dd32b83dd2249d0d0987956a7</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;MOSCOW\'S BEHAVIOR&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Moscow\'s Behavior" describes the actions and policies undertaken by the Russian government. These actions are often analyzed through the lens of strategic thinking, reflecting the influence of Russia\'s strategic vision on its governmental decisions.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">0f11f27d252b4419076b47cf4dfcb20d,cf70ea3dd32b83dd2249d0d0987956a7</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;RUSSIAN PARADIGM&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"RUSSIAN PARADIGM" represents a new framework for understanding Russian strategy, characterized by cross-domain coercion. This paradigm refers to a unique set of beliefs, values, and approaches to strategy held by Russia.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">8c89f749cd4aa8e422be2a970f803bec,cf70ea3dd32b83dd2249d0d0987956a7</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;DETERRENCE THEORY&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"A framework for understanding how states use threats and capabilities to prevent aggression from other actors."</data>\n      <data key="d2">cf70ea3dd32b83dd2249d0d0987956a7</data>\n <data key="d2">c243ab6f4e5afba61f79b9d15e7dc288</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;DIMA ADAMSKY&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Dima Adamsky is an analyst who    <data key="d2">83b0087e03908565fbbc54e5d4e331b1</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;REVOLUTION&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">**REVOLUTION** is a process of overthrowing existing power structures that results in significant societal upheaval. This upheaval often involves both political and social change, and is considered a crucial concept linking class struggle and war.  The interconnectedness of these elements can potentially accelerate the revolutionary process. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">6750bb4a2ab8af556c6cade73a275a95,83b0087e03908565fbbc54e5d4e331b1,8510ea40cef51fcde12bd266cbc4b6b2,9521960b1adb4fffde0f8bca2df87bcb</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;ALLIES&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">**ALLIES** can refer to two distinct concepts.  \n\nThe first definition describes **ALLIES** as a group of countries that share common interests with Russia, potentially including members of NATO. This suggests a geopolitical context where nations align themselves based on shared goals or strategic considerations. \n\nThe second definition defines **ALLIES** as individuals or organizations united in support of a common cause. This broader interpretation encompasses any collective effort driven by shared objectives, regardless of nationality or organizational affiliation.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">6750bb4a2ab8af556c6cade73a275a95,f3489109e196578634fad718c775549e</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;ENCYCLOPEDIA OF THE MINISTRY OF DEFENSE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"The Encyclopedia of the Ministry of Defense defined war as an extreme form of conflict resolution involving violence to achieve various goals."</data>\n      <data key="d2">287b17a01df64083a49c84828ae77591</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;ORGANIZATION FOR SECURITY AND CO-OPERATION IN EUROPE (OSCE)&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The Organization for Security and Co-operation in Europe (OSCE) is an international organization that monitors elections. Putin recently delivered a speech to the Federal Assembly. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">7f0ec47ed2088572385dcc53d6704c97,8178d352e32cb271d8f2c52c29bf60a3,c3a70df47396b839b38318aa06ce1cab</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;RUSSIAN FEDERAL ELECTION&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The **RUSSIAN FEDERAL ELECTION** is a significant event that has been mentioned in the context of increased financing of NGOs, particularly from Western sources.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">7f0ec47ed2088572385dcc53d6704c97,8178d352e32cb271d8f2c52c29bf60a3</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;1920S AND 1930S&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"TIME PERIOD"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"The 1920s and 1930s are identified as a crucial period for the foundation of Soviet military theory."</data>\n      <data key="d2">cb8b8a24ee435442f42e5aa0feacb291</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;RUSSIAN LANGUAGE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"LANGUAGE"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The **RUSSIAN LANGUAGE** is being discussed in the context of its influence on understanding concepts like "war". related to war. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">0f1d3d81d45833f3f53d14124bd0b77e,266688aac47e8134554bad1ee6e6ccba</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;KHARAAKTER VOINY&quot;">\n      <data Leadership within a state, specifically PERSONs holding positions of authority, are targeted by psychological subversion aimed at discrediting and undermining their legitimacy. This tactic is part of a broader strategy known as "The Russian Debate," which involves discussions and perspectives focused on conflict resolution. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">09f6e0bded329377afe9228d6cefd959,71021743a2347b0a7a926833266323b8,8d7872e0cf3cf0e3dce7c0d798b379ae,f5ebe1d6cef1bb82b2cb25260c0aea5a</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;WESTERN DEBATE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0" />\n      <data key="d1">**WESTERN DEBATE**\n\nWestern Debate encompasses discussions and analyses of war, particularly focusing on expanding the understanding of war beyond traditional notions of armed violence. These analyses often originate from Western countries and delve into Russian military thought.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">8196d4fb9caac5c7ffd87f465eac8c12,8c989fc0d3fc136d27a9f97d0fe40c82,8d7872e0cf3cf0e3dce7c0d798b379ae</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;SVYATOSLAV KOZLOV&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Kozlov is a military theorist who argues that war encompasses political, economic, ideological, and psychological means."</data>\n      <data key="d2">119a757f57ecf77109dc530e4339a65a</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;MIKHAIL SMIRNOV&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Smirnov is a military theorist who argues that war encompasses political, economic, ideological, and psychological means."</data>\n      <data key="d2">119a757f57ecf77109dc530e4339a65a</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;IVAN BAZ&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Baz is a military theorist who argues that war encompasses political, economic, ideological, and psychological means."</data>\n      <data key="d2">119a757f57ecf77109dc530e4339a65a</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;PYOTR SIDOROV&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Sidorov is a military theorist who argues that war encompasses political, economic, ideological, and psychological means."</data>\n      <data key="d2">119a757f57ecf77109dc530e4339a65a</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;PAVEL KAZARIN&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Pavel Kazarin is a Russian military theorist who argues for a broader definition of war. Kazarin distinguishes between the nature and character of war, explaining the difference in his work. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">1a860ae7b783d3a1eb78fb862dd64138,2999e2ab9620ec881fdf22361f3bb121,62bc2728250038f93d0bc65c57c2385b,70ffa305d793f894aff7641666c1ab03,cb292470c7cc7ca5b848504c1662c302,cfae2a9660e62a12a25d2678a2931f34</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;RUSSIAN MILITARY THEORIST&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ROLE"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"This role describes Pavel Kazarin\'s profession and area of expertise."</data>\n      <data key="d2">1a860ae7b783d3a1eb78fb862dd64138,cfae2a9660e62a12a25d2678a2931f34</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;LT. He is widely recognized as an authoritative figure in military theory, known for his work on warfare taxonomy which serves as the foundational framework for modern Russian military theorists.  His expertise in warfare extends to the concept of sixth-generation warfare. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">5cd9f4f78cb2dfdfcb512cc36ac0202f,85213ddae01bd7251e1f31b060d869f0,897b3e3eedf4e832571846d6ff67fabe</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;SIXTH GENERATION WARFARE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Sixth Generation Warfare refers to a new type of warfare characterized by long-range precision-guided missiles and minimal direct contact between soldiers. This shift, starting in the 1990s,  is marked by the use of precision weapons, information warfare tactics, and the strategic goal of crippling the enemy\'s economy.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">897b3e3eedf4e832571846d6ff67fabe,dcdc940fd2d0b50a2cd9e38ec0d2d76f,fb8a4e3d89439bd18b6f6ecae81d6d7c</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;MCIS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"MCIS is the venue where Gerasimov presented his views on \'soft power\' and color revolutions."</data>\n      <data key="d2">84b65c4d676043766aeebfc93b776ae6</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;GEN. MAKHMUT GAREYEV&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Gen. Makhmut Gareyev is a military figure who expressed concerns about information warfare and subversive actions as threats to internal stability."</data>\n      <data key="d2">2ced16684237fb065035dffff5afc8b4</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;OFER FRIDMAN&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Ofer Fridman is an expert on hybrid warfare who contributes to its understanding through his work. He argues that there are three distinct meanings of the term "hybrid warfare."  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">8118246d7d78d2f1bb03239a4d6597c7,92816f700222281e949f32015361b596</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;RUSSIAN HYBRID WARFARE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"BOOK"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"**Russian Hybrid Warfare**" is a concept and approach to warfare developed by Ofer Fridman, as explored in his book of the same name.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">8118246d7d78d2f1bb03239a4d6597c7,92816f700222281e949f32015361b596</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;MATTIS AND HOFFMAN&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Mattis and Hoffman are authors who first defined hybrid warfare as focusing on military problems."</data>\n      <data key="d2">8118246d7d78d2f1bb03239a4d6597c7</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;KENNAN&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Kennan is a figure mentioned by Fridman who conceptualized hybrid war as solely based on non-military means."</data>\n      <data key="d2">8118246d7d78d2f1bb03239a4d6597c7</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;WESTERN&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">**WESTERN** refers to a geopolitical bloc or cultural sphere whose military thought is analyzed in the text. This group of countries or entities is primarily focused on their analytical engagement with Russian military thought, and are generally aligned with Western values and perspectives. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">32d948fc460c6d1bb1d9682bfd136dd3,3db1db2951506b532f7777cda28bb8b2,d760565312fa739ff154c8ebd38fe95d</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;RUSSIAN ACADEMY OF MISSILE AND ARTILLERY SCIENCES&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"The Russian Academy of Missile and Artillery Sciences is an organization headed by Vasily Burenok."</data>\n      <data key="d2">3060e5a3570413999878edce8065dc2b</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;NORTH AFRICA&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"GEO"</data>\n      <data key="d1">North Africa is a region where information warfare tactics were employed.  These tactics were used to degrade states within the region. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">16a295a1b82cfcc452e208d5c3376783,5203622b4d84751d0ad97a36c65aa7cf</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;POLITICAL-MILITARY LEADERS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Political-military leaders are responsible for planning strategies for deterrence, warfighting, escalation management, and war termination in great power contests."</data>\n      <data key="d2">1ada0fbd5cbd2b629b6d11e082bf88fc</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;PLANNERS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Planners typically focus on warfighting operations in the context of great power contests."</data>\n      <data key="d2">1ada0fbd5cbd2b629b6d11e082bf88fc</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;STRATEGISTS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Strategists are individuals who develop plans and make decisions, particularly in military or political contexts.  They dedicate significant time to developing deterrence postures for specific contingencies. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">1ada0fbd5cbd2b629b6d11e082bf88fc,8c89f749cd4aa8e422be2a970f803bec</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;GREAT POWER INTERREGNUM&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The **GREAT POWER INTERREGNUM** is a period of relative peace and stability between major powers that has existed since World War II. This lack of focus on conflict management stems from the relative absence of large-scale conflicts between these powerful nations, contributing to a sense of security and reduced urgency in addressing potential international disputes.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">1ada0fbd5cbd2b629b6d11e082bf88fc,9ac9e1e3f7a69c768d48db77a9b7a3c8</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;POST-COLD WAR PERIOD&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The **POST-COLD WAR PERIOD** is defined as the era following the dissolution of the Soviet Union. This period witnessed a significant shift in global power dynamics.  However, it was also marked by a lack of focus on escalation management and war termination strategies. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">1ada0fbd5cbd2b629b6d11e082bf88fc,9ac9e1e3f7a69c768d48db77a9b7a3c8</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;BREZHNEV&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Brezhnev was a previous leader who implemented a policy of no first use of nuclear weapons."</data>\n      <data key="d2">00e7336d67609903b464740eecc2da73</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;NON-PROLIFERATION TREATY&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"The Non-Proliferation Treaty is a treaty mentioned in relation to nuclear weapon usage."</data>\n      <data key="d2">00e7336d67609903b464740eecc2da73</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;WESTERN ANALYSTS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Western analysts are mentioned as being influenced by Chekinov and Bogdanov\'s article."</data>\n      <data key="d2">3e6ab14e2f0c4f2a8a611ac169b8dc44</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;WAR IN UKRAINE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"The War in Ukraine is referenced as a significant event that followed the publication of Chekinov and Bogdanov\'s article."</data>\n      <data key="d2">3e6ab14e2f0c4f2a8a611ac169b8dc44</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;MILITARY ANALYST&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">A Military Analyst is a professional who provides insights and advice on strategic targets, including both quantifiable and non-quantifiable assets. Military analysts are recognized as experts in providing strategic advice, particularly in the realm of unconventional warfare. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">941d7903cf338bd149d976e02ef360e3,94a0dceab22bcc64f5cda721c8fea3a9,ff26a07c83518bf86bdee8bad2f2f78c</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;DECISION-MAKERS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Decision-makers are individuals who hold positions of authority and influence within a state\'s political system. It presents this perspective, analyzing war through the lens of class struggle and power dynamics.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">c224c7a93362b03f8db7d3e34d1bffc1,e54ed249cf4a821abfd0eec3959426c8</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;SOVIET VIEW&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"The Soviet view on war emphasizes its instrumental role in furthering government policy, seeing both peace and war as tools."</data>\n      <data key="d2">e54ed249cf4a821abfd0eec3959426c8</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;WESTERN UNDERSTANDING&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"The Western understanding of war often contrasts with the Soviet view, potentially perceiving it as a chaotic event with unclear purposes."</data>\n      <data key="d2">e54ed249cf4a821abfd0eec3959426c8</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;PETER VIGOR&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Peter Vigor is an author who analyzes and compares different perspectives on war, particularly the Soviet and Western views."</data>\n      <data key="d2">e54ed249cf4a821abfd0eec3959426c8</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;PEACE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0" />\n      <data key="d1">**PEACE** is a concept that holds significant weight in Soviet thought. are described as a countermeasure to armed violence against working people, foreign invaders, or colonialists against enslaved peoples."</data>\n      <data This balance aims to reduce the risk of conflict and promote stability within the global political landscape. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data <data key="d1">"Gambit or Endgame?\' is a book co-written by Aleksei Arbatov and Vladimir Dvorkin."</data>\n      <data key="d2">2385dbf05a52a7c13e919f4a9990177a</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;SOVIET LEADERS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Soviet leaders believed that socialistic transformation required armed struggle.  They held this specific belief about the necessity of armed struggle for social change. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">14442faf092eaecae58a72c1a981a33b,342381013c3f61db48a3a2b2bc77370c,b161f86472b14d8aafd5240f60c4d0ea</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;SOCIALISM&quot;">\n      <data key="d0" />\n      <data key="d1" />\n      <data key="d2">342381013c3f61db48a3a2b2bc77370c</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;SOCIALISTIC TRANSFORMATION OF SOCIETY&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"The socialistic transformation of society is presented as a goal pursued by Soviet leaders, requiring armed struggle."</data>\n      <data key="d2">b161f86472b14d8aafd5240f60c4d0ea</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;MILITARIZATION OF SOCIAL LIFE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0" />\n      <data key="d1" />\n      <data key="d2">b161f86472b14d8aafd5240f60c4d0ea</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;SOCIALIST STATE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0" />\n      <data key="d1" />\n      <data key="d2">b161f86472b14d8aafd5240f60c4d0ea</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;PRESIDENT OF RUSSIA&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The President of Russia is responsible for issuing decrees related to national security strategy. This was demonstrated by the President of Russia\'s recent issuance of a decree on the National Security Strategy.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">8c9af93ed8ee0b5b14df8c35220e2526,c27fe22edd732004ec71612fcd55bab2</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;STRATEGIC ROCKET FORCES&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"The Strategic Rocket Forces are a part of Russia\'s military, responsible for nuclear deterrence."</data>\n      <data key="d2">8c9af93ed8ee0b5b14df8c35220e2526</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;INTERNAL AFFAIRS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Internal Affairs is mentioned as a potential agency responsible for information influence on the population, contrasting with the military\'s role."</data>\n      <data key="d2">10779701d4d4bad771a7c8e3bdf664e0</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;SECURITY AGENCIES&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Security agencies are mentioned alongside Internal Affairs as potentially responsible for countering information influence."</data>\n      <data key="d2">10779701d4d4bad771a7c8e3bdf664e0</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;PERSSON&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Persson is cited as an expert source providing insights into the Russian view of war and national security."</data>\n      <data key="d2">497a16d8349c548069afaf4be6732760</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;EUROMAIDAN REVOLT&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The **Euromaidan Revolt** was a specific color revolution that occurred in Ukraine from 2013 to 2014. Characterized by violence, the revolt is widely recognized as a significant historical event that preceded Russia\'s invasion of Ukraine.  Some view the Euromaidan Revolt as further evidence of Western states successfully using color revolutions as a tool, while others emphasize its role as a catalyst for the subsequent Russian aggression. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">09d7c6af55f6f4b82f041f3f22e4670b,127b37863425efc735533b75512a27a3,465274671b741f3ad76a316d27207a5f,66363736a89b60d4a0809ceb037cbec1,d0c05f8ec94cd42a4727a66ae84be4dd,e0bc114dfaebe00d71bbcf19b4d41f1d</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;ANDR KALISTRATOV&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Andr Kalistratov is a military theorist who views war as a social armed struggle, specifically within the context of a class society.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">3d90ffe5fbb2fe4d1036ef242b8830be,e8d8461aeecbc6801361ca4fa5c3e2e2</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;OREKHOV AND CHEKINOV&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Orekhov and Chekinov are authors who specialize in researching and writing about the evolution and nature of warfare. Their work focuses on comparing warfare in the nineteenth and twenty-first centuries, examining the impact of information technology on modern conflict, and exploring the defining characteristics of war in the 21st century.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">54841d8827acc62d9af1b1f976a8c99f,cb9c7871784fe7e0541e9f25929b9435,e41fa526af28ae23029d009662aa4c4d,f196fc7516d60a5e95b2a477d1f0b3f7</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;VLADIMIR KVACHKOV&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Vladimir Kvachkov is a GRU colonel and fellow at the Center for Military-Strategic Studies who wrote about modern warfare."</data>\n      <data key="d2">54841d8827acc62d9af1b1f976a8c99f</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;AFGHAN WAR&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"The Afghan war is presented as another example of a conflict that transcends traditional definitions of war."</data>\n      <data key="d2">990f73c5f878701d1f0eda068b4141f2</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;CHECHNYA&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"GEO"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Chechnya was a region that was de facto independent at the time, where "restoring constitutional order" was a key objective in the conflict. This highlights the non-military aspects of the conflict alongside the political and territorial dimensions.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">990f73c5f878701d1f0eda068b4141f2,b0c5dde408f78d03b151ddc3b1617dda</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;MARXIST-LENINIST THOUGHT&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Marxist-Leninist thought is a key ideological framework that connects class struggle, war, and revolution. It provides a crucial understanding of the relationship between these three concepts.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">8510ea40cef51fcde12bd266cbc4b6b2,9521960b1adb4fffde0f8bca2df87bcb</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;FIRST WORLD WAR&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The First World War influenced the perception of war\'s potential to accelerate revolution.  It is mentioned as an event that strengthened the belief that war could speed up the revolutionary process. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">14442faf092eaecae58a72c1a981a33b,8510ea40cef51fcde12bd266cbc4b6b2,9521960b1adb4fffde0f8bca2df87bcb</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;RUSSIAN REVOLUTION&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The **Russian Revolution** saw the Bolsheviks come to power. This event is often cited as an example of how war can accelerate revolutionary movements, highlighting the link between war and revolution.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">14442faf092eaecae58a72c1a981a33b,8510ea40cef51fcde12bd266cbc4b6b2,9521960b1adb4fffde0f8bca2df87bcb</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;SECOND WORLD WAR&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The Second World War solidified the Soviet Union\'s control over Central Europe. This historical event also served as the context for ev\'s early military career. The war further exemplifies the link between war and revolution, as seen in the Soviet Union\'s strengthened position in Central Europe following the conflict. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">00ec4986199087f35da0fdf6a3fbe289,14442faf092eaecae58a72c1a981a33b,8510ea40cef51fcde12bd266cbc4b6b2,9521960b1adb4fffde0f8bca2df87bcb,ac3935048eeae245ddfa4be2101163b4</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;BOLSHEVIK REGIME&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The Bolshevik Regime was a fledgling government that faced both internal struggles and foreign interventions, making its existence precarious.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">7457059c696ee5838f2b9889b1412e1f,dcb36e1f25d08b0eeffb649bc3a7860f</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;&#1040;&#1053;&#1040;&#1057;&#1058;&#1040;&#1057;&#1048;&#1071; He argues that while violence remains central to war, information warfare is increasingly important. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">672950e46eaf1ef3e60e7be1bb7dfebb,cb292470c7cc7ca5b848504c1662c302</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;RUSSIAN MILITARY DEBATE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"The Russian military debate refers to discussions and disagreements within the Russian military regarding the nature of war and its conduct."</data>\n      <data key="d2">cb292470c7cc7ca5b848504c1662c302</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;ECONOMY&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"The economy is presented as a crucial factor in national power and a potential target in warfare."</data>\n      <data key="d2">1a860ae7b783d3a1eb78fb862dd64138</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;VLADIMIR PUTIN&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Vladimir Putin is the President of Russia and believes that his regime\'s survival is threatened by Western subversion."</data>\n      <data key="d2">48992c1ff17a8a786ad467a773402407</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;SERGEI LAVROV&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Sergei Lavrov is the Foreign Minister of Russia. He views sanctions imposed by the U.S. and EU as an attempt to create "regime change" in Russia, perceiving them as more than just economic penalties. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">48992c1ff17a8a786ad467a773402407,5140c89116bf2a284b9b14b06732515a,b6478283fa7c46af4ca180dfbfe4fb8b,bb79f01fab18fe7d28c221337b6e09c0</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;HEAD OF RUSSIA\'S SECOND-LARGEST BANK&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"The head of Russia\'s second-largest bank is quoted as viewing the sanctions as \'economic war\'."</data>\n      <data key="d2">b6478283fa7c46af4ca180dfbfe4fb8b</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;MALYSHEV&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">MALYSHEV is a military theorist and expert on war who serves as the chief of the Strategy Department at the General Staff Academy.  He analyzes the changing nature of war, arguing that while its scope has expanded, armed warfare remains its defining element. Despite these evolving trends, Malyshev advocates for a more traditional view of war in his work. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">48406587f16687aac4c95e6b442fc461,7e482cb10632a3cf72d58679114ee7f7,ffc35334e36b0fecb9fab734e90d5cc9</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;ALEKSANDR VLADIMIROV&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Aleksandr Vladimirov is a retired major general and president of the board of Russian military experts for the Russian International Affairs Council."</data>\n      <data key="d2">ffc35334e36b0fecb9fab734e90d5cc9</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;RUSSIAN INTERNATIONAL AFFAIRS COUNCIL&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The Russian International Affairs Council is an organization led by and employing Aleksandr Vladimirov.  Aleksandr Vladimirov also works for the council. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">10c2107510ca030511e787a41f8386e6,222621f5436da920cdc65605cbbc1a27,ffc35334e36b0fecb9fab734e90d5cc9</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;KONSEPTUALNYYE OSNOVY NATSIONALNOY STRATEGII ROSSII&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"BOOK"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Konseptualnyye osnovy natsionalnoy strategii Rossii" is a book published in 2007.  Written by Aleksandr Vladimirov, it focuses on the conceptual foundations of Russian national strategy. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">10c2107510ca030511e787a41f8386e6,222621f5436da920cdc65605cbbc1a27,ffc35334e36b0fecb9fab734e90d5cc9</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;OSNOVY OBSHCHEY TEORII VOINY&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"BOOK"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Osnovy obshchey teorii voiny" is a collection of texts published in 2013. should be protected from political interference.  He argued for this protection in his writings and teachings. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">2553587dc45018c99ef96b7e7bb2637d,d1330c3cbc7e7877db9ba902371af4d9</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;MILITARY THEORIZING&quot;">\n      <data key="d0" />\n      <data key="d1" />\n      <data key="d2">3cd3649d4d82b16c6d105090d8081f6e</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;MARXIST THOUGHT&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Marxist thought is presented as a framework that contains a paradox regarding war."</data>\n      <data key="d2">51eee122c2ebcb8b0ffd820ac78cdc7b</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;ESCALATION&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Escalation is a key concept in the text, referring to the potential for conflict to intensify."</data>\n      <data key="d2">00641f6f7299e02e813e3f9b6264b19e</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;DETERRENT DAMAGE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Deterrent Damage is a calculated level of harm inflicted on an adversary with the aim of discouraging further action or escalation.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">00641f6f7299e02e813e3f9b6264b19e,75cf1c5331762502113e33f0d91f7c4d</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;ASSIGNED DAMAGE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Assigned Damage refers to damage inflicted as part of a planned military operation."</data>\n      <data key="d2">00641f6f7299e02e813e3f9b6264b19e</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;ADVERSARY STRATEGY&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Adversary strategy refers to the tactics and plans employed by Russia, particularly deterrence by intimidation."</data>\n      <data key="d2">7f29c6f20448813b7813c49b4dc2cc0c</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;GRAY&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">GRAY is an author and expert on Soviet nuclear strategy.  He is a scholar who emphasizes the importance of analogy and interpretation when studying Soviet nuclear strategy due to the limitations of available evidence. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">8575b5a4808a02423294125b2c1483e6,ccb7c808f122106b7d9c096a80c02665</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;SOVIET NUCLEAR STRATEGY&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Soviet nuclear strategy refers to the military doctrine and planning of the Soviet Union regarding nuclear weapons. The party is also known as the platform where Vladislav Surkov introduced his concept of "sovereign democracy." \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">156ff7f250aed5b5236d9aad856e4fa7,85e5e3514a004553e41c0c93fc4c5f0a,e0d765d0aa64f3c5fa134e12f9523747,e8769bf3ae70aa7e94e61f0244ae3e87</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;WESTERN GOVERNMENTS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Western governments are often portrayed as a key player in color revolutions, particularly by Russian leaders. key="d2">3b41834f1aeafcdbc929c57f206725a1,9faec8504bfb0d46421bb8e60eb2c5dd</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;ADVERSARY\'S&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Adversary\'s refers to opposing entities or groups, likely nations or organizations."</data>\n      <data key="d2">a1cbb5a09e483e3cc680f9262e2348ed</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;INTERNATIONAL SPHERES&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"LOCATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"International spheres encompass global political and diplomatic arenas."</data>\n      <data key="d2">a1cbb5a09e483e3cc680f9262e2348ed</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;SURKOV&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">**SURKOV** is a Russian political strategist who is closely associated with Vladimir Putin and considered part of the Russian leadership. He is known for developing and promoting the concept of "sovereign democracy," which emphasizes national sovereignty and limits foreign influence.  \n\nSurkov also coined the term "orange technologies" to describe Western-backed strategies aimed at undermining Russia\'s sovereignty through non-violent means, such as protests and civil disobedience. He warned about the threat these technologies posed, connecting them to the concept of "soft capture," where external actors exert influence without direct control.  \n\nWhile Surkov advocated for cooperation with the West, he also highlighted the role of foreign NGOs in color revolutions, viewing them as key players in destabilizing regimes. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">0a20fca212149a5c275431feaaf62872,10fdbc155d8eeafb67522412fec1e0df,156ff7f250aed5b5236d9aad856e4fa7,34b0078e74299e6a200a4ef43f0bdc9c,3747b8d7981bef88cd93023a9282583b,90103cb4f23e3f665cb8e7a0b7cc6bf1,e8769bf3ae70aa7e94e61f0244ae3e87,fbc7a2df818769e5a910c5bb3976be37</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;SOVEREIGN DEMOCRACY&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Sovereign Democracy is Surkov\'s concept that emphasizes Russia\'s independence from external interference."</data>\n      <data key="d2">e8769bf3ae70aa7e94e61f0244ae3e87</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;ORANGE TECHNOLOGIES&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Orange Technologies refers to a set of influences that erode values, declare the state ineffective, and provoke internal conflicts."</data>\n      <data key="d2">10fdbc155d8eeafb67522412fec1e0df</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;SOFT CAPTURE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Soft Capture is a concept connected to \'soft power\' and describes a method of influence."</data>\n      <data key="d2">10fdbc155d8eeafb67522412fec1e0df</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;JOSEPH NYE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Joseph Nye is credited with launching the concept of "soft power" in US foreign policy. analysis."</data>\n      <data key="d2">997501601230522984f64014c2dfc838</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;CONQUERORS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data He highlights failings in Western conceptions of armed conflict, arguing that these types of wars are not new but rather expose weaknesses in traditional understandings of military engagement.  Echevarria II also points to the enduring influence of Russian military thought throughout history. \n</data>\n      <data It refers to a strategy where a full-scale use of nuclear weapons by two or more opposing sides would result in the complete annihilation of both the attacker and the defender.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">5acd5cef8f86988b25ee5ea4db51d835,7a463246834de68f60794449af1761c7</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;RUSSIAN STRATEGIC STUDIES&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n military strategy and capabilities."</data>\n      <data key="d2">2ebccd83f6ca66e3734ad7a0f35d865b</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;NUCLEAR SIGNALLING&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Nuclear Signalling is a strategy that utilizes the threat of nuclear weapons as a deterrent, even without the intention of actually deploying them. This tactic is employed within the framework of cross-domain operations, suggesting its application across various military and strategic domains. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">23a741082731d52f254cf6d6f54eb58c,e96a19292c0dcbfd971525ddefe52467</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;INTRA-WAR COERCION&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Intra-war coercion is another tool employed in the cross-domain operation."</data>\n      <data key="d2">e96a19292c0dcbfd971525ddefe52467</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;MILITARY REFORM&quot;">\n      <data key="d0" />\n      <data key="d1" />\n      <data key="d2">6fe4faca1e39cc57f7c84b772a87fd4d</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;CONVENTIONAL DETERRENCE THEORIES&quot;">\n      <data key="d0" />\n      <data key="d1" />\n      <data key="d2">6fe4faca1e39cc57f7c84b772a87fd4d</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;INFORMATIONAL (CYBER) DETERRENCE THEORIES&quot;">\n      <data key="d0" />\n      <data key="d1" />\n      <data key="d2">6fe4faca1e39cc57f7c84b772a87fd4d</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;DETERRENCE THEORIES&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Deterrence theories are mentioned as existing frameworks that have influenced the development of cross-domain coercion."</data>\n      <data key="d2">76815ae7d94d779bb7060d241c9903fc</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;INSURGENCY&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"An insurgency was created and directed in Eastern Ukraine by Russia\'s intelligence agencies."</data>\n      <data key="d2">9ea52a4480bd186fd8c41d309a569da5</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;NIKITA KHRUSHCHEV&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Nikita Khrushchev, the leader of the Soviet Union,  amended the country\'s official stance on war following a successful nuclear test. This change in perspective reflected a new understanding of the devastating potential of nuclear weapons and their impact on global conflict. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">73e9dd59e90139f5e98a1ec5152660fd,7496af92a71655ac8c47de41bf43bb65,dcb36e1f25d08b0eeffb649bc3a7860f</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;MARXIST-LENINIST PRECEPT&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The **Marxist-Leninist Precept** is an ideology or belief system within Marxism-Leninism that posits the inevitability of war as long as imperialism persists. This strategy was a direct response to perceived losses in public support during the First Chechen War. Despite the challenges and complexities of the conflict, Russia ultimately survived the Second Chechen War. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d6">46a8120d658a422a13cbf4af4bac874c,52788eb4a502bd9fae3098a9fead4ce8,d1270b1668a34228056151a7c64babb1</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;RUSSIA&quot;" target="&quot;VALERY GERASIMOV&quot;">\n      <data key="d4">1.0</data>\n      <data key="d5">"Valery Gerasimov is the Chief of the General Staff of Russia."</data>\n      <data key="d6">2ed01d91a2d5804af478b65fbd4fff17</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;RUSSIA&quot;" target="&quot;GAREYEV&quot;">\n      <data key="d4">2.0</data>\n      <data key="d5">Russian expert Gareyev identifies "information and other subversive activities" as a significant threat to Russia. He specifically analyzes the danger posed by "soft power" in this context.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d6">2ed01d91a2d5804af478b65fbd4fff17,84b65c4d676043766aeebfc93b776ae6</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;RUSSIA&quot;" target="&quot;MILITARY DOCTRINE&quot;">\n      <data key="d4">2.0</data>\n      <data key="d5">Russia\'s Military Doctrine is a document that outlines the country\'s strategic goals and military capabilities.  It emphasizes the protection of Russia\'s sovereignty and borders, viewing them as potential threats. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d6">c57764869d0b7caa0abcd0a9e7b856aa,df2540cf569ce35f7b90708e5da0b01d</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;RUSSIA&quot;" target="&quot;INFORMATION WARFARE&quot;">\n      <data key="d4">3.0</data>\n      <data key="d5">Russia views **Information Warfare** as a crucial element of its contemporary military strategy.  They have broadened the definition of war to encompass not only traditional combat but also the manipulation of information to achieve strategic objectives. Russia aims to undermine Western unity and democratic processes through targeted campaigns in **information warfare**. This expansive approach encompasses influencing social and state stability, fostering patriotism, and shaping public consciousness on a mass scale. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d6">225b0cff903c251046636fb4bfe2e8ff,3db1db2951506b532f7777cda28bb8b2,94ad18024a3545fd895f5193db1fd0c5</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;RUSSIA&quot;" target="&quot;WEST&quot;">\n      <data key="d4">2.0</data>\n      <data key="d5">Russia actively engages in an information struggle against the West, seeking to weaken their unity and erode confidence in democratic institutions.  This campaign is part of a broader strategy where Russia is perceived as holding a competitive advantage over the West by operating effectively across multiple domains. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d6">225b0cff903c251046636fb4bfe2e8ff,7ae0f631f330850ca53d02c933c953ce</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;RUSSIA&quot;" target="&quot;TROLL FACTORIES&quot;">\n      <data key="d4">1.0</data>\n      <data key="d5">"Russia utilizes pro-Kremlin online influence agents, often referred to as \'troll factories\', to amplify its information warfare efforts."</data>\n      <data key="d6">225b0cff903c251046636fb4bfe2e8ff</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;RUSSIA&quot;" target="&quot;US ELECTIONS&quot;">\n      <data key="d4">1.0</data>\n      <data key="d5">"Russia has exerted influence in US elections, particularly through information warfare."</data>\n      <data key="d6">94ad18024a3545fd895f5193db1fd0c5</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;RUSSIA&quot;" target="&quot;SLIPCHENKO&quot;">\n      <data key="d4">1.0</data>\n      <data key="d5">"Slipchenko\'s work was influential in the study of future war in Russia."</data>\n      <data key="d6">f773883fc42cbafe5e0268d526176d80</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;RUSSIA&quot;" target="&quot;GERASIMOV&quot;">\n      <data key="d4">2.0</data>\n      <data key="d5">**Russia\'s** Gerasimov is a figure within the Russian military who actively participates in discussions about the evolving nature of warfare. His views on these matters are subject to debate within Russia.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d6">7cc72471bf4edd02ae4d6b43dd505467,dd68126420b24cd563d457fdb5356a33</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge theory."</data>\n      <data key="d6">43cb0f2a8f89f287a9fa0308ed110a3f</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;SOVIET UNION&quot;" target="&quot;COMMUNIST PARTY&quot;">\n      <data This influence originated within the Soviet Union itself. \n</data>\n      <data key="d6">3cd3649d4d82b16c6d105090d8081f6e,8493f884b789159d96b7dab3a7202396</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;SOVIET UNION&quot;" target="&quot;RUSSIAN FEDERATION&quot;">\n      <data key="d4">2.0</data>\n      <data key="d5">The Russian Federation inherited both the military legacy and the military thinking about war from the Soviet Union.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d6">2ced16684237fb065035dffff5afc8b4,31d8ac7fc85d988e67da2c6480208aad</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;SOVIET UNION&quot;" target="&quot;JUST WARS&quot;">\n      <data key="d4">1.0</data>\n      <data key="d5">"The Soviet Union believed that certain types of wars, such as those in defense of socialist countries or national liberation, were just."</data>\n      <data key="d6">65495eb1bdee1fa1abc9d070c27380fa</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;SOVIET UNION&quot;" target="&quot;UNJUST WARS&quot;">\n      <data key="d4">1.0</data>\n      <data key="d5">"The Soviet Union considered imperialist aggression and wars between exploiting classes and the working class to be unjust."</data>\n      <data key="d6">65495eb1bdee1fa1abc9d070c27380fa</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;SOVIET UNION&quot;" target="&quot;WAR THEORY&quot;">\n      <data key="d4">1.0</data>\n      <data key="d5">"The Soviet Union laid the theoretical foundation for Russian war theory, which persists today."</data>\n      <data key="d6">1fdbdba8c71554268a8e4cacad9c056a</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;SOVIET UNION&quot;" target="&quot;LENIN&quot;">\n      <data key="d4">2.0</data>\n      <data key="d5">The Soviet Union\'s understanding and application of warfare throughout history were heavily influenced by Lenin\'s definition of war. His writings became foundational tenets for how war was perceived and conducted within the nation.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d6">1b996f45c7b397759863385a53361eed,4a45316e71cd0e0104c26095efef1a8b</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;SOVIET UNION&quot;" target="&quot;CHAPTER 2&quot;">\n      <data key="d4">1.0</data>\n      <data key="d5">"Chapter 2 examines the development of Russian military theory after the dissolution of the Soviet Union."</data>\n      <data key="d6">4a45316e71cd0e0104c26095efef1a8b</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;SOVIET UNION&quot;" target="&quot;GEORGE KENNAN&quot;">\n      <data key="d4">1.0</data>\n      <data key="d5">"Kennan called for using all means short of war against the Soviet Union during the Cold War."</data>\n      <data key="d6">c0ae1b35d101dd5c80796ebcaaa52998</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;SOVIET UNION&quot;" target="&quot;WAR&quot;">\n      <data key="d4">2.0</data>\n      <data key="d5">The Soviet Union understood war as a strategic tool to be employed in pursuit of political objectives. This perspective is analyzed in detail, examining the views on war held by both leaders and intellectuals within the Soviet Union.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d6">1b996f45c7b397759863385a53361eed,31d8ac7fc85d988e67da2c6480208aad</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;SOVIET UNION&quot;" target="&quot;CLAUSEWITZ&quot;">\n      <data 2014 work. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d6">0ac95daa24b8448799785bd3afba6112,29af440463776490596d1cedcfe1b068,68355cf380d714ea713e77efbe44d3ac,c06a4e03818e9f2586a6cd014a2408b7</data>\n    </edge>\n key="d6">35fa4f03c6bbb412d22ff5f494e83329</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;GERASIMOV&quot;" target="&quot;MCIS&quot;">\n      <data key="d4">1.0</data>\n      <data key="d5">"Gerasimov key="d6">0130a2e44046b07aa1a2eac85562f8aa</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;GERASIMOV&quot;" target="&quot;ARAB SPRING&quot;">\n      <data key="d4">1.0</data>\n      <data <edge source="&quot;GERASIMOV&quot;" target="&quot;ACADEMY OF MILITARY SCIENCES&quot;">\n      <data key="d4">1.0</data>\n      <data key="d5">"Gerasimov gives his yearly speech at the Academy of Military Sciences."</data>\n      <data key="d6">68355cf380d714ea713e77efbe44d3ac</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;GERASIMOV&quot;" target="&quot;SYRIA&quot;">\n      <data key="d4">1.0</data>\n      <data key="d5">"Gerasimov discusses Syria in his speech about the changing nature of war."</data>\n      <data key="d6">68355cf380d714ea713e77efbe44d3ac</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;GERASIMOV&quot;" target="&quot;HYBRID METHODS&quot;">\n      <data key="d4">2.0</data>\n      <data key="d5">General Gerasimov advocates for the use of hybrid methods in modern conflicts. He argues that these methods, which combine military and non-military measures, are increasingly prevalent in contemporary warfare.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d6">0ac95daa24b8448799785bd3afba6112,68355cf380d714ea713e77efbe44d3ac</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;GERASIMOV&quot;" target="&quot;HYBRID WARFARE&quot;">\n      <data key="d4">1.0</data>\n      <data key="d5">"Gerasimov is the source of information about Hybrid Warfare and its components."</data>\n      <data key="d6">b11c3e5c041763bf480a5b17676c7ef3</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;GERASIMOV&quot;" target="&quot;UKRAINE&quot;">\n      <data key="d4">1.0</data>\n      <data key="d5">"Gerasimov uses Ukraine as an example to illustrate hybrid warfare tactics."</data>\n      <data key="d6">b11c3e5c041763bf480a5b17676c7ef3</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;GERASIMOV&quot;" target="&quot;ADAPTIVE USE OF FORCE&quot;">\n      <data key="d4">1.0</data>\n      <data key="d5">"Gerasimov\'s definitions of adaptive use of force and hybrid war are used by Andrew Korybko."</data>\n      <data key="d6">2d96d25d0022a1193382ea88b904435a</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;GERASIMOV&quot;" target="&quot;KORYBKO&quot;">\n      <data key="d4">2.0</data>\n      <data key="d5">Korybko is an analyst who focuses on the theories of  Gerasimov, particularly those concerning adaptive use of force and hybrid warfare. Korybko utilizes Gerasimov\'s definitions of these concepts within his own analyses and interpretations. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d6">22b661e49114bda37400701e79292197,4a396711762b9d23dfa301a027d2737e</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;GERASIMOV&quot;" target="&quot;PROMINENT FIGURES&quot;">\n      <data key="d4">1.0</data>\n      <data key="d5">"Gerasimov is considered a prominent figure in the Russian military, alongside Kartapolov and Gareyev."</data>\n      <data key="d6">803cf3c02920d14a7bb0447fc1c76140</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;ARAB SPRING&quot;" target="&quot;COLOR REVOLUTIONS&quot;">\n      <data key="d4">2.0</data>\n      <data key="d5">Both the **Arab Spring** and the **Color Revolutions** are interconnected concepts. While the **Arab Spring** is often cited as an example of a Color Revolution, it\'s important to note that its nature was complex and evolved over time. Initially, the **Arab Spring** was widely seen as a series of successful nonviolent uprisings, aligning with the typical characteristics of Color Revolutions. However,  the movement also witnessed significant violence in various countries, complicating its categorization and highlighting the diverse trajectories these revolutions can take. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d6">127b37863425efc735533b75512a27a3,c06a4e03818e9f2586a6cd014a2408b7</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;ARAB SPRING&quot;" target="&quot;CHEKINOV &amp; BOGDANOV&quot;">\n      <data key="d4">1.0</data>\n      <data key="d5">"Chekinov and Bogdanov viewed the Arab Spring as a sign of a new age of war."</data>\n      <data key="d6">e216e7f3ed5bf3208c1f51eaa41603b8</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;ARAB SPRING&quot;" target="&quot;WAR&quot;">\n      <data key="d4">2.0</data>\n      <data key="d5">According to Valery Gerasimov, **Arab Spring**-style revolts could be a typical form of **war** in the 21st century.  He proposed this idea, suggesting that these uprisings and social movements share characteristics with traditional warfare. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d6">2ed01d91a2d5804af478b65fbd4fff17,b04e155024b2e24838d7dba80a934c81</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;ARAB SPRING&quot;" target="&quot;GAREYEV&quot;">\n      <data <data key="d4">1.0</data>\n      <data key="d5">"Western military interventions in Syria followed a Color Revolution."</data>\n      <data key="d6">127b37863425efc735533b75512a27a3</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;ZARUDNITSKY&quot;" target="&quot;COLOR REVOLUTIONS&quot;">\n      <data key="d4">2.0</data>\n      <data key="d5">Zarudnitsky is an analyst who studies Color Revolutions. He posits that these events represent a novel type of military threat and constitute a significant shift in global politics, introducing new challenges to security. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d6">053fc6b7d54ff33c0865e0ad0ff30b52,c06a4e03818e9f2586a6cd014a2408b7</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;COLOR REVOLUTIONS&quot;" target="&quot;GAREYEV&quot;">\n      <data key="d4">3.0</data>\n      <data key="d5">Gareyev views Color Revolutions as significant shifts in the nature of conflict. While he acknowledges their potential to bring about substantial political change,  he still prioritizes traditional definitions of war. Gareyev cites Color Revolutions, such as the Arab Spring, as successful examples of non-military political upheaval, noting similarities in tactics employed between these events and the broader Arab Spring uprisings. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d6">752e31eca4dc5d94da820c3cb84cf6e9,8beec46e554e40907188a8b4eadfb7f8,fcf6292acd4060dcb8b6f555eeebabe3</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;COLOR REVOLUTIONS&quot;" target="&quot;YURI BALUYEVSKY&quot;">\n      <data key="d4">1.0</data>\n      <data key="d5">"Baluyevsky considers Color Revolutions a major threat, emphasizing their impact on military thought."</data>\n      <data key="d6">ad3a9a7eec5a9d65028ce8f7f95ab827</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;COLOR REVOLUTIONS&quot;" target="&quot;MILITARY POWER&quot;">\n      <data key="d4">1.0</data>\n      <data key="d5">"Color Revolutions challenge traditional notions of military power, highlighting the importance of non-military means."</data>\n      <data key="d6">ad3a9a7eec5a9d65028ce8f7f95ab827</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;COLOR REVOLUTIONS&quot;" target="&quot;DOMESTIC MILITARY DANGER&quot;">\n      <data key="d4">1.0</data>\n      <data key="d5">"The 2014 Military Doctrine identifies color revolutions as a domestic military danger."</data>\n      <data key="d6">17ec79bdb3de589c18eab04fab860d2c</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;COLOR REVOLUTIONS&quot;" target="&quot;CHEKINOV AND BOGDANOV&quot;">\n      <data key="d4">1.0</data>\n      <data key="d5">"Chekinov and Bogdanov argue that Color Revolutions represent a new form of warfare called \'wars of controlled chaos\'. "</data>\n      <data key="d6">cb50fafd31d07b9e8f9e52f658937913</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;COLOR REVOLUTIONS&quot;" target="&quot;WEST&quot;">\n      <data key="d4">4.0</data>\n      <data key="d5">According to the Russian leadership, **Color Revolutions** are viewed as a form of aggression from **the West** against Russia.  Descriptions portray **the West** as orchestrating and using **Color Revolutions** for geopolitical gain, viewing them as a tool for warfare. \n\n\nThe consistent theme across all descriptions is that **the West** is responsible for instigating **Color Revolutions** with the aim of achieving strategic political objectives. \n</data>\n      <data
