One of their papers focuses specifically on calculation algorithms and systems for assessing both current and potential damage.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">05f2cbcbcab7b423ca490efc91183f31,1a170d35d1db0069870ebc4e61a1b440</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">204</data>\n      <data key="d5">dcb9f281cd6248c699e0ebb285a42a5e</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;VOENNAYA MYSL&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Voennaya Mysl is the publication where a paper about calculation algorithms and systems for assessing current and potential damage was published."</data>\n      <data key="d2">1a170d35d1db0069870ebc4e61a1b440</data>\n      <data key="d3">3</data>\n      <data key="d4">205</data>\n      <data key="d5">072cdee531b74513984f49d99a8d64a0</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;KRISTIN VEN BRUUSGAARD&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Kristin Ven Bruusgaard is an author and expert who specializes in Russian military theory, strategic gestures, and the impact of Russia\'s actions on Crimea.  She is known for her publication "Crimea and Russia\'s Strategic Overhaul," as well as articles exploring this topic. Bruusgaard\'s work raises questions about the effectiveness of Russian deterrence signaling and delves into the use of calculation algorithms and systems for assessing damage in current and potential conflicts. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">05f2cbcbcab7b423ca490efc91183f31,1a170d35d1db0069870ebc4e61a1b440,4c204df8ad672f0ac08e5f67507eaf18,4f8db3ed9bf44e0a3d5c923630004413,94a4c440971e12fe51d0296b2e2ccd80,d7db417821a9ecdbb04ad34de78b0244,eaf0d08dbd97c1a7311aa7c886044509</data>\n      <data key="d6">5</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">2</data>\n      <data key="d4">206</data>\n      <data key="d5">5ae335d9210a45fda3f92a9a028d6d9b</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;CALCULATION ALGORITHMS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0" />\n      <data key="d1" />\n      <data key="d2">1a170d35d1db0069870ebc4e61a1b440</data>\n      <data key="d6">5</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">207</data>\n      <data key="d5">5ac60a941a5b4934bdc43d2f87de601c</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;GLAVNOYE RAZVEDYVATELNOYE UPRAVLENIYE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Glavnoye Razvedyvatelnoye Upravleniye (GRU) is the Russian military intelligence service, now renamed GU but still commonly referred to as GRU."</data>\n      <data key="d2">ee529e2d08063744d6a3cc51b8b4775b</data>\n      <data key="d6">1</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">208</data>\n      <data key="d5">d405c3154d0e48ce96fad4c28fe20590</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;NATIONAL SECURITY STRATEGY&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The **NATIONAL SECURITY STRATEGY** is an important document that shapes Russia\'s approach to security. It outlines the nation\'s overall approach to ensuring its security and interests.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">833fcef2d336802f17cac21855d9386e,ee529e2d08063744d6a3cc51b8b4775b</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">209</data>\n      <data key="d5">7923d8521c744bd9aab131c1aea91ffd</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;GENERATIONS OF WAR&quot;">\n      <data key="d0" />\n      <data key="d1" />\n      <data key="d2">ee529e2d08063744d6a3cc51b8b4775b</data>\n      <data key="d6">7</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">210</data>\n      <data key="d5">5bd156c87ec44e19ae6f8f62e6e50b9d</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;MILITARY ACTIONS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0" />\n      <data key="d1" />\n      <data key="d2">ee529e2d08063744d6a3cc51b8b4775b</data>\n      <data key="d6">16</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">211</data>\n      <data key="d5">c1a146d7fb16429ea6d0aa2a55ee597f</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;GRU&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The GRU (Glavnoye Upravleniye) is the Russian military intelligence service. It was formerly known as Upravleniye, but is now commonly referred to by its current name, GU (Glavnoye Upravleniye).  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">102101b4c233908b8b89641dfce3cf63,54841d8827acc62d9af1b1f976a8c99f,7ed31e804f831372958bf16ddc23894c</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">212</data>\n      <data key="d5">ede9350632084da5b0b577ff799ab14b</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;GU&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">GU (Glavnoye Upravleniye) is the current official name of the Russian military intelligence service.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">102101b4c233908b8b89641dfce3cf63,7ed31e804f831372958bf16ddc23894c</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">213</data>\n      <data key="d5">ed559fb4ebde45518849ec803b350fa3</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;NEW GENERATION WARFARE (NGW)&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">New Generation Warfare (NGW) is a contemporary approach to warfare characterized by the integration of advanced technologies and unconventional tactics. It utilizes indirect action, informational campaigns, and other methods that fall outside traditional military strategies.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">207bed9f1d288e01a876a1430dccf65e,85f4f3b5379c5738a70e9fb5bc359ae0</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">214</data>\n      <data key="d5">f422035f8b78417f98e4d116971cf9f3</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;ASYMMETRICAL AND INDIRECT ACTIONS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Asymmetrical and indirect actions are a key component of NGW, aiming to neutralize the adversary without direct force."</data>\n      <data key="d2">207bed9f1d288e01a876a1430dccf65e</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">215</data>\n      <data key="d5">c79d686eba044c5586c706cdc096817d</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;PRECISION GUIDED MUNITIONS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"TECHNOLOGY"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Precision guided munitions are mentioned as a tool employed in NGW campaigns."</data>\n      <data key="d2">207bed9f1d288e01a876a1430dccf65e</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">216</data>\n      <data key="d5">0f70db1e598d463fbbcdd1e288bd9490</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;ARMED CIVILIANS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Armed civilians are mentioned as potential participants in NGW campaigns."</data>\n      <data key="d2">207bed9f1d288e01a876a1430dccf65e</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">217</data>\n      <data key="d5">b35c3d1a7daa4924b6bdb58bc69c354d</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;CRITICAL INFRASTRUCTURE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"LOCATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Critical Infrastructure refers to essential systems and assets vital for societal functioning.  These include facilities such as nuclear power plants, hydroelectric plants, power grids, transportation networks, and communication systems. The Russian General Staff (GS) identifies critical infrastructure as a target for destruction in their vision of contemporary warfare.  The deliberate targeting and destruction of critical infrastructure is also a tactic employed in Non-Government Warfare (NGW) campaigns aimed at degrading an adversary\'s military-economic potential. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">207bed9f1d288e01a876a1430dccf65e,2aade1f79d1854a0ea4fadaab417e8a5,75ab69af1bcde38f873a43d3c5344bc2,83a9c8568bb6d6b42eda25b377e1d82a,cc84ac6c50ec6d7ddd192d476b87fed3</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">218</data>\n      <data key="d5">a97e2ecd870944cfbe71c79bc0fcc752</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;DECISION MAKERS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Decision makers are individuals who make choices and influence outcomes, particularly in military strategy. This applies specifically to individuals within Russia who play a role in formulating strategies and making choices.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">34d972dafa86555d8f489098607e4c77,78e21e7581a6a69c457a96fea7ed205a</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">219</data>\n      <data key="d5">3e1b063bbfa9423d84e50311296d2f3c</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;OPERATORS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Operators are individuals responsible for executing plans and actions, often in a technical or tactical capacity."</data>\n      <data key="d2">78e21e7581a6a69c457a96fea7ed205a</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">220</data>\n      <data key="d5">9a8ce816ee954bdabd01ea2081538009</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;ADVERSARY&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"**ADVERSARY**" refers to an opposing force or entity, primarily a nation or military organization, potentially in conflict with Russia.  \n\nThis term encompasses nations or entities targeted by Russia\'s strategic interactions, including reflexive control tactics, cross-domain coercion operations, and informational pressure campaigns. The adversary is also mentioned as a competitor in a protracted struggle with Russia and the target of the United States\' military strategy. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">0afa143d52dacb7c41e7fa780362e6f4,23a741082731d52f254cf6d6f54eb58c,245c8a66b7fbfb155c4ea1253d66dad9,4029a673e4a82185b802f0ac1cd07c9c,78e21e7581a6a69c457a96fea7ed205a,7ae0f631f330850ca53d02c933c953ce,7f82e8411c5b80a6ac75f300f2e486f5,8587fc1bd5fbf935fa72a6100bddb7b7,8a6bc654ca308f2716cc1b21c9c2a7a2,8af314428c563e0a26a74d9083e89198,988815ea3f96b42cbe7dc83869db7588,e96a19292c0dcbfd971525ddefe52467</data>\n      <data key="d6">0</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">4</data>\n      <data key="d4">221</data>\n      <data key="d5">09f18f81442d4d6d93a90f0fac683f9b</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;MILITARY SUPERIORITY&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Military superiority describes the advantage one side holds over another in terms of armed forces and capabilities."</data>\n      <data key="d2">78e21e7581a6a69c457a96fea7ed205a</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">222</data>\n      <data key="d5">e02be3e37ca0454883a4c1fd859c24bb</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;INFORMATIONAL STRUGGLE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"INFORMATIONAL STRUGGLE" is a key element of New Generation Warfare (NGW) that focuses on shaping perceptions and influencing public opinion. It involves a competition for influence through information, propaganda, and media control.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">3b97d2180490b928c0221d51d99009d6,54e95c247a87127af9ad5fa80f3d8599,78e21e7581a6a69c457a96fea7ed205a,888683deca722e6e0152b005624cd674</data>\n      <data key="d6">10</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">4</data>\n      <data key="d4">223</data>\n      <data key="d5">6e0c81bef5364c988b21bf9b709d9861</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;FORCE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Force refers to military power or the ability to compel action through violence or threat."</data>\n      <data key="d2">78e21e7581a6a69c457a96fea7ed205a</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">224</data>\n      <data key="d5">1dbc51475cb04dafa4a8833a8378635e</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;WEST&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">## The West: A Geopolitical Entity Perceived Differently by Russia\n\n"The West" refers to Western countries and their collective actions, often including the US and EU. It is presented as a geopolitical entity with contrasting interests and perspectives compared to Russia.  Western nations are perceived by Russian elites as orchestrating Color Revolutions and Information Warfare for geopolitical gain. \n\nWhile "The West" is portrayed as primarily using nonmilitary and nonviolent force according to Gerasimov\'s theory, it is also identified as a target or subject of his proposed adaptive approach to force.  Russia accuses "The West" of double standards in its Ukrainian policy, criticizing its actions as hypocritical. \n\nConversely, "The West" engages in interactions with Moscow, seeking to understand Russian strategic perspectives and envisions international regulation of the informational (cyber) space differently than Russia. It is also mentioned as a contrasting perspective to Russia\'s nuclear strategy and a potential instigator of the information war by some Russians.  \n\nUltimately, "The West" is presented as a collective entity believed by Russia to be heavily involved in information warfare and a source of cultural offensive against Russia. This portrayal highlights the complex and often adversarial relationship between these two geopolitical entities. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">0f7839ea8349ef21120e4bb4f7687956,10779701d4d4bad771a7c8e3bdf664e0,127b37863425efc735533b75512a27a3,17ec79bdb3de589c18eab04fab860d2c,1dabe4b6c1c6784c25fb3e21c5e41d22,225b0cff903c251046636fb4bfe2e8ff,29a46f13633e4ddfb2338626c0e0a4c8,29af440463776490596d1cedcfe1b068,2c8af010afa07adb4fc31c2ca3c76f0e,3858893d4e6c348056e49fd3ae011704,3ac56cedae22345797ec130c512cc5b9,3d9254865502f679af6fa7a0b77a6cbe,3f38017cf23bc7563f3f91672438843d,4825db8d9e31e39efc9a58ed4d38e842,497a16d8349c548069afaf4be6732760,4988f2a5f074560f53ed5ddfe5e100b2,54e95c247a87127af9ad5fa80f3d8599,5fe78f79b74aaf92a89687fd492be682,61ac280201ff550c532fdc0a622b220c,7762d8e435ee0e72467ae2468b71323e,7ae0f631f330850ca53d02c933c953ce,80e2f294b065a7a45175fb7408358c76,8e19a67a1ae3b88f93b6c2d0e4c861c7,93d35d9e3f3e82ed3b519b494edfd9b9,9d078dbf3cd9f132d9d452509bd774f1,c2324291b2afa91371cc2c27eeb6979e,d7db417821a9ecdbb04ad34de78b0244,ddd0a3f72f4191a04998e4fe73f788b7,ee01bd14651295a2b77fcb67ebdc098b,fa1f745b441f0a8da9c96e5184733ab7</data>\n      <data key="d6">6</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">5</data>\n      <data key="d4">225</data>\n      <data key="d5">c12b9ebd8b4e42b7896822a32e3fa6eb</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;EU&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The **EU (European Union)** is a political and economic union of European countries.  It shares NATO\'s concerns about Russia and has imposed sanctions on the Russian Federation. The EU is also accused by Russia of providing support to Ukraine that led to war, provoking the removal of the legitimate president in Ukraine, and supporting the overthrow of the Ukrainian government and inciting conflict. \n\nDespite these accusations, the EU is portrayed as an organization concerned about Russia\'s actions and has adopted the concept of hybrid warfare to understand contemporary Russian military tactics.  The EU is criticized by Putin for its double standards in promoting democracy. The EU is mentioned as a potential actor influencing events in Russia, supporting NGOs, and potentially involved in information warfare related to the conflict in Ukraine.  Russia seeks to distance itself from the EU, viewing it as an external force. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">02a6df0665914ec51da4921e5dd94d40,046b1edf8fbc5d1fbd1a79f8a887a374,1d1f8fd7a97b7aca3ba71380fbbaa90c,1eef68cba1ae051b37f22f0f0ca7f0db,30032f8bc461471f2472db1803deb493,3858893d4e6c348056e49fd3ae011704,398eeca696092e2043e85b335804a06b,3ecc874d513039a384221cb07d625267,48992c1ff17a8a786ad467a773402407,5e6fb3a3adc710bacf237b23b8de5cdb,730c4f20ab1db06c8867021b10267a04,78e0d14c1d381cdf093e4f7873c77b1c,806203f9ac3bb5daf5713237ac7d114e,90103cb4f23e3f665cb8e7a0b7cc6bf1,a2023cafb796baf9facb3660049c9663,b3db7caea69de418d71078fbb5676d15,b6478283fa7c46af4ca180dfbfe4fb8b,c2736d15fad21b52584eeabefdf7f2da</data>\n      <data key="d6">6</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">3</data>\n      <data key="d4">226</data>\n      <data key="d5">27505f6ade4b4e5f9316ffe9c34821f7</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;RUSSIAN LEADERSHIP&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The **Russian Leadership** is presented as a collective entity with its own understanding of the geopolitical situation.  This decision-making body, responsible for choosing courses of action in potential conflict, is a key influencer of Russia\'s strategic choices. The Russian leadership perceives democracy promotion as a geopolitical tool used by the United States and fears "regime change" and color revolutions. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">2c8af010afa07adb4fc31c2ca3c76f0e,34b0078e74299e6a200a4ef43f0bdc9c,4a613c1d2300f0daf7688d2a667bd6b2,6d223c86a361242683a4bd296d60b502,7f29c6f20448813b7813c49b4dc2cc0c,988815ea3f96b42cbe7dc83869db7588,d42e19095522f9d2df7dc1499cedc5ca</data>\n      <data key="d3">2</data>\n      <data key="d4">227</data>\n      <data key="d5">0ee7db2c6bea4630ba9f0c25e8a967ad</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;JONSSON 2017A&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Jonsson 2017a refers to a specific publication or work by Jonsson that provides insights into Russian perspectives."</data>\n      <data key="d2">2c8af010afa07adb4fc31c2ca3c76f0e</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">228</data>\n      <data key="d5">5a6c1d15424149f69052cd8d91fbff75</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;&#1052;&#1048;&#1053;&#1048;&#1057;&#1058;&#1045;&#1056;&#1057;&#1058;&#1042;&#1054; &#1054;&#1041;&#1054;&#1056;&#1054;&#1053;&#1067; &#1056;&#1060;&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The **Ministry of Defense of the Russian Federation** (&#1052;&#1048;&#1053;&#1048;&#1057;&#1058;&#1045;&#1056;&#1057;&#1058;&#1042;&#1054; &#1054;&#1041;&#1054;&#1056;&#1054;&#1053;&#1067; &#1056;&#1054;&#1057;&#1057;&#1048;&#1049;&#1057;&#1050;&#1054;&#1049; &#1060;&#1045;&#1044;&#1045;&#1056;&#1040;&#1062;&#1048;&#1048;) serves as a primary source of information regarding military strategy and operations.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">301411011eea3aeeebe199c0d468c1e1,d2d4df284cdfd3436c43d512c0b82fa0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">229</data>\n      <data key="d5">d005bf75c31d4848ad7041f39651e59c</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;&#1057;&#1058;&#1056;&#1040;&#1058;&#1045;&#1043;&#1048;&#1063;&#1045;&#1057;&#1050;&#1040;&#1071; &#1054;&#1055;&#1045;&#1056;&#1040;&#1062;&#1048;&#1071; &#1071;&#1044;&#1045;&#1056;&#1053;&#1067;&#1061; &#1057;&#1048;&#1051; (&#1057;&#1054;&#1071;&#1057;)&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The Strategic Nuclear Force Operation (SNF), also known as  "&#1057;&#1090;&#1088;a&#1090;e&#1075;&#1080;&#1095;ec&#1082;a&#1103; &#1071;&#1076;&#1077;&#1088;&#1085;&#1072;&#1103; &#1057;&#1080;&#1083;&#1072; (c&#1080;&#1083;&#1099;)" in Russian, is a key concept within Russian military doctrine. It is defined as a military operation. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">301411011eea3aeeebe199c0d468c1e1,d2d4df284cdfd3436c43d512c0b82fa0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">230</data>\n      <data key="d5">9b3eef8f3a3a45e6873838db95295b8a</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;&#1056;&#1042;&#1057;&#1053;&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"The Russian Strategic Missile Forces (RVSN) are mentioned as a crucial component of Russia\'s nuclear deterrent."</data>\n      <data key="d2">d2d4df284cdfd3436c43d512c0b82fa0</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">231</data>\n      <data key="d5">fdc954b454744820804d7798f3e0b5de</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;RUSSIAN STRATEGIC PLANNERS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Russian strategic planners are responsible for estimating the conditions under which de-escalation by nuclear means would be recommended to senior leadership.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">6be90bae70d4a931450e8b0170cddf37,a4f7f4b3c3aaa2c4a28a4f9fc0d813a1</data>\n      <data key="d3">2</data>\n      <data key="d4">232</data>\n      <data key="d5">49c1383836934ec495c3b35769100a73</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;SENIOR LEADERSHIP&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Senior leadership is the decision-making authority within Russia that receives recommendations from strategic planners.  This group advises on matters of national strategy, including nuclear de-escalation. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">6be90bae70d4a931450e8b0170cddf37,a4f7f4b3c3aaa2c4a28a4f9fc0d813a1</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">233</data>\n      <data key="d5">859dedcc3736439a8a563419f16cb3d8</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;RUSSIAN EXPERTS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">## Russian Experts\n\nRussian Experts are individuals who play a significant role in shaping Russian military strategy and doctrine. They contribute to theoretical discussions and policy development, often facing communication challenges with Western counterparts due to differing terminology and perspectives.  \n\nWhile they analyze and comment on the militarization of the informational domain by the US, they do not use the term "hybrid warfare" to describe their own country\'s tactics. Russian Experts are also involved in developing methodologies for calculating unacceptable levels of damage and determining the nuclear threshold, a crucial aspect of strategic planning.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">3005c5cb5d98576847761fbbd5957ef3,4124151e2fc00b9b0fa6084138b8a7ef,4da16a6c2d67e20c8f2d1c5a8156c4fd,5eea4913c132500b62e2f7d79380593e,6be90bae70d4a931450e8b0170cddf37,92697f6a162cf0b8f900c0eb43d28c12,a4f7f4b3c3aaa2c4a28a4f9fc0d813a1,db516a1ced78fde051a32a1c881c6b6b,f3100a3b7eda755b429622097891e3a0</data>\n      <data key="d3">3</data>\n      <data key="d4">234</data>\n      <data key="d5">6078b9980a6c4dcd9198d151b833ead7</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;MODIFIED MCNAMARA CRITERIA&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Modified McNamara criteria is a proposed method for calculating prospective and actual damage to critical infrastructure and command-and-control systems under conventional aggression."</data>\n      <data key="d2">a4f7f4b3c3aaa2c4a28a4f9fc0d813a1</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">235</data>\n      <data key="d5">f93cd6b8213e46dda67af7e5382e1bd2</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;STRATEGIC COMMUNITIES&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Strategic communities are groups of individuals who engage in strategic decision-making and influence on an international level.  These communities are characterized by shared perspectives and practices related to military strategy, highlighting their significant role in shaping global affairs. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">8e19a67a1ae3b88f93b6c2d0e4c861c7,bcc65b2e28c6961542c9ec3723d8eed0</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">236</data>\n      <data key="d5">496f17c2f74244c681db1b23c7a39c0c</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;WESTERN VALUES&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Western Values" are presented as a motivating factor for some actors involved in the conflict, according to the provided text.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">51b868d40e3701709987e796369fbf69,d494718117eae6e351eff5873eca32c0</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">237</data>\n      <data key="d5">da1684437ab04f23adac28ff70bd8429</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;KONYZHEV AND SERGUNIN&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Konyzhev and Sergunin are military theorists who analyze different war theories, including nontraditional warfare. They are authors cited in texts as experts on military affairs, indicating they may be researchers or experts collaborating on the topic.  \n\nIn their work, Konyzhev and Sergunin define "war of consciousness" as a psychological war focused on the enemy population\'s values. They discussed these concepts in 2014 and studied various strands of nontraditional warfare, including defining a type of warfare called "myatezhvoina."  Konyzhev and Sergunin also analyzed the state of Russian military theory. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">16a295a1b82cfcc452e208d5c3376783,276f8550d758346b203160a32cd885b6,416b24c5306fccae40958a87626ad65f,60642b4264405ef39d55111c2feff3c4,93d35d9e3f3e82ed3b519b494edfd9b9,d494718117eae6e351eff5873eca32c0,d8383d735e3d4dedd141bc4b08e3eeaa,def7760b684f6f3110fc8b387dcc9b09,fdc2c2b29672f18ffe9ae9fb2f1da756</data>\n      <data key="d6">5</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">4</data>\n      <data key="d4">238</data>\n      <data key="d5">4517768fc4e24bd2a790be0e08a7856e</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;POPOV AND KHAMZATOV&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Popov and Khamzatov are authors who analyze various war theories, including those surrounding the nationalist ideology of "myatezhvoina."  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">276f8550d758346b203160a32cd885b6,d494718117eae6e351eff5873eca32c0</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">239</data>\n      <data key="d5">545edff337344e518f68d1301d745455</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;AFGHANISTAN&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"GEO"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Afghanistan is a country located in Central Asia that has been the site of numerous conflicts throughout its history.  The US and NATO conducted operations in Afghanistan aiming for democratic governance, while the Soviet Union invaded the country in 1979, claiming it was a defensive action. Following the September 11th attacks, the US launched military operations in Afghanistan targeting al-Qaeda and the Taliban. \n\nAfghanistan has been described as a location where traditional military action has been observed, with ground troops demonstrably needed.  The country has also been mentioned as an example of a traditional military conflict, where armed force was used to unleash local conflicts. Notably, "ev" served as a chief military adviser in Afghanistan. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">00ec4986199087f35da0fdf6a3fbe289,0130a2e44046b07aa1a2eac85562f8aa,0d30b8ab46b9f341eae428a79714b86c,355bb2e7269c004d598030ff8348dda0,3fe4dd62a032b1a281c925fbec9cbc6a,4014059e72ca2fb658649cccba153f5e,84b65c4d676043766aeebfc93b776ae6,84fbeb27b48ec1426740369d4f5b851e,ac3935048eeae245ddfa4be2101163b4,cd472d2664acb377dd498e88b7ed8d58,d494718117eae6e351eff5873eca32c0</data>\n      <data key="d6">3</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">3</data>\n      <data key="d4">240</data>\n      <data key="d5">9376ce8940e647a99e5e087514b88fa4</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;IRAQ&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"GEO"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Iraq is a country that was invaded by the US in an attempt to replace Saddam Hussein\'s regime with a democratic government.  The invasion and subsequent occupation have been cited as examples of how internal instability can be provoked through subversive actions and the use of armed force to unleash local conflicts. Iraq has also been described as a location where ground troops were demonstrably needed, traditional military action has been observed, and traditional military conflicts have taken place. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">0130a2e44046b07aa1a2eac85562f8aa,0d30b8ab46b9f341eae428a79714b86c,3fe4dd62a032b1a281c925fbec9cbc6a,84b65c4d676043766aeebfc93b776ae6,84fbeb27b48ec1426740369d4f5b851e,d494718117eae6e351eff5873eca32c0,e0927b91be8f756165d5fca82ca84107</data>\n      <data key="d6">4</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">241</data>\n      <data key="d5">b38a636e86984600bb4b57c2e2df9747</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;CYBERWAR&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">CYBERWAR is a subcategory of nontraditional warfare that focuses on conflict within the virtual information sphere.  It is described as a type of war, referred to as "cyberwar (kibervoiny)" in some texts. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">416b24c5306fccae40958a87626ad65f,988cfd2c3c636c6bc23a2455381cfe57,d8383d735e3d4dedd141bc4b08e3eeaa</data>\n      <data key="d6">4</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">3</data>\n      <data key="d4">242</data>\n      <data key="d5">4bc7440b8f4b4e4cae65a5c49defa923</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;NONTRADITIONALISTS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0" />\n      <data key="d1">The Nontraditionalists are a school of thought in Russian military theory that diverges from the traditional doctrines based on the works of Carl von Clausewitz.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">135bc11aa823b69772040362565fae86,988cfd2c3c636c6bc23a2455381cfe57</data>\n      <data key="d6">4</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">243</data>\n      <data key="d5">5d1b038ce8be4533b54dd79d6496de9b</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;VM&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">VM is a journal that publishes papers on strategic deterrence.  V.O. Zapivakhin, S.A. Komov, and A.A. Krivchenko are among the authors who have published their work in VM. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">35a12b9e620c419b9d3709d8310e4e44,4f8db3ed9bf44e0a3d5c923630004413</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">244</data>\n      <data key="d5">ac6e5a44e0c04a4fa93589376fde4c34</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;A.A. Kreidin."</data>\n      <data key="d2">f8e92b9cf56ae036a7539cce823291de</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">250</data>\n      <data key="d5">8169efeea3ce473d9fd2f1c688126a1c</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;PREDEL SOKRASCHENIIA SIAS\'">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Predel sokrascheniia SIaS\' is a publication authored by V.V. Korobushin, V.I. Kovalev, and G.N. Vinokurov."</data>\n      <data key="d2">f8e92b9cf56ae036a7539cce823291de</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">251</data>\n      <data key="d5">c2d48b75af6a4d7989ccf9eceabd934e</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;2014 MILITARY DOCTRINE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The **2014 Military Doctrine** is a document that outlines military strategies and the perceived threats facing the armed forces.  It specifically emphasizes information warfare and color revolutions as significant dangers. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">8cbc35e22aa8edad712072d4efe491f1,a1c7cc7a633d4eb0010929797ae264c5</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">252</data>\n      <data key="d5">5f1fc373a8f34050a5f7dbd8ac852c1b</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;2010 MILITARY DOCTRINE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The **2010 Military Doctrine** is a previous document outlining Russian military strategies and threats. It recognizes the effectiveness of information warfare in achieving strategic objectives and outlines Russia\'s concerns about color revolutions and information warfare as key elements of modern conflict.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">0e40df5d22db6584ec7e05b07c3d9b66,8cbc35e22aa8edad712072d4efe491f1,a1c7cc7a633d4eb0010929797ae264c5</data>\n      <data key="d6">1</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">253</data>\n      <data key="d5">0c010fa3aeac4b28b2fbb8c2339c2521</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;2015 NATIONAL SECURITY STRATEGY&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"The 2015 National Security Strategy explicitly mentioned color revolutions as a threat."</data>\n      <data key="d2">8cbc35e22aa8edad712072d4efe491f1</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">254</data>\n      <data key="d5">c2999bdca08a478b84b10219875b285e</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;RUSSIAN STATE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The **RUSSIAN STATE** seeks to deter aggression against its core security interests by signaling its intentions to the United States and NATO through communication.  It also aims to communicate directly with these entities. While wielding power through instruments like subversion and coercion, the Russian state is described as potentially vulnerable due to societal impacts that could destabilize it. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">0e067e05f9650b52c2d5a35f0b338517,3304c86daf67046c27cb5947f9a9483d,833fcef2d336802f17cac21855d9386e,a3793e3636208105dfe212679c69fe6c,c8300f4f7d5b7c124ffba537f3e9d2f8</data>\n      <data key="d6">4</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">2</data>\n      <data key="d4">255</data>\n      <data key="d5">263d07354a1b4336b462024288f9bcd3</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;I.N. They are decision-makers who shape the Russian understanding of war through their positions and influence, contributing to the country\'s overall perception of conflict. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">37367261346e904a453711b72a78f624,46383c461d50b84aa5f19d44407b0924,4b3b407bbe1ac2b90a3980545cb66a39,5eebe2681ef1e72ddfec4046d181b179,641dba1d5b7b52f8b0e286f427afecc3,8196d4fb9caac5c7ffd87f465eac8c12</data>\n      <data key="d6">9</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">264</data>\n      <data key="d5">89b2003e97804961805ea1886d078ebd</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;MILITARY THEORISTS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Military theorists are a group of individuals who study and analyze warfare, including its various aspects. They contribute to the understanding of war across different nations, with military theorists in Russia providing academic perspectives on war and military strategy.  These experts delve into military strategy, tactics, and doctrine, analyzing and developing theories about warfare that encompass both military and non-military dimensions. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">16e81515ca8373651cd0b48537be5baf,30386c4e76d744b895d430847b713f0a,37367261346e904a453711b72a78f624,46383c461d50b84aa5f19d44407b0924,5eebe2681ef1e72ddfec4046d181b179,8196d4fb9caac5c7ffd87f465eac8c12</data>\n General Staff is the highest-ranking military officer and leads military-theoretical development. This position, held by Nikolai Makarov, is responsible for leading and managing the armed forces within an organization.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">37367261346e904a453711b72a78f624,d0ecd460d53c457bc525cf4f3ba940d2,d5dcc493e23a0823f088973d518e05d9</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">269</data>\n      <data key="d5">cf6115e69d6649cc99ef2bd11854ccfb</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;DEPUTY DEFENSE MINISTER&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The **Deputy Defense Minister** is a high-ranking official within the Russian government, deeply involved in military affairs.  They assist the Minister of Defense in carrying out their duties and hold a prominent position within the Russian military. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">0d448e2ed64ced1d8c219f32dfdbf8dd,37367261346e904a453711b72a78f624,6b21b5384eeb47acd3531f198f0cc8a8</data>\n      <data key="d6">3</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">270</data>\n      <data key="d5">9ed7e3d187b94ab0a90830b17d66615e</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;GENERAL STAFF&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The **General Staff** is the highest-ranking military body in Russia, responsible for leading and developing military strategy. It is a high-level military organization within Russia, involved in strategic planning and command.  Headed by Gerasimov, it is also described as having the leading role in developing military thought and shaping strategic thought within the officer corps. The General Staff oversees the journal *Voyennaya Mysl* and is responsible for publishing military-theoretical works. It confirms existing viewpoints on the changing nature of war and is presented as a military institution responsible for strategic planning and decision-making.  \n\nPreviously, the **Center** was part of the General Staff, but it has since moved to a separate structure. Yuri Baluyevsky previously led the General Staff, and Kartapolov holds a key position within the organization. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">00ec4986199087f35da0fdf6a3fbe289,0d448e2ed64ced1d8c219f32dfdbf8dd,188d0ba736e3a2e79f8ee925efb5fc17,358c867d3a7c5e13a54f3d519fad1603,389e48907c50cbd0638418cda16b9938,48406587f16687aac4c95e6b442fc461,59000e6206d2f11d502e8016a145b2e4,5b098687cb656d98c6bb419d0ec6fd75,5bc1d54f3233915280db63e273e03592,5e6fb3a3adc710bacf237b23b8de5cdb,661e67c85ea1083089347a517eabb492,6a27add2f8dee21c9564401e84531dc3,6b21b5384eeb47acd3531f198f0cc8a8,803cf3c02920d14a7bb0447fc1c76140,850631a820a8158d8c7bff68e8f7fea5,8575b5a4808a02423294125b2c1483e6,8c9af93ed8ee0b5b14df8c35220e2526,94a2bf999aec8597aae3db5d3633891d,972ad08450d40acba47394c99e434c56,9d078dbf3cd9f132d9d452509bd774f1,b04e155024b2e24838d7dba80a934c81,b3066af57efb89b0569dbadaba8b79bc,bd400dbd8e753ab71c9394fe8b1f07ce,cbad03251a174d87dc9c103d0a260763,efe802c6b1c257d9a40d7035ce1fa807,f7fe50a67c52ae2fe045654d627f23e1</data>\n      <data key="d6">3</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">17</data>\n      <data key="d4">271</data>\n      <data key="d5">b4c7432f712849d7aba9dccbb77471ef</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;THEORISTS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Theorists are individuals involved in drafting public security doctrines and participating in military debates, specifically contributing to the development of military doctrines and engaging in discussions within the Russian military.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">0d448e2ed64ced1d8c219f32dfdbf8dd,6b21b5384eeb47acd3531f198f0cc8a8</data>\n      <data key="d6">3</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">2</data>\n      <data key="d4">272</data>\n      <data key="d5">434e752b992c4e6a812557529315c5b9</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;PUBLIC SECURITY DOCTRINES&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Public Security Doctrines are theoretical frameworks outlining Russia\'s approach to maintaining internal order and national security. They represent official policies and beliefs regarding security within Russia, serving as part of the framework used to understand war in Russia. These doctrines also provide official guidelines and beliefs regarding war within Russia.  Essentially, Public Security Doctrines encompass strategies for ensuring both internal order and national security, shaping Russia\'s understanding and approach to conflict. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">0d448e2ed64ced1d8c219f32dfdbf8dd,4b3b407bbe1ac2b90a3980545cb66a39,641dba1d5b7b52f8b0e286f427afecc3,6b21b5384eeb47acd3531f198f0cc8a8,8196d4fb9caac5c7ffd87f465eac8c12</data>\n      <data key="d6">3</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">273</data>\n      <data key="d5">df79a27b9a4f42fd839c90bb8a79ad91</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;WORLD WARS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">According to Gareyev, World Wars are large-scale conflicts that are becoming increasingly unlikely. This is attributed to the deterrent effect of nuclear weapons and the emergence of alternative strategies for resolving international disputes. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">752e31eca4dc5d94da820c3cb84cf6e9,8beec46e554e40907188a8b4eadfb7f8,ac4e19c9709c97775be647ede43818b5</data>\n      <data key="d6">5</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">274</data>\n      <data key="d5">8f140fd7126f47b6b00307b0181509f9</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;ARMED HOSTILITIES&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Armed Hostilities are defined by Gareyev as the defining characteristic of war."</data>\n      <data key="d2">752e31eca4dc5d94da820c3cb84cf6e9</data>\n      <data key="d6">5</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">275</data>\n      <data key="d5">40450f2c91944a81944621b94f190b49</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;LARGE-SCALE AGGRESSIONS AGAINST RUSSIA&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Large-scale aggressions against Russia are another type of conflict that Gareyev believes are becoming less likely."</data>\n      <data key="d2">ac4e19c9709c97775be647ede43818b5</data>\n      <data key="d6">5</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">276</data>\n      <data key="d5">5b9fa6a959294dc29c8420b2d7d3096f</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;PRAVDA&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Pravda is a Russian newspaper that publishes articles on various topics, including information warfare.  The news organization released an article on January 8, 2015, and serves as a source of information regarding alleged attacks on Russia. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">2d9ebc26c09a31bc04991b6efe8272bf,6e49482d37bfe8a11381f5fd9b2bf9ab,b119839b954a74bbdae1b5dc8eedc114</data>\n      <data key="d6">1</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">277</data>\n      <data key="d5">b84d71ed9c3b45819eb3205fd28e13a0</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;CHEGINOV&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Cheginov is a Russian expert who served as a source of information alongside Bogdanov in 2010.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">2a095cc3e0a26865ad75d88bf966ff8e,6e49482d37bfe8a11381f5fd9b2bf9ab</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">278</data>\n      <data key="d5">b0b464bc92a541e48547fe9738378dab</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;IVASHOV&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">IVASHOV is a Russian expert mentioned in the text as a source of information.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">2a095cc3e0a26865ad75d88bf966ff8e,6e49482d37bfe8a11381f5fd9b2bf9ab</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">279</data>\n      <data key="d5">44c65dda6fb7472dae36f6eea720ab47</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;RUSSIAN MILITARY&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The **RUSSIAN MILITARY** is undergoing significant transformation, shifting its strategic focus towards nonmilitary methods while simultaneously advancing traditional military capabilities.  \n\nRecent combat missions and strikes in Syria have showcased advancements in C4ISR technology and long-range weaponry. The Russian military develops and implements unique strategies for deterrence, escalation management, and war termination, employing a distinct approach compared to US doctrine. This approach involves a range of tactics, from intimidation to calibrated damage, aimed at influencing an opponent\'s psychology and achieving strategic objectives. \n\nThe military is actively engaged in information warfare and adopting a new cross-domain coercion strategy.  Furthermore, the Russian military is undergoing defense reform, seeking to conventionalize its capabilities while simultaneously developing and implementing innovative strategies and tactics for modern warfare. The evolving understanding of warfare within the **RUSSIAN MILITARY** is a subject of ongoing study and analysis, as evidenced by research focusing on their strategic thinking and writings. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">00641f6f7299e02e813e3f9b6264b19e,0283cd403b9606c59770ad6284698bd1,03141fcff229613c697eaeb333fc00ed,1ac7aca91700a150878fc2f36ce37117,446c1ef537e09d2b67aa06e28092aa49,6316dc2ec52d895a0b1b2877b490420a,77ef3028f0d7a5b90d1d20cb6a53932a,94523d994b1f98cfdb10589452955c12,a3345dfba31fd680883eed3f8e0ab118,a3793e3636208105dfe212679c69fe6c,acb49396b9072d77515a295d612faf84,b41197b9152dd437072aaed249afab6d,ba6cc1cd4e196ad5c9a6ed672f497d19,c03a3c2ac32840f0834fab9a991c0251,dbec7ffa34212bcbbf7129724563c4f8,ea564c655112d9ce5437348086fd1116,ed75045fde0e8bf203850ee3b096166f</data>\n into their nuclear weapon employment strategies."</data>\n      <data key="d2">0283cd403b9606c59770ad6284698bd1</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">282</data>\n      <data mentioned as a factor influencing Russia\'s nuclear strategy."</data>\n      <data key="d2">d397a87c28d728cb2c898a4397dcb575</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">283</data>\n Harvard UP, 2003 is the publication information of Strategy."</data>\n      <data key="d2">0e30f66c2fff8cbe583b5d61a229ae9f</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">299</data>\n      <data key="d5">2fb7e14a3f124526bd7b24867fc18e81</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;B. BYELY ET AL.&quot;&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"B. Byely et al. is a group of researchers who concluded that wars are caused by private ownership relations and social class antagonisms."</data>\n      <data key="d2">b3aa1ac66a5e25e270fce196c19d325e</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">300</data>\n      <data key="d5">5c13c7d61e6c4bfe839f21e7ad3530a7</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;IOAKIM VATSETIS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Ioakim Vatsetis served as the chief of the Red Army in 1923. He believed that future wars would be driven by economic rivalry, stemming from the inherent conflict within class societies.  Vatsetis expressed his views on the causes of war, positing that war is fundamentally rooted in the tensions and power struggles inherent to class-based social structures. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">47cb9a9a109971e9d019217bceac82f8,b3aa1ac66a5e25e270fce196c19d325e,e76184cff7bad45cbad7c9b1d3777f30</data>\n      <data key="d6">12</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">301</data>\n      <data key="d5">a621663edba64d99b7e50f1e53f32ee7</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;RED ARMY&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The **Red Army** was the military force of the Soviet Union and the army of the Bolsheviks.  They believed the Red Army held a "master key to military reality" due to its understanding of dialectical materialism. While it was a significant military force in the past, its threat has diminished. This decline is attributed to fear and lack of initiative among military leaders following purges, which hindered its development. The Red Army is now mentioned in the past tense, indicating it no longer poses a significant threat.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">1d1f8fd7a97b7aca3ba71380fbbaa90c,47cb9a9a109971e9d019217bceac82f8,48992c1ff17a8a786ad467a773402407,a2023cafb796baf9facb3660049c9663,b3aa1ac66a5e25e270fce196c19d325e,e90da29be1148d9844e3ed777db08bf6,ee2a956c830712b74c912b175f90afdd</data>\n      <data key="d6">12</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">2</data>\n      <data key="d4">302</data>\n      <data key="d5">42be4e140061482ea509dd3e26189480</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;WARS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0" />\n      <data key="d1">Wars are characterized by armed struggle and indicate large-scale conflicts.  The goals of wars vary depending on the societal context in which they occur. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">672950e46eaf1ef3e60e7be1bb7dfebb,69df775c113200e1f5faa086acbf27aa,b3aa1ac66a5e25e270fce196c19d325e</data>\n      <data key="d3">4</data>\n      <data key="d4">303</data>\n      <data key="d5">4da4ef951ff340f1a3dd679de4be3341</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;IMPERIALISM: THE HIGHEST STAGE OF CAPITALISM&quot;">\n      <data key="d0" />\n      <data key="d1" />\n      <data key="d2">6b7d21eb26a4ec94c42acbaaf3707f2e,b3aa1ac66a5e25e270fce196c19d325e</data>\n      <data key="d6">9</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">304</data>\n      <data key="d5">2f05fcce857e4a499ca4e89a3cefbcb3</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;MARX AND ENGELS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0" />\n      <data key="d1">Marx and Engels were influential thinkers whose ideas on capitalism and class struggle significantly influenced Lenin\'s views on war.  While they were capitalists themselves, Marx and Engels supported the British-French aggression in Crimea during the 1850s, believing it would contribute to the downfall of the czar. They viewed war as a continuation of political struggles between powers and classes, holding a perspective on war that differed from Lenin\'s. Despite their support for this particular conflict, Marx and Engels are also recognized as predecessors to Lenin\'s ideas on imperialism and war. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">0d32209c44da5e7a86e294594009dc9c,342381013c3f61db48a3a2b2bc77370c,355bb2e7269c004d598030ff8348dda0,6b7d21eb26a4ec94c42acbaaf3707f2e,ad49a894ef8b75f1e79de5a63ec78b85,b1b64ef207d42a2b81118c978ce1f222,b3aa1ac66a5e25e270fce196c19d325e,e3f78e84ba947ada447e7a0b46389605</data>\n      <data key="d6">9</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">3</data>\n      <data key="d4">305</data>\n      <data key="d5">b3aeb7ae009a4f52ae3ae4586e32fe11</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;GERASIMOV DOCTRINE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The **Gerasimov Doctrine** is a Russian military doctrine that focuses on blurring the lines between war and peace through hybrid warfare tactics.  \n\nPopularized by analyst Mark Galeotti, despite his reservations, the term refers to Chief of the General Staff Valery Gerasimov\'s thoughts on modern warfare. The doctrine emphasizes the importance of information warfare and psychological operations, as well as the impact of informatization and automatization on conventional armed forces. It is often discussed in relation to Non-Government Warfare (NGW) as an alternative name or aspect of the same concept.  The Gerasimov Doctrine is a framework for understanding modern warfare that utilizes political, social, and military means, collectively known as hybrid warfare. It is considered a key concept in understanding Russia\'s current military strategy. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">2ebccd83f6ca66e3734ad7a0f35d865b,30e696da641c144eac33994ba0518ccf,9a70b285557b0524306162d74f497e03,a3a7513f41e4fd6cb9e4f0decdbc615d,d5d750ae9aeb32d27e411be522f87d48,e5172fc8ab5577ed794a9225b1eb26f3,e97880df6b33eecb3147aea6e798be7d,fa6f1322c861f018219ae4741df2bae1</data>\n      <data key="d6">0</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">2</data>\n      <data key="d4">306</data>\n      <data key="d5">089b9b9841714b8da043777e2cda3767</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;VALERY GERASIMOV&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Valery Gerasimov is a prominent military figure who has significantly shaped contemporary thinking on warfare.  As the Chief of the Russian General Staff, he proposed in his 2013 speech that the Arab Spring represented a typical conflict for the 21st century, emphasizing the importance of non-military means like information warfare. Gerasimov believes that information resources are effective weapons and that the U.S. has instigated "color revolutions" in various regions. He also acknowledges that armed forces would play a secondary role in future wars, aligning with the concept known as the Gerasimov Doctrine which he popularized. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">102101b4c233908b8b89641dfce3cf63,158ce52b95681a52d3cd554e67e50c0b,2ed01d91a2d5804af478b65fbd4fff17,48992c1ff17a8a786ad467a773402407,e97880df6b33eecb3147aea6e798be7d,ef55602335bea29d08150b6649fad897</data>\n      <data key="d6">0</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">2</data>\n      <data key="d4">307</data>\n      <data key="d5">38f1e44579d0437dac1203c34678d3c3</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;SOVIET WAY&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"The Soviet way refers to a specific ideology or system of thought, particularly regarding the classification of wars."</data>\n      <data key="d2">65a1bf9e5672afc1a7011ffa78b1c211</data>\n      <data key="d6">1</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">308</data>\n      <data key="d5">1ca24718a96b47f3a8855550506c4b41</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;JUST AND UNJUST WARS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Just and unjust wars represent a framework used by the Soviets to categorize conflicts based on their perceived morality."</data>\n      <data key="d2">65a1bf9e5672afc1a7011ffa78b1c211</data>\n      <data key="d6">1</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">309</data>\n      <data key="d5">9c980dfe3cab44b7a83408405edab0b6</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;INTERFAX&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Interfax is a news agency that reported on statements made by an unnamed entity."</data>\n      <data key="d2">79642481b2ae6a1e1e62350b8f9872b5</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">310</data>\n      <data key="d5">f23484b1b45d44c3b7847e1906dddd37</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;GEORGIA&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"GEO"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Georgia is a country cited as a location where a "color revolution" occurred.  It is mentioned as one of the countries where these revolutions took place, and is even given as an example of such an event. Additionally, Georgia was involved in a war with Russia in 2008, which renewed Western interest in Russian military thought. While some descriptions mention Georgia as a location where potential future events could occur, the primary focus of the provided information centers on its past experience with a color revolution and its conflict with Russia.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">02a6df0665914ec51da4921e5dd94d40,2cb1e7782df146c829e143995efaa5ea,5c2f2ed6b167d0c17fcd87e51d62ab85,68d539054aaa9dcc75ed59e59850468c,79642481b2ae6a1e1e62350b8f9872b5,83073afaa1def102babae9700cd63bba,ad3a9a7eec5a9d65028ce8f7f95ab827,e0bc114dfaebe00d71bbcf19b4d41f1d</data>\n      <data key="d6">2</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">311</data>\n      <data key="d5">929f30875e1744b49e7b416eaf5a790c</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;KYRGYZSTAN&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"GEO"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Kyrgyzstan is widely recognized as a country where a "color revolution" occurred.  It is frequently cited as an example of a nation that experienced this type of political upheaval, with descriptions mentioning it as both a location and a participant in these events. While some descriptions also mention Kyrgyzstan as a potential site for future events, the consensus points to its past experience with a color revolution. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">02a6df0665914ec51da4921e5dd94d40,2cb1e7782df146c829e143995efaa5ea,68d539054aaa9dcc75ed59e59850468c,79642481b2ae6a1e1e62350b8f9872b5,ad3a9a7eec5a9d65028ce8f7f95ab827,e0bc114dfaebe00d71bbcf19b4d41f1d</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">312</data>\n      <data key="d5">4920fda031804ce8a1073ace8e061ed6</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;SAFETDINOV&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Safetdinov is a researcher and author who specializes in military doctrine and strategy.  His works are cited within the text. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">228006e7cffd4f00ced36bee90ca132f,27e09c194d672c8bea31adf70326914a,bfe751bb23a049bbf641c35a0c251cae</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">313</data>\n      <data key="d5">4b8aa4587c7344adac2cbfa69d5e40fa</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;DOKTRINA INFORMATSIONNOI BEZOPASNOSTI&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"DOKTRINA INFORMATSIONNOI BEZOPASNOSTI" is a document or policy that outlines information security doctrine. Published in 2000, it is related to information security.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">228006e7cffd4f00ced36bee90ca132f,7f1632ffd4cf2dc58d75832810f206de</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">314</data>\n      <data key="d5">52701d941dfb45359693baae8f267056</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;ANTONOVICH&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Antonovich is a researcher and author who specializes in military doctrine and strategy, particularly focusing on peace in the context of technosphere warfare.  Their work explores the concept of peace within the framework of modern warfare, examining how technological advancements influence conflict and potential avenues for maintaining peace in such an environment. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">10fe7b26db4d186e285f91ba48b28eac,228006e7cffd4f00ced36bee90ca132f,27e09c194d672c8bea31adf70326914a,3335c606e0de431e14afc7e61f86dfa8,bfe751bb23a049bbf641c35a0c251cae</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">315</data>\n      <data key="d5">31499ee6277a4d71b19cb5b6be554c69</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;V.I. KUZNETSOV&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">V.I. Kuznetsov is a researcher or author mentioned in the text. He co-authored a work with Y.Y. Donskov.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">228006e7cffd4f00ced36bee90ca132f,bfe751bb23a049bbf641c35a0c251cae</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">316</data>\n      <data key="d5">d99eabad5dfd47278692569d2a9395b1</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;Y.Y. SUKHORUTCHENKO&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"V.V. Sukhorutchenko is an author."</data>\n      <data key="d2">7f1632ffd4cf2dc58d75832810f206de</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">323</data>\n      <data key="d5">100c2fccd7f74d9281707082f062ba72</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;RUSSIAN DEBATE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"RUSSIAN DEBATE" encompasses ongoing discussions and perspectives within Russia regarding the definition and characteristics of war in contemporary times. This debate involves scholars and policymakers who analyze the nature of war and its implications for Russia\'s national security and foreign policy.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">81610c5774616913fcb1d17e45b9c19b,c6557d1800561000ed6c8db91857d73e</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">324</data>\n      <data key="d5">378fc7636eeb4aabbfd40995a6960c64</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;UNARMED MEANS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Unarmed means are presented as potentially becoming violent and blurring the lines between war and peace."</data>\n      <data key="d2">81610c5774616913fcb1d17e45b9c19b</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">325</data>\n      <data key="d5">80a04aa18cd649d584292f23b10c0727</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;GENERAL BALUYEVSKY&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">General Baluyevsky is a military figure known for his authorship of key Russian military doctrines. He is credited with writing both the 2010 and 2014 Russian military doctrines, which advocate for a multi-faceted approach to deterrence.  His work has significantly shaped Russia\'s strategic thinking on defense and security. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">1838769a055e042d335b716b927ac517,191f63425eb772004d9742ba73efc54f,62184cc3276096431c580f794a557f41</data>\n      <data key="d6">16</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">326</data>\n      <data key="d5">4e9ca18ccc1d4527a3bc035d07f5e162</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;ADAMSKY&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">ADAMSKY is a Russian military theorist, scholar, and author who specializes in Russian military science.  He emphasizes the importance of history in understanding Russian military doctrine and has written extensively on the subject, including his book "Russian Nuclear Incoherence" published in the Journal of Strategic Studies. \n\nAdamsky\'s expertise extends to analyzing Russia\'s strategic culture, particularly its cultural imprint, and he is frequently cited for his insights into Russian nuclear deterrence doctrine. He describes Russian deterrence as having gone through three intellectual waves and analyzes doctrines such as NGW (New Generation Warfare) and the Gerasimov Doctrine.  Additionally, Adamsky is a recognized expert on information warfare within the context of Russian military strategy. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">191f63425eb772004d9742ba73efc54f,30e696da641c144eac33994ba0518ccf,62184cc3276096431c580f794a557f41,80e2f294b065a7a45175fb7408358c76,95b02f88cc024920d86323e2c06e55ae,b3db7caea69de418d71078fbb5676d15,d5d750ae9aeb32d27e411be522f87d48,e1ba1ba79ba31dd6ace4f1d2339dfe7c,e76184cff7bad45cbad7c9b1d3777f30</data>\n      <data key="d6">16</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">327</data>\n      <data key="d5">5564257e89f1428486a64fcf52f49490</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;NONMILITARY MEASURES&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Nonmilitary measures refer to strategies and tactics that do not involve direct military force."</data>\n      <data key="d2">62184cc3276096431c580f794a557f41</data>\n      <data key="d6">16</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">328</data>\n      <data key="d5">83c76fbd2a004d90a5b0a6736ffed61d</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;DOCTRINE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0" />\n      <data key="d1">Doctrine, as defined by the Ministry of Defense, is a set of military principles and strategies that evolves over time.  Specific examples include the 2010 and 2014 doctrines, which are significant events or policies outlined by the Ministry of Defense. The 2014 doctrine, in particular, represents a notable shift, introducing a new approach to warfare as discussed in the text. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">0da7185a3277e6969d5f94e97613b636,28d43c783f6daf1e4eabaab826cb037e,390e6b6bbf2dbf4ee3678f7e9b5afaed,fe9e4fa83d6dfdca5ffcf8a382fc5ff8</data>\n      <data key="d8">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d6">1</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">5</data>\n      <data key="d4">329</data>\n      <data key="d5">d9779c41e3c74fe0b26e23822a4b995b</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;OBJECTIVES&quot;">\n      <data key="d0" />\n      <data key="d1" />\n      <data key="d2">0da7185a3277e6969d5f94e97613b636</data>\n      <data key="d6">1</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">330</data>\n      <data key="d5">9d7a563b3b2d405092c31f1fe08cff77</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;POPULATION\'S PROTEST POTENTIAL&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"The population\'s protest potential is mentioned as a tool used in modern conflict."</data>\n      <data key="d2">0da7185a3277e6969d5f94e97613b636</data>\n      <data key="d6">1</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">331</data>\n      <data key="d5">bd43f3d439a54781bd4b721a9a269b92</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;SPECIAL OPERATIONS FORCES&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Special Operations Forces (SOF) are a component of the military utilized in both deterrence and modern conflict. They are considered part of the military\'s coercive capabilities within non-nuclear deterrence strategies.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">0da7185a3277e6969d5f94e97613b636,5001e715f5ba5243fcabb020b7615069,fcf565288501279df280096beb7c6d3a</data>\n      <data key="d6">1</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">332</data>\n      <data key="d5">adc0f95733e74351a891c4dadf650a52</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;LIDER&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Lider is a Soviet military theorist known for his contributions to understanding war as armed violence employed to achieve political objectives. He further defines the nature of war and is cited as a source providing a definition of peaceful coexistence.  Additionally, Lider is mentioned as a source quoting Khrushchev\'s perspective on war. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">29f93a094c1a402300a4534f45b1e2a2,51ed05a44ffcb6ce215b22d1c327ef23,942df564c917634c14e664feb79e1d02,fb99597f638ca7706b382f31de64c0a7</data>\n      <data key="d6">14</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">2</data>\n      <data key="d4">333</data>\n      <data key="d5">225105a7be14447cb03186bd40756059</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;MARXISM-LENINISM O VOINE I ARMII&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"BOOK"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"This book is an authoritative source on military affairs during the Soviet Union, defining war as the continuation of politics by means of armed force."</data>\n      <data key="d2">51ed05a44ffcb6ce215b22d1c327ef23</data>\n      <data key="d6">9</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">2</data>\n      <data key="d4">334</data>\n      <data key="d5">efce8a9d61254447a26aee99e53f0398</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;NATURE OF WAR&quot;">\n      <data key="d0" />\n      <data key="d1" />\n      <data key="d2">2999e2ab9620ec881fdf22361f3bb121,51ed05a44ffcb6ce215b22d1c327ef23,9d078dbf3cd9f132d9d452509bd774f1</data>\n      <data key="d6">9</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">4</data>\n      <data key="d4">335</data>\n      <data key="d5">4a75a9f0b18a48bea9c0601c0fc395c4</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;SOVIET MILITARY THEORISTS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0" />\n      <data key="d1">Soviet military theorists were a group of individuals who contributed to the understanding of war within a specific tradition. They developed theories about warfare, including prominent figures like Frunze, and analyzed war through various lenses.  This group held diverse viewpoints, particularly regarding the relationship between politics and strategy, as evidenced by the debate between Svechin and Tukhachevsky. Some Soviet military theorists, such as those mentioned in relation to Sokolovsky, specifically focused on nuclear weapons and their implications for warfare. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">2553587dc45018c99ef96b7e7bb2637d,4d3bd4beec226501211dcd3560fd6fba,51ed05a44ffcb6ce215b22d1c327ef23,53a9ea72d5933a1785f5d7146aa759c3,8493f884b789159d96b7dab3a7202396,d1330c3cbc7e7877db9ba902371af4d9,fb99597f638ca7706b382f31de64c0a7</data>\n      <data key="d6">14</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">336</data>\n      <data key="d5">e19287afe00a431f9a593a4827d1b448</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;POLITICS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">**POLITICS** refers to the activities and processes associated with governing and decision-making in a society. This encompasses all aspects of how power is exercised, distributed, and used to shape public policy and influence societal outcomes.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">96de73e76077a8dbde7d1d4e185a69bb,bfa15fcd5d4a19aa65f946d1af780d5f,f6e8b902329dc6f6dbef5fc7fd397474</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">337</data>\n      <data military power used in warfare.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">4640d14036dc3924713f8e3da33466d6,96de73e76077a8dbde7d1d4e185a69bb</data>\n      <data key="d6">5</data>\n      <data
