as participants in hostilities against Russia."</data>\n      <data key="d2">ed99845841304bd47e2d825a071ab187</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">415</data>\n      <data key="d5">bf6a4c18f44042799eb7456a6b85b54a</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;KARIAKIN&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Kariakin is an author who published an article titled \'Khaosmiatezh\' in the journal \'Natsional\'naia Oborona\' in 2015."</data>\n      <data key="d2">c6bceb66a3d2c04618fc4513ce73962c</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">416</data>\n      <data key="d5">fac4a59c2278498d83f9f1b4231ad62e</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;CHEGINOV AND BOGDANOV&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Cheginov and Bogdanov are authors who published a work in 2013. In this work, they wrote about the concept of informational struggle.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">54e95c247a87127af9ad5fa80f3d8599,c6bceb66a3d2c04618fc4513ce73962c</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">417</data>\n      <data key="d5">d6d2b5862ddc4c4d87deee3423506817</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;NATSIONAL\'NAIA OBORONA&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Natsional\'naia Oborona is a journal where Kariakin published his article \'Khaosmiatezh\'."</data>\n      <data key="d2">c6bceb66a3d2c04618fc4513ce73962c</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">418</data>\n      <data key="d5">47d588d26e2b4cccb68fe2af4c147c8f</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;KARTAPOLOV&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Kartapolov is a high-ranking member of the Russian General Staff, serving as the head of the operations directorate. He is a key figure in discussions about modern warfare and military strategy, particularly regarding hybrid warfare tactics and the role of indirect means in conflict. Kartapolov advocates for the use of propaganda and information warfare as primary tools in modern combat, arguing that indirect actions constitute a new type of war alongside classical warfare. His views on modern conflict have earned him recognition as an expert on international conflicts and military strategy. He is frequently mentioned alongside other prominent figures in the Russian military, such as Gerasimov and Burenok, highlighting his significant influence in military decision-making. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">54e5f6035998ada7e8e6f4188995aec5,5544a73c36bca1539aa5ea6ad7f5e013,5e6fb3a3adc710bacf237b23b8de5cdb,677c7a0f4f60503badb0a4d899c21d74,803cf3c02920d14a7bb0447fc1c76140,850631a820a8158d8c7bff68e8f7fea5,875a24bb4d326ae3b9a0c46c84cca4be,a1d5b70180c35b1c12fa0a5a6e0f0a8a,a8ab56e6e419d570a195fd2ea167899d,ab85b02c7dac7ba1d7aedf091ca78d90,b3066af57efb89b0569dbadaba8b79bc,bd400dbd8e753ab71c9394fe8b1f07ce,ff779b872510c138da68523b69265b0e</data>\n      <data key="d6">3</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">7</data>\n      <data key="d4">419</data>\n      <data key="d5">c0f2dc03d8df400db4997c1a0babd6ad</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;UKRAINIAN PRESIDENTIAL ELECTIONS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"The Ukrainian presidential elections of 2004 were contested and influenced by the West."</data>\n      <data key="d2">046b1edf8fbc5d1fbd1a79f8a887a374</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">420</data>\n      <data key="d5">0211d61aae834229a3a1e004ff5cc658</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;IVANOV&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">**IVANOVA** is a person who holds strong views on international relations and technology. He believes that the West\'s interference in Ukraine is detrimental, arguing against the imposition of democracy from external forces. Ivanov shares Putin\'s perspective that revolutions are orchestrated by NGOs and sees information technology as a weapon used against Russia.  Furthermore, during his tenure as Russian defense minister in 2005, Ivanov declared that Russia was engaged in an undeclared war. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">0f7839ea8349ef21120e4bb4f7687956,1dabe4b6c1c6784c25fb3e21c5e41d22,3747b8d7981bef88cd93023a9282583b,8c989fc0d3fc136d27a9f97d0fe40c82,b150f2af73252fedbdd595a3de157238</data>\n      <data key="d6">2</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">2</data>\n      <data key="d4">421</data>\n      <data key="d5">ccbbbcc055c34709abcf103208c2c299</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;CENTER&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The CENTER is a military organization that has experienced several organizational shifts. Initially, it was part of the General Staff before being relocated to the Military Academy of the General Staff.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">59000e6206d2f11d502e8016a145b2e4,efe802c6b1c257d9a40d7035ce1fa807</data>\n      <data key="d6">3</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">2</data>\n      <data key="d4">422</data>\n      <data key="d5">989add81cf874018a569239b68d17ff2</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;MILITARY ACADEMY OF THE GENERAL STAFF&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The Military Academy of the General Staff is a Russian educational institution dedicated to training military officers. Located within the General Staff, it serves as a hub for military personnel development and houses various training facilities, including the Center which was relocated there at some point. Vladislav Orlyansky is currently employed at the Military Academy of the General Staff. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">59000e6206d2f11d502e8016a145b2e4,8c9af93ed8ee0b5b14df8c35220e2526,b477b517d309b8c0ead048c621cce8c7,efe802c6b1c257d9a40d7035ce1fa807</data>\n      <data key="d6">3</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">423</data>\n      <data key="d5">fd7d94fbab084bc380480abeef6bfade</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;O.&#1041;. &#1040;&#1063;&#1040;&#1057;&#1054;&#1042;&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"O.&#1041;. &#1040;&#1095;&#1072;&#1089;&#1086;&#1074; is an author who wrote a report on the balanced development of components in the VKO system."</data>\n      <data key="d2">59000e6206d2f11d502e8016a145b2e4</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">424</data>\n      <data key="d5">cfb915c95caf41c6a25e99a9f37f03a2</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;&#1070;.&#1040;. &#1055;&#1045;&#1063;&#1040;&#1058;&#1053;&#1054;&#1042;&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"&#1070;.&#1040;. &#1055;&#1077;&#1095;&#1072;&#1090;&#1085;&#1086;&#1074; is an author who wrote several reports on strategic deterrence and the effectiveness of weapons."</data>\n      <data key="d2">59000e6206d2f11d502e8016a145b2e4</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">425</data>\n      <data key="d5">8815ed80f9b741dbb458d902024f34a4</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;&#1056;.&#1043;. &#1058;&#1040;&#1043;&#1048;&#1056;&#1054;&#1042;&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">R.G. Tagirov is a co-author with Ye.A. Pech. He is also an author of a publication about the effectiveness of precision-guided weapons in deterring aggression against Russia. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">59000e6206d2f11d502e8016a145b2e4,fb4f9673dbfede5d5f60d7de9e63a083</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">426</data>\n      <data key="d5">dddb831546354e088d29aebd154e3a31</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;REPORT&quot;">\n      <data key="d0" />\n      <data key="d1" />\n      <data key="d2">59000e6206d2f11d502e8016a145b2e4</data>\n      <data key="d3">2</data>\n      <data key="d4">427</data>\n      <data key="d5">005d2154da754b21adcd90ac921bd5f7</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;&#1070;.&#1040;. &#1055;&#1045;&#1063;&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"&#1070;.&#1040;. &#1055;&#1077;&#1095; is an author of a publication about the effectiveness of precision-guided weapons in deterring aggression against Russia."</data>\n      <data key="d2">fb4f9673dbfede5d5f60d7de9e63a083</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">428</data>\n      <data key="d5">711ba818354546cea69f1532b92a2f26</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;&#1057;&#1058;&#1056;&#1040;&#1058;&#1045;&#1043;&#1048;&#1063;&#1045;&#1057;&#1050;&#1040;&#1071; &#1057;&#1058;&#1040;&#1041;&#1048;&#1051;&#1068;&#1053;&#1054;&#1057;&#1058;&#1068;&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"&#1057;&#1090;&#1088;&#1072;&#1090;&#1077;&#1075;&#1080;&#1095;&#1077;&#1089;&#1082;&#1072;&#1103; &#1057;&#1090;&#1072;&#1073;&#1080;&#1083;&#1100;&#1085;&#1086;&#1089;&#1090;&#1100; (Strategic Stability)" is a journal that focuses on strategic stability and arms control. It publishes articles on military and political issues, including works by authors like V.I. Kovalev and S.Yu. Malkov who explore potential approaches to forming a \'systemic configurator\'. The journal has also published articles by A.I. Turchin, A.V. Oseledsky, and A.L. Khryapin on various topics, including the effectiveness of precision-guided weapons. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">41e4c3296d7d78d51200037f4bccd7ff,5d54cccef5b1c89928a5cabc002bdec4,97115a0336caf22a9db0b37f213c46ae,d1fcf88891f6c2a0f72d55f9ab93b598,e3df8104fa72dbdb7f739ecdc4d6b532,fa7d09393909bab8787423373e5574cd,fb4f9673dbfede5d5f60d7de9e63a083</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">429</data>\n      <data key="d5">5c4d8a8f9c104176b87d2bfdf04ae0bd</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;THEORY OF WARFARE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Korybko\'s theory focuses on nonviolent and violent overthrow methods."</data>\n      <data key="d2">a66026abef50d4b6b00ca0f933f6be0f</data>\n      <data key="d6">3</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">430</data>\n      <data key="d5">5a781604f1fb4719b730f43f534627f6</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;UNCONVENTIONAL WARFARE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Unconventional Warfare is a violent method of regime change. It is considered a "hard" approach, contrasting with less forceful methods like Color Revolutions.  Unconventional Warfare involves a hard coup, aiming to violently overthrow an existing regime. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">4a396711762b9d23dfa301a027d2737e,6b82eafaf18f777bfa19dd36a0a5c327,788b86755c01b24e39ed41a0dd120038,a66026abef50d4b6b00ca0f933f6be0f</data>\n      <data key="d6">3</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">431</data>\n      <data key="d5">ecdc1020b10e49ca869d399825e16fa3</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;SPUTNIK&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Sputnik is a government-run international news agency. It is used by Russia to increase its global information presence.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">46a8120d658a422a13cbf4af4bac874c,a7f0f3bd43f5142bb1728f4adacde5b0,be14354d183b860e7bd2a06d1c731a17</data>\n      <data key="d6">0</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">432</data>\n      <data key="d5">0d8fde01d7234726a00d7e73e2e01d66</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;RT&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">RT is an international news organization operated by Russia. It is often described as being used for information warfare.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">46a8120d658a422a13cbf4af4bac874c,a7f0f3bd43f5142bb1728f4adacde5b0,be14354d183b860e7bd2a06d1c731a17</data>\n      <data key="d6">0</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">433</data>\n      <data key="d5">9c4bd60958fd4e09a6d5b9e2ab163b5a</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;RUSSIAN ELECTIONS OF 2011-12&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The **Russian Elections of 2011-12** were a series of political elections held in Russia. These elections were marked by widespread protests and allegations of social media manipulation, contributing to significant unrest throughout the country.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">8c989fc0d3fc136d27a9f97d0fe40c82,a7f0f3bd43f5142bb1728f4adacde5b0,be14354d183b860e7bd2a06d1c731a17</data>\n      <data key="d6">6</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">434</data>\n      <data key="d5">39d31f770cf740e78d526a2e1101a1db</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;INTERNET RESEARCH AGENCY&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The Internet Research Agency is a Russian organization created to combat international grassroots dissent.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">46a8120d658a422a13cbf4af4bac874c,a7f0f3bd43f5142bb1728f4adacde5b0,be14354d183b860e7bd2a06d1c731a17</data>\n      <data key="d6">0</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">435</data>\n      <data key="d5">9d282b2250f7408888504f1f93c202a8</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;MILITARY DOCTRINE (2010)&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"The 2010 Military Doctrine stated that information warfare could achieve political objectives without the use of force."</data>\n      <data key="d2">a7f0f3bd43f5142bb1728f4adacde5b0</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">436</data>\n      <data key="d5">c063484895794a0eaae1b0ff070ad4c9</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;CONCEPTUAL VIEWS (2011)&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"The 2011 Conceptual Views saw it as the armed forces\' task to counter information interference in internal affairs."</data>\n      <data key="d2">a7f0f3bd43f5142bb1728f4adacde5b0</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">437</data>\n      <data key="d5">e8868920e21b4431aad16e86db977ecb</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;BURENOK&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Burenok is a prominent military theorist who argues that information warfare has fundamentally altered the nature of conflict. He emphasizes that global communications have significantly amplified the potential for information warfare, making it a crucial aspect of modern military strategy.  His insights are considered significant within military circles, as he is frequently mentioned alongside influential figures like Gerasimov and Kartapolov in discussions about information warfare. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">16a295a1b82cfcc452e208d5c3376783,3060e5a3570413999878edce8065dc2b,5203622b4d84751d0ad97a36c65aa7cf,54e5f6035998ada7e8e6f4188995aec5,a1d5b70180c35b1c12fa0a5a6e0f0a8a</data>\n      <data key="d6">8</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">8</data>\n      <data key="d4">438</data>\n      <data key="d5">aea3378bfff842e5b3f4b7a4b55b3879</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;MILITARY DOCTRINES AND SECURITY STRATEGIES&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Military Doctrines and Security Strategies" is a document or set of documents that outlines military strategies and security approaches.  It also discusses attempts to influence Russia\'s psychological situation. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">12ae590d68b54130fcdd8b11cda495b2,3ff11360ddc5bd1fa296a784da747a6e</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">439</data>\n      <data key="d5">d562223c17d948bf98e34b4d97dde932</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;VLADIMIR MAKHONIN&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Vladimir Makhonin is a Russian historian known for proposing a terminological hierarchy for understanding war and armed conflict.  This hierarchy aims to provide a more nuanced and comprehensive framework for analyzing different types of warfare. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">12ae590d68b54130fcdd8b11cda495b2,3ff11360ddc5bd1fa296a784da747a6e</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">440</data>\n      <data key="d5">cde2d75c51d245879265b79d14b8699b</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;CHEKINOV AND BODGANOV&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Chekinov and Bodganov are theorists who view war as a condition that allows for various means, including armed violence."</data>\n      <data key="d2">3ff11360ddc5bd1fa296a784da747a6e</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">441</data>\n      <data key="d5">44594467054849d4a1fadb46ddd51641</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;MAKHONIN&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Makhonin is a theorist who views war as the most intense form of fighting and social conflict as the legitimizing factor."</data>\n      <data key="d2">4962674ec4e70cd78efe6b3ee6d8fdab,e40ae7e84e084d721b89cfac3b1f4448</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">442</data>\n      <data key="d5">2918130221f94f4387da049b647bfe6a</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;THE STATE OF WAR&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"The state of war refers to a condition that precedes the application of armed conflict, suggesting a broader context beyond physical violence."</data>\n      <data key="d2">4962674ec4e70cd78efe6b3ee6d8fdab</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">443</data>\n      <data key="d5">fd139ac75b0e4777ab67b7423eaaa37f</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;ARMED CONFLICT&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">**Armed Conflict** is the central topic of discussion, with various perspectives exploring its definition and scope. While it is presented as one tool used within the broader context of war,  armed conflict itself takes center stage in the analysis. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">489aeca592784f5f7be0a754beb4f575,4962674ec4e70cd78efe6b3ee6d8fdab,818993a678a84051e60563bfd33f106a</data>\n      <data key="d6">9</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">444</data>\n      <data key="d5">a701c349eb7142d48ba7efad89caf9d2</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;PSYCHOLOGICAL WARFARE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Psychological Warfare is a tactic that utilizes mental and emotional manipulation as a tool in conflict. It aims to influence the minds and emotions of enemy populations, seeking to undermine their morale and will to fight.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">be99ed0e0a0f22dc215ec3d77e26d299,faeec4fac390184ebb4bfcfdefc13e11</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">445</data>\n      <data key="d5">e5d40a1b17f74b1db5d18279caedb04a</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;MILITARY AVIATION&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Military aviation marked a shift in warfare to three-dimensional combat."</data>\n      <data key="d2">3090c7597ab8b380afd48c1498709019</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">446</data>\n      <data key="d5">de25d06733d04385825ee082792f5e52</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;SUBVERSION-WAR&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Subversion-War, a concept developed by Messner, is a type of warfare where psychological factors dominate, blurring the lines between army and population.  It is characterized by indirect actions that incite internal conflict within a society, leading to widespread participation and making it difficult to distinguish between combatants and civilians. Subversion-war primarily relies on psychological manipulation to achieve its goals. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">3090c7597ab8b380afd48c1498709019,69ab3a134854d40cbd893d37335cd7a2,6f3507b03c5fb34990029b28366363fe,83b0087e03908565fbbc54e5d4e331b1,d0b738b8d19afd8178c28b7e67d984cd</data>\n      <data key="d6">15</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">447</data>\n      <data key="d5">32f6f11a7845416b8c6eb9fb0b382140</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;THREE-DIMENSIONAL COMBAT&quot;">\n      <data key="d0" />\n      <data key="d1" />\n      <data key="d2">3090c7597ab8b380afd48c1498709019</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">448</data>\n      <data key="d5">91407be8c3e54e23918d3a7183d962db</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;COERCION&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">**Coercion** is a form of influence used to compel an actor to do something against their will. It involves the use of force or threats to influence someone\'s behavior, often employed as a pressure and influence tactic in asymmetrical approaches. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">245c8a66b7fbfb155c4ea1253d66dad9,37a79c861cb20a05659b6f1b76b007ba,92697f6a162cf0b8f900c0eb43d28c12,b66af13f988a23c8b2bc220bcf3a76c9</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">449</data>\n      <data key="d5">3831134696584d83bbf676a6b3bfa8f9</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;DETERRENCE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">**DETERRENCE** is a key concept in Russian military theory and policy, aiming to prevent adversaries from taking actions harmful to Russia.  It is a military strategy that involves the threat of force to discourage aggression. Deterrence aims to prevent attacks by making them too costly for the aggressor through the threat of retaliation. This strategy seeks to preserve the status quo by threatening negative consequences if an actor takes a certain action, ultimately aiming to prevent escalation and de-escalate hostilities. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">245c8a66b7fbfb155c4ea1253d66dad9,5acd5cef8f86988b25ee5ea4db51d835,8651bdb6a227bf3bca82a80a06ed712a,92697f6a162cf0b8f900c0eb43d28c12,a1cbb5a09e483e3cc680f9262e2348ed,db516a1ced78fde051a32a1c881c6b6b,fcf565288501279df280096beb7c6d3a</data>\n      <data key="d6">10</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">2</data>\n      <data key="d4">450</data>\n      <data key="d5">50e512a5dbe941f5af68bfdf74b1c3c0</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;COMPELLENCE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">COMPELLENCE is the effort to change the status quo by using force or threats of negative consequences to compel an adversary to take a specific action.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">245c8a66b7fbfb155c4ea1253d66dad9,92697f6a162cf0b8f900c0eb43d28c12</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">451</data>\n      <data key="d5">edc717747e904728b57185f5013461f9</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;GEORG HEGEL&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Georg Hegel was a philosopher known for his idealistic metaphysics.  His ideas were, however, rejected by proponents of dialectical materialism and are described as having been discarded by some. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">645ce27900f66a0b633be93f0e5d6399,e8980bd806b32ffd5ad4b169a299338d</data>\n      <data key="d6">12</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">452</data>\n      <data key="d5">8fba1fea719d49d380ac2d9c310d68b3</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;CRITICAL INDUSTRY SYSTEMS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"GEO"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"While not explicitly stated, \'critical industry systems\' likely encompass geographical locations and infrastructure."</data>\n      <data key="d2">b41197b9152dd437072aaed249afab6d</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">453</data>\n      <data key="d5">532da08f04f645708e747c57e9c4ee05</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;TABLE 7&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Table 7 is mentioned as a source of information about the breakdown of critical industry systems."</data>\n      <data key="d2">b41197b9152dd437072aaed249afab6d</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">454</data>\n      <data key="d5">3cf0ab4cf14e47ddabd49d500a3dc488</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;GRECHKO AND OGARKOV&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">GRECHKO AND OGARKOV are authors known for their collaborative work on The Soviet Military Encyclopedia.  In 1976, they co-authored a publication that highlighted the significance of diverse military assets, encompassing both traditional armed forces and other strategic elements, in modern warfare. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">29f93a094c1a402300a4534f45b1e2a2,c03cb503d15d806465177d74c09c8bbc</data>\n      <data key="d6">14</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">455</data>\n      <data key="d5">a39b72f8921f43ef8ef295c7cc8f7294</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;VOYENNYY ENTSIKLOPEDICHESKIY SLOVAR&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"The 1986 military encyclopedia defined armed struggle as the main form of war."</data>\n      <data key="d2">c03cb503d15d806465177d74c09c8bbc</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">456</data>\n      <data key="d5">9f5adbeb6cf04f089abe78d86cfa6aba</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;KALISTRATOV&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">KALISTRATOV is a theorist who argues for an expansive definition of war, encompassing domains beyond armed violence.  He supports this view by citing sources such as the 1986 military encyclopedia in his 2004 work. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">313dc3be1190b1a10a2579c621091156,7be505fea57e0dbd921a3c195dd29aac,c03cb503d15d806465177d74c09c8bbc</data>\n      <data key="d6">9</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">457</data>\n      <data key="d5">efb6350e65964659bc20396c0166b296</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;KANEVSKY AND SHABARDIN&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Military theorists Kanevsky and Shabardin argued that war included nonmilitary means."</data>\n      <data key="d2">c03cb503d15d806465177d74c09c8bbc</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">458</data>\n      <data key="d5">e095cc36da784300b27c6f8c60a96440</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;B. K. KANEVSKY&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">B. K. Kanevsky is a military theorist who argues that war encompasses nonmilitary means.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">30386c4e76d744b895d430847b713f0a,39786aa4012dd6b57506633a91deaeca</data>\n      <data key="d6">9</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">2</data>\n      <data key="d4">459</data>\n      <data key="d5">c68893ca39d74ba08c6eb138f24441e1</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;P. N. SHABARDIN&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">P. N. Shabardin is a military theorist who argues that war encompasses nonmilitary means.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">30386c4e76d744b895d430847b713f0a,39786aa4012dd6b57506633a91deaeca</data>\n      <data key="d6">9</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">2</data>\n      <data key="d4">460</data>\n      <data key="d5">472b23bb92834173b4118d101040c726</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;NIKOLAI MAKAROV&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Nikolai Makarov is a prominent figure in Russian military thought, often mentioned in discussions surrounding hybrid warfare doctrines. While his direct authorship of the Gerasimov Doctrine is debated, some sources, including scholar Mark Galeotti, suggest he may be a potential originator of similar ideas.  \n\nCurrently serving as Chief of the General Staff, Makarov has publicly echoed arguments made by other military figures like Gorbunov and Bogdanov regarding the increasing effectiveness of non-nuclear weapons. This reinforces his position as a key voice shaping Russia\'s military strategy in the 21st century. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">9a70b285557b0524306162d74f497e03,d0ecd460d53c457bc525cf4f3ba940d2,e97880df6b33eecb3147aea6e798be7d,ef55602335bea29d08150b6649fad897,fe9e4fa83d6dfdca5ffcf8a382fc5ff8</data>\n      <data key="d6">0</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">2</data>\n      <data key="d4">461</data>\n      <data key="d5">81869985b45a4fefbbbb23ea118a3de4</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;CHARLES BARTLES&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Charles Bartles is a critic of the terms \'hybrid warfare\' and \'the Gerasimov doctrine\'."</data>\n      <data key="d2">9a70b285557b0524306162d74f497e03</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">462</data>\n      <data key="d5">42b8584c5a874eb08fbd61f0c18f3ca0</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;POLITICAL OPPOSITION&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"A political opposition is identified as a tool potentially used by external actors to destabilize a target government."</data>\n      <data key="d2">4b4ca426d52b18a71e7dffc4e2b585a1</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">463</data>\n      <data key="d5">824d93d9840a4b7c8b1f31bc6816b497</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;NGOS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">## NGOs: Perceived as Tools of Western Influence and Destabilization\n\nNGOs are widely perceived in Russia as tools used by Western states to influence domestic affairs and destabilize the country.  Descriptions portray NGOs as receiving funding from the West, potentially including foreign governments, and utilizing this financial support to interfere in Russia\'s internal politics. \n\nThis perception is fueled by accusations that NGOs are involved in "color revolutions," a term used to describe pro-democracy uprisings often perceived as Western-backed.  Some descriptions even suggest that NGOs are actively exporting revolutions and playing a significant role in the Russian Military\'s contemporary war strategy. \n\nProminent figures like Putin and Markov view NGOs as political weapons wielded by the West, further solidifying this negative image within Russian discourse.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">02a6df0665914ec51da4921e5dd94d40,4b4ca426d52b18a71e7dffc4e2b585a1,7f0ec47ed2088572385dcc53d6704c97,8178d352e32cb271d8f2c52c29bf60a3,94523d994b1f98cfdb10589452955c12,9c59a1134d84949c9c4c2d4510c2fbfb,c3a70df47396b839b38318aa06ce1cab,dccb84a71d03372398587d309d2898aa,f35ced22e0b916ab11822dd7acc16502</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">464</data>\n      <data key="d5">f209a808f1f04a5699601e672f4abd06</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;WESTERN CONCEPTS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Western concepts are used to understand Russian warfare, but the text suggests a need for alternative perspectives."</data>\n      <data key="d2">0e067e05f9650b52c2d5a35f0b338517</data>\n      <data key="d6">4</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">465</data>\n      <data key="d5">ccb335166f6c4564ac1c61549d8ded50</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;AMBIGUOUS WARFARE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Ambiguous warfare is another term used in the United Kingdom to understand Russian military strategies."</data>\n      <data key="d2">0e067e05f9650b52c2d5a35f0b338517</data>\n      <data key="d6">4</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">466</data>\n      <data key="d5">cbe1a41a82aa4f268e8264568b25938f</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;RUSSIAN WARFARE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0" />\n      <data key="d1">Russian warfare has been a central topic of discussion in recent times, particularly due to its unconventional and hybrid nature as demonstrated in the ongoing conflict in Ukraine.  While some describe Russian military campaigns in Ukraine as successful, indicating a significant military undertaking, others focus on analyzing the unique strategies employed by Russia, especially concerning New Generation Warfare (NGW). The effectiveness and implications of these tactics are subjects of ongoing debate and analysis within military circles and beyond. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">0a127d33c040b6f998a650ee92decc96,0e067e05f9650b52c2d5a35f0b338517,e8b2ce2c1fd2c098e0876122cefde0bb,f1861d38ef28e9efef8df52eaedaaf94</data>\n      <data key="d6">4</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">6</data>\n      <data key="d4">467</data>\n      <data key="d5">28e7639f55ce464c8a080cbb2c745fa2</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;PAVEL ANTONOVICH&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Pavel Antonovich is a chair of electronic warfare in the Russian Combined-Arms Academy, arguing that cyberspace erodes the lines between war and peace."</data>\n      <data key="d2">e40ae7e84e084d721b89cfac3b1f4448</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">468</data>\n      <data key="d5">3f3a2d7aa1294116814f0b4d89baa23d</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;YURI STARODUBTSTEV&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Yuri Starodubtstev is an author who argues that war can be conducted on any scale without a formal declaration. He co-wrote the book "Warfare in the Technosphere" with other authors, where he discussed the nature of modern warfare.  Starodubtstev also contributed to the article "Warfare in the Technosphere," further exploring the concept of technosphere warfare. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">10fe7b26db4d186e285f91ba48b28eac,3335c606e0de431e14afc7e61f86dfa8,e40ae7e84e084d721b89cfac3b1f4448</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">469</data>\n      <data key="d5">3073b33926bd4f33807ffa3befacefaf</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;VLADMIR BUKHARIN&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Vladimir Bukharin is an author known for his work on the nature of modern warfare. He co-authored the book "Warfare in the Technosphere" and contributed to an article of the same name, both exploring the concept of technosphere warfare.  Bukharin argues that war can be conducted on any scale without a formal declaration. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">10fe7b26db4d186e285f91ba48b28eac,3335c606e0de431e14afc7e61f86dfa8,e40ae7e84e084d721b89cfac3b1f4448</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">470</data>\n      <data key="d5">2b916117691c4872a9c4e4888d4fe4ab</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;SERGEI SEMYONOV&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Sergei Semyonov is an author who argues that war can be conducted on any scale without a formal declaration. He co-wrote the book "Warfare in the Technosphere" with other authors, where he discussed the nature of modern warfare.  Semyonov also contributed to an article titled "Warfare in the Technosphere," further exploring the concept of technosphere warfare. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">10fe7b26db4d186e285f91ba48b28eac,3335c606e0de431e14afc7e61f86dfa8,e40ae7e84e084d721b89cfac3b1f4448</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">471</data>\n      <data key="d5">1f7b02bf486e4f42b23e9cb1a63207f3</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;RUSSIAN COMBINED-ARMS ACADEMY&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"The Russian Combined-Arms Academy is where Pavel Antonovich works."</data>\n      <data key="d2">e40ae7e84e084d721b89cfac3b1f4448</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">472</data>\n      <data key="d5">e744c118ae7f4638a01d060bbaedd6e9</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;WARFARE IN THE TECHNOSPHERE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Warfare in the Technosphere is an article that discusses the characteristics of warfare in a technologically advanced environment."</data>\n      <data key="d2">10fe7b26db4d186e285f91ba48b28eac</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">473</data>\n      <data key="d5">e1c1080c717d437996def1a41772d179</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;MARK GALEOTTI&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Mark Galeotti is an analyst who specializes in providing insights into the nature of hybrid warfare. He argues for a distinction between "hybrid war" and "political war," advocating for a broader definition of hybrid warfare that encompasses political warfare.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">30e43423e314a1ec92fb31a8cd093078,e8b2ce2c1fd2c098e0876122cefde0bb,ff33e904e4d9308ef4fac68e0de16f71</data>\n      <data key="d6">3</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">474</data>\n      <data key="d5">63fba9a7c47a4f14ac0bee6bc90d0fea</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;MATTIS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">MATTIS (James Mattis) is a prominent figure in the development and understanding of "hybrid warfare."  He, alongside expert Fred Hoffman, advocated for a four-block war model that encompasses psychological and information operations.  Mattis is recognized as one of the originators of the term "hybrid warfare,"  coining it alongside Hoffman. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">0fa028b232510c552f26de29d99b145b,6cb6b290fc24699cc0581b793cb749cd,ff33e904e4d9308ef4fac68e0de16f71</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">475</data>\n      <data key="d5">6bfc2395b4f54a528a1ebac94a43acb8</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;GEORGE KENNAN&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">George Kennan was a prominent historical figure who famously used the term "political war" during the Cold War.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">1b9b97610a4a892ffd4aa4057f98a99d,c0ae1b35d101dd5c80796ebcaaa52998,ff33e904e4d9308ef4fac68e0de16f71</data>\n      <data key="d6">13</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">2</data>\n      <data key="d4">476</data>\n      <data key="d5">1cce5cebf437428eb1a60dffbdfa603f</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;VIGOR&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">VIGOR is an author cited in the text for presenting Lenin\'s perspective on peace.  They are also cited as providing insights into the Soviet view of war. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">1cce175e6c7003db4a0791abde031a39,beabdeed11a36088777fbee158b3a3f5,c224c7a93362b03f8db7d3e34d1bffc1</data>\n      <data key="d6">9</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">477</data>\n      <data key="d5">dc94039d6643460ca3c66150b9087129</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;SCOTT AND SCOTT&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Scott and Scott are authors cited in the text, discussing the Soviet understanding of peace."</data>\n      <data key="d2">1cce175e6c7003db4a0791abde031a39</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">478</data>\n      <data key="d5">f197d75f159943f8a3ff441199790bc7</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;MARX&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Marx was a theorist who, along with Engels, viewed war as an extension of political and class struggles.  While Marx is mentioned as a figure whose views on war are discussed, it is likely that he never read Clausewitz\'s work. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">1cce175e6c7003db4a0791abde031a39,962347193b87926e833cb5e1de7ff4e2,bab940f0cf76af894b6edb440a57b5f8,bfa15fcd5d4a19aa65f946d1af780d5f</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">479</data>\n      <data key="d5">4d8890c699684c9381105b03b0b41b03</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;ENGELS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">## Engels\n\nEngels, a prominent figure in socialist thought, collaborated with Karl Marx to define war as a continuation of political and class conflicts.  His views on war are widely discussed, particularly his original proposition that the character of war is fundamentally shaped by the prevailing economic system. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">1cce175e6c7003db4a0791abde031a39,bab940f0cf76af894b6edb440a57b5f8,ce0f551566143f746d8ff46f4a021065</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">480</data>\n      <data key="d5">b1658adfa43847eabad1437db235e858</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;JOMINI&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Jomini was a military theorist who was preferred by some, including Karl von Clausewitz himself.  Engels also favored Jomini\'s work over that of Clausewitz. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">1cce175e6c7003db4a0791abde031a39,bfa15fcd5d4a19aa65f946d1af780d5f</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">481</data>\n      <data key="d5">a1773cac7d4c4939aec965660e5015fe</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;TREATY OF BREST-LITOVSK&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"The Treaty of Brest-Litovsk is mentioned as an example of a situation where the class struggle did not require armed conflict."</data>\n      <data key="d2">1cce175e6c7003db4a0791abde031a39</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">482</data>\n      <data key="d5">6a054cb59fb44cf494b93988b5f88833</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;ANTOINE-HENRI JOMINI&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Jomini was a military theorist who was preferred by Clausewitz."</data>\n      <data key="d2">962347193b87926e833cb5e1de7ff4e2</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">483</data>\n      <data key="d5">e7b103a52e384e3e8bf14105223e7e82</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;NONNUCLEAR DETERRENCE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">**Nonnuclear Deterrence** refers to strategies and capabilities designed to discourage an opponent from taking aggressive action without resorting to nuclear weapons. This stage of conflict precedes nuclear escalation, involving conventional weapons and other capabilities to disorganize the opponent.  The ultimate goal is to deter conflict through a system of non-nuclear threats and responses. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">0f4582b567ff65ce5d31d48517e50988,343b764679f62503b91262b7cfb4249b,4a66c9dd8f8b5f5e8f471b728f857c7f</data>\n      <data key="d3">2</data>\n      <data key="d4">484</data>\n      <data key="d5">3f1042452c254cecaf7189e89162adc8</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;STRATEGIC CONVENTIONAL WEAPONS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"TECHNOLOGY"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Strategic Conventional Weapons are military assets utilized in non-nuclear deterrence strategies. Their purpose is to inflict substantial damage upon an adversary, serving as a crucial component within the broader non-nuclear deterrence system.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">0f4582b567ff65ce5d31d48517e50988,343b764679f62503b91262b7cfb4249b</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">485</data>\n      <data key="d5">fd31d549420744d1bd1a6b1112a9a6ba</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;AIR/MISSILE DEFENSE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"TECHNOLOGY"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Air/Missile Defense systems are a component of the non-nuclear deterrence system. They are designed to protect against aerial and missile attacks.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">0f4582b567ff65ce5d31d48517e50988,343b764679f62503b91262b7cfb4249b</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">486</data>\n      <data key="d5">f7ab348030714072a277682b51f7c588</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;OBJECTIVE DAMAGE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"**OBJECTIVE DAMAGE**" refers to quantifiable levels of physical destruction inflicted on an opponent\'s targets.  This measurable damage can be assessed and tracked during engagements. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">0f4582b567ff65ce5d31d48517e50988,4a66c9dd8f8b5f5e8f471b728f857c7f,bd87dc3d58a84509895af40b922940f2</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">487</data>\n      <data key="d5">2139b0906dc541e094138a978d070416</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;SUBJECTIVE DAMAGE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"SUBJECTIVE DAMAGE" refers to perceived or estimated levels of damage, rather than quantifiable physical destruction. This type of damage focuses on influencing leadership and population perceptions through tailored actions that aim to create a sense of insecurity and instability.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">0f4582b567ff65ce5d31d48517e50988,bd87dc3d58a84509895af40b922940f2</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">488</data>\n      <data key="d5">ff5466607e5d4453b1d833629292f664</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;REGIONAL (NUCLEAR) DETERRENCE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Regional (nuclear) deterrence involves the use of nonstrategic nuclear weapons in a regional conflict."</data>\n      <data key="d2">0f4582b567ff65ce5d31d48517e50988</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">489</data>\n      <data key="d5">71f95003936e46a98d90757ffd845d40</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;RETALIATORY STRIKE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"A retaliatory strike is the launch of strategic nuclear weapons in response to an opponent\'s attack on Russian territory."</data>\n      <data key="d2">0f4582b567ff65ce5d31d48517e50988</data>\n      <data key="d3">2</data>\n      <data key="d4">490</data>\n      <data key="d5">bada987ea7da4c939393ee1c3d08ccd4</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;RETALIATORY-MEETING STRIKE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">A **retaliatory-meeting strike** is a Russian military term referring to the launch of strategic nuclear weapons in response to an opponent launching their own weapons. This type of military action specifically involves retaliating against an attack on Russian territory by deploying strategic nuclear weapons.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">0f4582b567ff65ce5d31d48517e50988,446c1ef537e09d2b67aa06e28092aa49,bd87dc3d58a84509895af40b922940f2</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">491</data>\n      <data key="d5">d0a274e7934d446fb91847bb53a961a6</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;CONVENTIONAL LONG-RANGE PRECISION STRIKE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">A **conventional long-range precision strike** is a Russian military term referring to approaches and capabilities that enable Russia to inflict damage on critical targets. These operations utilize conventional weaponry with high accuracy over extended distances.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">446c1ef537e09d2b67aa06e28092aa49,bd87dc3d58a84509895af40b922940f2</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">492</data>\n      <data key="d5">0a799eab61bc4e6b884db6689f9c2c4a</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;NON-CONTACT WARFARE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0" />\n      <data key="d1" />\n      <data key="d2">c1fde4292cf13cc0042a258ed0932fb6</data>\n      <data key="d6">7</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">2</data>\n      <data key="d4">493</data>\n      <data key="d5">8c34cd494a63438dac219c1dc0f73100</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;PSYCHOLOGICAL OFFENSIVE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0" />\n      <data key="d1" />\n      <data key="d2">c1fde4292cf13cc0042a258ed0932fb6</data>\n      <data key="d6">7</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">494</data>\n      <data key="d5">c6f428af0c5e4f629902fd5455bf19ac</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;INFORMATION DOMINANCE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0" />\n      <data key="d1" />\n      <data key="d2">c1fde4292cf13cc0042a258ed0932fb6</data>\n      <data key="d6">7</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">495</data>\n      <data key="d5">d1fd271d16c348019c2fcced762b35a2</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;WAR CLASSIFICATION&quot;">\n      <data key="d0" />\n      <data key="d1" />\n      <data key="d2">4640d14036dc3924713f8e3da33466d6</data>\n      <data key="d6">9</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">496</data>\n      <data key="d5">ffa128c9c0c84d39bad1bba8cfa4adc5</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;WAR DEFINITION&quot;">\n      <data key="d0" />\n      <data key="d1" />\n      <data key="d2">4640d14036dc3924713f8e3da33466d6</data>\n      <data key="d6">9</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">497</data>\n      <data key="d5">058f66cc356b43cc9433bd3c8d57fa46</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;2000S&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"The 2000s is a period during which Gareyev held his traditional view on war."</data>\n      <data key="d2">e847464375c697471e8db8e76b49b6d1</data>\n      <data key="d6">5</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">498</data>\n      <data key="d5">ff74091eaba246698fcae59c21eec828</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;US INFORMATION WARFARE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0" />\n      <data key="d1" />\n      <data key="d2">4029a673e4a82185b802f0ac1cd07c9c</data>\n      <data key="d6">11</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">499</data>\n      <data key="d5">f6cbbf1b8f4b48a28a16e4dd8976b9bb</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;RUSSIAN INTERPRETATION OF INFORMATIONAL STRUGGLE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"The Russian interpretation of informational struggle comprises both digital-technological and cognitive-psychological components."</data>\n      <data key="d2">4029a673e4a82185b802f0ac1cd07c9c</data>\n      <data key="d6">0</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">500</data>\n      <data key="d5">757ca40654d5476aa949a26b733be8d4</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;REFLEXIVE CONTROL&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Reflexive Control is a strategy employed in informational struggle where information is carefully tailored to influence an adversary\'s decision-making.  The goal is to guide the adversary towards actions that are beneficial to the controlling side by manipulating their perception of reality and essentially forcing them to act according to a false reality. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">4029a673e4a82185b802f0ac1cd07c9c,941d7903cf338bd149d976e02ef360e3,f1a146e421e297be23156a46a12345c5</data>\n      <data key="d6">0</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">501</data>\n      <data key="d5">539d55e7c42e44b59d98f59fae3e0ee1</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;MORAL-PSYCHOLOGICAL SUPPRESSION&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Moral-psychological suppression is identified as a tactic aimed at influencing the adversary\'s morale and social consciousness."</data>\n      <data key="d2">f1a146e421e297be23156a46a12345c5</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">502</data>\n      <data key="d5">3785eeadea9042bfb2e50f16c0397a12</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;US INTELLIGENCE SERVICES&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The US intelligence services are mentioned as having mastered techniques of psychological manipulation.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">68e4ed89f41a580e3c58f0f98434cc33,6b6ac6cc3ec6eac44948fcf6afcb38d9,beb665481df870fd27048e10898e8bac</data>\n      <data key="d6">6</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">503</data>\n      <data key="d5">48cd97f2297143e09d61ff2a8542c0c5</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;GEORGIA, UKRAINE, AND KYRGYZSTAN&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"GEO"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"These countries are mentioned as locations where color revolutions took place, potentially influenced by US psychological warfare."</data>\n      <data key="d2">68e4ed89f41a580e3c58f0f98434cc33</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">504</data>\n      <data key="d5">ff95eb0d5f7f49b782027d5c7ae3c3fe</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;THE MILITARY ENCYCLOPEDIA&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"THE MILITARY ENCYCLOPEDIA" is a source that has been criticized by scholars Chekinov and Bogdanov for its outdated definitions.  Specifically, the encyclopedia has drawn criticism for its understanding of both armed strategy and the concept of "color revolutions." \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">bd0d9bfb86c0dbbc88767c3e5a743934,cb50fafd31d07b9e8f9e52f658937913</data>\n      <data key="d6">6</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">505</data>\n      <data key="d5">086da554db5b4ad5806aedeb0024197c</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;WARS OF CONTROLLED CHAOS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Wars of Controlled Chaos are a type of warfare described by Chekinov and Bogdanov."</data>\n      <data key="d2">cb50fafd31d07b9e8f9e52f658937913</data>\n      <data key="d6">6</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">506</data>\n      <data key="d5">216ee8a907a0466a88b27f8ada19ffa0</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;ARMED STRATEGY&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Armed Strategy refers to the planning and execution of military operations."</data>\n      <data key="d2">cb50fafd31d07b9e8f9e52f658937913</data>\n      <data key="d6">6</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">507</data>\n      <data key="d5">6fefb317687d4ac98efe39a52f3e190f</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;MILITARY AND NONMILITARY MEASURES&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Military and Nonmilitary Measures refer to the tools used in modern warfare, including both traditional military force and non-violent methods."</data>\n      <data key="d2">cb50fafd31d07b9e8f9e52f658937913</data>\n      <data key="d6">6</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">508</data>\n      <data key="d5">320d9d91238948a8be67972ccceab878</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;CIVIC CHAMBER OF THE RUSSIAN FEDERATION&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The **Civic Chamber of the Russian Federation** was established by the Russian government with the stated purpose of serving as a consultative platform for civil society.  It aimed to provide a space for civil society organizations to engage with legislative processes and contribute their perspectives. However, critics argue that while presented as a platform for diverse voices, the Civic Chamber was largely populated with pro-Kremlin activists, raising questions about its genuine commitment to representing the full spectrum of Russian civil society. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">7c2ddfba3167a0d0ec8a949e6ee0bae4,b50799a7304451430d84c0212b504cf4,ddeb1ebdd49c6838e2b7396a635666f9</data>\n      <data key="d3">2</data>\n      <data key="d4">509</data>\n      <data key="d5">bdcbcccadd474b3bbe9a8f56c811bab4</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;VLADIMIR FROLOV&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Vladimir Frolov is a political analyst who argues that Russia faces a new phenomenon of \'Democracy by Remote Control\' where outside factors influence elections."</data>\n      <data key="d2">ddeb1ebdd49c6838e2b7396a635666f9</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">510</data>\n      <data key="d5">f127fc4d87f94794be89134406ba0694</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;FEAR OF COLOR REVOLUTIONS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0" />\n      <data key="d1" />\n      <data id="&quot;COUNTERING OPPOSITION NGOS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0" />\n      <data key="d1" />\n      <data key="d2">ddeb1ebdd49c6838e2b7396a635666f9</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">512</data>\n      <data key="d5">dab39f92d0ed468c80699f28c05c45fa</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;DEMOCRACY BY REMOTE CONTROL&quot;">\n      <data key="d0" />\n      <data key="d1" />\n      <data key="d2">ddeb1ebdd49c6838e2b7396a635666f9</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">513</data>\n      <data key="d5">3076f330d121489aa50964ce54a3b1ac</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;WESTERN NGOS, MASS MEDIA, ELECTION OBSERVATION MISSIONS, AND WESTERN COUNTRIES\' POLITICAL LEADERSHIP&quot;">\n      <data key="d0" />\n      <data key="d1" />\n      <data key="d2">ddeb1ebdd49c6838e2b7396a635666f9</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">514</data>\n      <data key="d5">c8e5d3afdcb54c8589e280f0c4a87417</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;OUTSIDE FACTORS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0" />\n      <data key="d1" />\n      <data key="d2">ddeb1ebdd49c6838e2b7396a635666f9</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">515</data>\n      <data key="d5">f3d30627e19245649e497ab49bf0fa30</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;CIS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"The CIS is mentioned as the location where elections are taking place and subject to outside interference."</data>\n      <data key="d2">59de865b0e3fe3900acaf6cf5b316e32</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">516</data>\n      <data key="d5">e3f1098c3d984bc7b5f30b9c0101f7a6</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;FROLOV&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Frolov is an individual who argues that elections in the CIS were influenced by external factors."</data>\n      <data key="d2">59de865b0e3fe3900acaf6cf5b316e32</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">517</data>\n      <data key="d5">24b4a5f4db67418cbfa08c5316f0ab51</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;FRIDMAN&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Fridman is an author who specializes in analyzing Western and Russian military thought, particularly focusing on the concept of hybrid warfare. He defines "gibridnaya voina" (hybrid war) as primarily non-military and non-violent,  and provides an overview of its origins in 2018. Fridman explores three distinct meanings of the term within the context of Russian military theory and offers an interpretation of Messner\'s concept of "subversion-war," citing Messner\'s views on the subject.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">0fa028b232510c552f26de29d99b145b,39b41cfcdca61ad353853416d904417f,6b408afcf04121f1365ead7989dc8265,8ff62159c1783829c0c32453f17c18ce,9b9ff0b9cc19b0ace380f06dff0ce7bd,aa5d990b03c9214c4c3a37412d5cf0d1,d760565312fa739ff154c8ebd38fe95d,f9cd1d8b7cbb13deeabb75de223a5c6c</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">518</data>\n      <data key="d5">e4b707e3e6964197855b82fc66ef59e7</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;HYBRID WARFARE (GIBRIDNAYA VOINA)&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Hybrid Warfare is a concept that encompasses both military and non-military means, often debated in the context of Russian military strategy."</data>\n      <data key="d2">aa5d990b03c9214c4c3a37412d5cf0d1</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">519</data>\n      <data key="d5">109b8be5a8ee4180a1465cd23f019d7b</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;WESTERN CONCEPT&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"The term \'Hybrid Warfare\' originates from Western military thought."</data>\n      <data key="d2">452741c3c9d866e070dc0fcef9650ce1</data>\n      <data key="d6">4</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">520</data>\n      <data key="d5">49f771e31a0c4b35bc39e389f3623509</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;RASIN&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Rasin was a Colonel Professor who corresponded with Stalin about the obsolescence of Clausewitz. He is identified as asking Stalin this very question, demonstrating his interest in military strategy and its evolution. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">11b09d5fddbfffd21c2a75e43b225a4a,38c01208da0359baa45c7640d7a2285c,cca1605d479526e189239aac472c3e7e</data>\n      <data key="d6">9</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">521</data>\n      <data key="d5">aa946d4379694a74ba0da37e69d2810a</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;MARXIST THEORY&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Marxist theory is referenced by Stalin as a framework that already contained elements similar to Clausewitz\'s ideas."</data>\n      <data key="d2">38c01208da0359baa45c7640d7a2285c</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">522</data>\n      <data key="d5">268446fc52a54fd2837f73aeb3e0b74f</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;BYELY ET AL.&quot; &quot;">\n      <data key="d0" />\n      <data key="d1" />\n      <data key="d2">38c01208da0359baa45c7640d7a2285c</data>\n      <data key="d6">9</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">523</data>\n      <data key="d5">f6ddfa8491ff40d2839bb5b2e105df22</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;MARXIST-LENINIST&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Marxist-Leninism is a political ideology and its adherents who critique Clausewitz\'s views on war.  It defines war as an instrument of class politics, viewing it as an extension of class struggle driven by economic factors. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">2f7216242ac705ab8c989c77c74d477b,39786aa4012dd6b57506633a91deaeca,a15ef9eda68738122db496f9962d6a9f,ce0f551566143f746d8ff46f4a021065</data>\n      <data key="d6">9</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">524</data>\n      <data key="d5">db1295504da645b69d9786d54f233fed</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;ALEKSANDR GOLTS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Aleksandr Golts is an analyst who interprets the Russian Military Doctrine."</data>\n      <data This encompasses a range of approaches, including both nuclear and non-nuclear means, aimed at exerting influence and achieving strategic objectives.  Russia continually adapts its methods for coercion to suit its evolving geopolitical goals. " \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">68a51313b3812e3e2ae80473d4579a10,76cf5235d2951a7ebc83ee3405ddf7e6,a177fa4c59ed4683722f6e27877728db</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">536</data>\n      <data key="d5">66689accdd974295b7eb779e43578748</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;NUCLEAR DETERRENCE CONCEPT&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The **NUCLEAR DETERRENCE CONCEPT** is a traditional military strategy employed by nations like Russia, and others, to prevent conflict. This strategy relies on the threat of nuclear retaliation as a deterrent against potential aggressors.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">68a51313b3812e3e2ae80473d4579a10,76cf5235d2951a7ebc83ee3405ddf7e6</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">537</data>\n      <data key="d5">6b49c78aa1524609ab7aa74aeaa3e01d</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;INFORMATIONAL DETERRENCE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">**INFORMATIONAL DETERRENCE** refers to the use of information warfare strategies to dissuade adversaries from aggression. It involves employing information and propaganda to influence adversary behavior and decision-making, shaping perceptions and discouraging hostile actions.  This strategy aims to deter adversaries through the strategic dissemination of information and influence operations. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">23a741082731d52f254cf6d6f54eb58c,68a51313b3812e3e2ae80473d4579a10,76cf5235d2951a7ebc83ee3405ddf7e6,a177fa4c59ed4683722f6e27877728db</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">538</data>\n      <data key="d5">7ff31ce54f424f0bbb297b0b3ba7c757</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;RUSSIAN MILITARY EXPERTS AND DEFENCE INTELLECTUALS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"These individuals contribute to the development and discussion of Russian military doctrine and strategies."</data>\n      <data key="d2">68a51313b3812e3e2ae80473d4579a10</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">539</data>\n      <data key="d5">bac51e00d486420c8e91e824d8e17411</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;MILITARY THREAT&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Military threat refers to the potential danger posed by armed forces."</data>\n      <data key="d2">1507b417cf61f29030428f95a1c2dc08</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">540</data>\n      <data key="d5">4adee3aad6524a4aa4c4711c1ee05e64</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;PRESIDENT PUTIN&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Vladimir Putin is the President of Russia and a key figure in Russian politics. He views "color revolutions" as a threat to Russia\'s interests and believes that Russia is engaged in an information war perpetrated by the West. Putin holds significant influence on Russia\'s perception of information warfare, seeing it as effective as nuclear weapons.  He has delivered speeches at events like the Munich Conference on Security Policy, outlining his views on democracy promotion and foreign influence. Putin also expressed concerns about the increasing potency of non-nuclear weapons. In 2012, he repeated the arguments of Gorbunov and Bogdanov, warning of color revolutions and controlled chaos as tools of information warfare.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">1eef68cba1ae051b37f22f0f0ca7f0db,31c36375a76ddae90fef30da9e17ed10,3ecc874d513039a384221cb07d625267,4825db8d9e31e39efc9a58ed4d38e842,677c7a0f4f60503badb0a4d899c21d74,7762d8e435ee0e72467ae2468b71323e,d0ecd460d53c457bc525cf4f3ba940d2,d42b29aa1834c31d91de6f4e73a98edd,ef55602335bea29d08150b6649fad897,f9b181b3ff2171e547897575c5e4d562</data>\n      <data key="d6">7</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">4</data>\n      <data key="d4">541</data>\n      <data key="d5">d034e4fd8ac849278e658daad1a1f033</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;ARAB SPRING UPRISINGS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"The Arab Spring Uprisings are included in the Russian understanding of Color Revolutions."</data>\n      <data key="d2">7762d8e435ee0e72467ae2468b71323e</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">542</data>\n      <data key="d5">091e998370dd42d1b05ab0fcf6595a7e</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;RUSSIAN SOURCES&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Russian sources are a group that provides information and perspectives on Hybrid Warfare, often referencing Western military doctrine in their analyses. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">39a622d83f06e92566ff2e6cfa3daf49,b97617707d0f13c32b85f07ae1407b77</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">543</data>\n      <data key="d5">1e6cabc18fab4c048281fd29d3044438</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;HW&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"HW", also known as Hybrid Warfare, is a military doctrine or approach. It is sometimes presented as a potential model for understanding strategy and military tactics.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">105a9d11085365005b931d85b5c84b21,1c8fed726b2eb22fb2e268caa1aa9993</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">547</data>\n      <data key="d5">43c68f9a86654a32a2215e23957ed184</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;CHIEF OF THE GENERAL STAFF GERASIMOV&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Chief of the General Staff Gerasimov is identified as a prominent figure who echoes Borduzha\'s views on information warfare.
