is a publication where Yuri Baluevsky\'s article was published."</data>\n      <data key="d2">814d01dee6c26955ba331054e16cf406</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">558</data>\n      <data key="d5">432a6b4962544200949421a96a405142</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;NGOS, PRIVATE MILITARY COMPANIES&quot;">\n      <data key="d0" />\n      <data key="d1" />\n      <data key="d2">b04e155024b2e24838d7dba80a934c81</data>\n      <data key="d6">3</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">2</data>\n      <data key="d4">559</data>\n      <data key="d5">d6700b360ac141d282cdb567414bf4ce</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;NEW TYPE OF WAR&quot;">\n      <data key="d0" />\n      <data key="d1" />\n      <data key="d2">137a23ec0a6c30f2d104480a42ca716b,9d078dbf3cd9f132d9d452509bd774f1</data>\n      <data key="d6">1</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">2</data>\n      <data key="d4">560</data>\n      <data key="d5">c1b40a4039b44061a358e098867f7412</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;CHANGING NATURE OF WAR&quot;">\n      <data key="d0" />\n      <data key="d1" />\n      <data key="d2">9d078dbf3cd9f132d9d452509bd774f1</data>\n      <data key="d6">3</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">561</data>\n      <data key="d5">4643a7a319674adfb732b6f6122c7c64</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;ARMED FORCES&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The **Armed Forces** are a key component of a nation\'s security, responsible for ensuring its protection through both direct combat and non-military means. They play a crucial role in achieving political objectives, whether through military action or other strategies.  In the context of modern warfare, the Armed Forces are the primary focus of discussion surrounding new and evolving conflict paradigms. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">5bb2f411436cd9fd01cf7697e33fec75,8258163684c3a3818b26452a49f704d7,ba928bad7ff0a2b238ebf26ae921d1ec,e0724c55bdd96aee3b57fa207b1c1d50</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">562</data>\n      <data key="d5">46e8056fb2ec4811ab33cb34a0dc9fb3</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;CRIMEA&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"GEO"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Crimea is a territory that was annexed by Russia in 2014, a move that triggered international condemnation.  Russia has used the annexation of Crimea to demonstrate its military capabilities and to criticize "color revolutions," as exemplified by Putin\'s speech on the topic following the event.  Historically, Crimea was also the site of British-French aggression in the 1850s. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">21a07c1b9dcad76a185aa038ee84add1,730c4f20ab1db06c8867021b10267a04,ba4314d7dde31a9a3de140b03d964db0,e3f78e84ba947ada447e7a0b46389605,f1861d38ef28e9efef8df52eaedaaf94</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">563</data>\n      <data key="d5">8b57a9f43a1942a49b58cf881835f974</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;WESTERN PARTNERS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Western Partners is a term used by Vladimir Putin to describe a group of nations or organizations that he views as adversaries.  Putin perceives these Western partners as crossing lines and promoting values that challenge Russia. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">1c170b6b1c8851bba14e24b8af15b481,9a2dcbe9b0d27f8917dd3fe660260425</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">564</data>\n      <data key="d5">f78b01b0d93948c283644ec58f7be74a</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;RUSSIAN EXPERT COMMUNITY&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The **RUSSIAN EXPERT COMMUNITY** is a group of individuals who provide analysis and recommendations on foreign policy and military matters in Russia. Their contributions were instrumental in shaping the 2014 doctrine, as their ideas were codified into its framework.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">aa03b6e282108dde3478fcc4128e19d0,cdaf5991490e5afcb16ad8cfae5d9fe5</data>\n      <data key="d6">1</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">565</data>\n      <data key="d5">8dbe8f9867e4448f998416c18923eac4</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;PRECISION CONVENTIONAL MUNITIONS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"TECHNOLOGY"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Precision conventional munitions are a tool used in non-nuclear deterrence to inflict damage on adversary targets."</data>\n      <data key="d2">cdaf5991490e5afcb16ad8cfae5d9fe5</data>\n      <data key="d6">1</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">566</data>\n      <data key="d5">fe8ea8bf1395434393e04e8f7a33025f</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;FORCE DEMONSTRATION&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Force demonstration is a tactic used in deterrence to prevent escalation."</data>\n      <data key="d2">fcf565288501279df280096beb7c6d3a</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">567</data>\n      <data key="d5">7d58b089bfc549e8951e91ad62541119</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;LIMITED USE OF FORCE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Limited use of force is a radical measure used in deterrence for de-escalating hostilities."</data>\n      <data key="d2">fcf565288501279df280096beb7c6d3a</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">568</data>\n      <data key="d5">1fa6d3118bd846c8837b5fa9fb78f262</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;FINANCIAL AND ECONOMIC DISRUPTIONS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Financial and economic disruptions are threats used in conjunction with military coercion."</data>\n      <data key="d2">fcf565288501279df280096beb7c6d3a</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">569</data>\n      <data key="d5">62c65bbae33c4ee9a21b61f6f454c4b4</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;ADVANCED CONVENTIONAL WEAPONS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"TECHNOLOGY"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Advanced conventional weapons are a component of the military used in deterrence."</data>\n      <data key="d2">fcf565288501279df280096beb7c6d3a</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">570</data>\n      <data key="d5">30b7034c4468473f98ee18d00ee73b33</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;STRATEGIC DETERRENCE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">**STRATEGIC DETERRENCE** is a military doctrine and concept aimed at preventing conflict by threatening massive retaliation if an adversary attacks.  It encompasses a broader scope than nuclear deterrence, aiming to shape conflict through various means, including the use of military force, both conventional and potentially limited nuclear employment. \n\nSome scholars use "Strategic Deterrence" to describe a comprehensive approach that integrates different forms of influence beyond just military might, as seen in Russian writings where it refers to their unified strategy for exerting influence on the global stage.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">03e0008b6d13c0bb38a6f8bbfe20e996,34d972dafa86555d8f489098607e4c77,39936b87b632c096c061641c0490c2af,4a66c9dd8f8b5f5e8f471b728f857c7f,4d4f70048932b22639b3e5cd835b0669,59f9360f2decd637139d6b869529c2ad,8651bdb6a227bf3bca82a80a06ed712a,888683deca722e6e0152b005624cd674</data>\n      <data key="d6">10</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">3</data>\n      <data key="d4">571</data>\n      <data key="d5">00f78b85e5b84999a810e311e540037b</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;CONVENTIONAL PRECISION STRIKES&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Conventional Precision Strikes are military actions targeting specific enemy assets with high accuracy, often used in the early stages of conflict before nuclear escalation."</data>\n      <data key="d2">343b764679f62503b91262b7cfb4249b</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">572</data>\n      <data key="d5">3e460d9f011d4b0b9ccaae7b6a5202de</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;EUROMAIDAN UPRISING&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The Euromaidan Uprising, a pro-European demonstration in Ukraine, is widely cited as an example of Western influence potentially achieved through information warfare.  Russia perceived the uprising as heavily influenced by the West, viewing it as a case study for the destructive potential of hybrid warfare, as described by Kartapolov. The event has shaped Russia\'s understanding of how Western powers can leverage information to sway public opinion and achieve their goals. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">225b0cff903c251046636fb4bfe2e8ff,5fe78f79b74aaf92a89687fd492be682,803cf3c02920d14a7bb0447fc1c76140,ee01bd14651295a2b77fcb67ebdc098b</data>\n      <data key="d6">3</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">573</data>\n      <data key="d5">9d98dece22eb401aa1a5ce9c88c603f0</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;US ELECTIONS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">US ELECTIONS are mentioned as a target of both Russian information warfare and Russian influence. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">225b0cff903c251046636fb4bfe2e8ff,94ad18024a3545fd895f5193db1fd0c5</data>\n      <data key="d6">16</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">2</data>\n      <data key="d4">574</data>\n      <data key="d5">81446ea789b24eaf9eab02dc07c3d984</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;TROLL FACTORIES&quot;">\n      <data key="d0" />\n      <data key="d1" />\n      <data key="d2">225b0cff903c251046636fb4bfe2e8ff</data>\n      <data key="d6">0</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">575</data>\n      <data key="d5">79f4b1c1b2be4cf7aa828846e20a4eb6</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;2009 NATIONAL SECURITY STRATEGY&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The **2009 National Security Strategy** is a document that reflects Russia\'s stance on global issues. It outlines Russia\'s security concerns, which include the potential threat of color revolutions.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">0e40df5d22db6584ec7e05b07c3d9b66,d67b112a958502c163b1c99c7ba13f8f</data>\n      <data key="d6">5</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">3</data>\n      <data key="d4">576</data>\n      <data key="d5">de04830d6e414fd5b39a9e90769d9452</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;DEFENSE 2010&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Defense 2010 is a military doctrine or strategy document."</data>\n      <data key="d2">927ecbbd9a7b08760bb62d394dcd75e9</data>\n      <data key="d6">1</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">2</data>\n      <data key="d4">577</data>\n      <data key="d5">69db426b97714835bf4937180774787a</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;GERASIMOV, CHEKINOV, BOGDANOV&quot;">\n      <data key="d0" />\n      <data key="d1" />\n      <data key="d2">d8383d735e3d4dedd141bc4b08e3eeaa</data>\n      <data key="d6">7</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">578</data>\n      <data key="d5">9c7bc862339d4a5bb21ee5154d9b33bb</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;NONTRADITIONAL WARFARE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0" />\n      <data key="d1" />\n      <data key="d2">d8383d735e3d4dedd141bc4b08e3eeaa</data>\n      <data key="d6">5</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">579</data>\n      <data key="d5">17bad53a0ebe4569839e5e151ff78593</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;INFORMATION SPHERE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0" />\n      <data key="d1">The **INFORMATION SPHERE** is a realm of communication and media that plays a crucial role in shaping public opinion. It is considered a particularly important nonmilitary means in both contemporary and future conflict.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">3d9254865502f679af6fa7a0b77a6cbe,576201edef6effef1d8b0f7f8ab4fa70,d8383d735e3d4dedd141bc4b08e3eeaa</data>\n      <data key="d6">4</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">3</data>\n      <data key="d4">580</data>\n      <data key="d5">53d98f08e7c74158b7318357b6c660b3</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;TRADITIONAL WARFARE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0" />\n      <data key="d1" />\n      <data key="d2">84b65c4d676043766aeebfc93b776ae6,d8383d735e3d4dedd141bc4b08e3eeaa</data>\n      <data key="d6">4</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">3</data>\n      <data key="d4">581</data>\n      <data key="d5">cd601f77419c403889aadeee591915b5</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;CONCLUSIONS OF CYBERWAR SCHOOL&quot;">\n      <data key="d0" />\n      <data key="d1" />\n      <data key="d2">d8383d735e3d4dedd141bc4b08e3eeaa</data>\n      <data key="d6">5</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">582</data>\n      <data key="d5">0f564ebd53e940fba9d16674ac7bc038</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;SERGUNIN&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Sergunin is a Russian author and researcher who specializes in military doctrine.  They have written about various schools of thought within Russian military doctrine, including nuclear doctrine, as evidenced by their 2014 publication and citations referencing their expertise in the field. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">0fe8cfd6fb9698ac419d99a30f7c00d6,1fac0c360126310483049187b172e47d,93d35d9e3f3e82ed3b519b494edfd9b9</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">583</data>\n      <data key="d5">7deb75816e4f473480e0c79ae99b5bf4</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;2014&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"2014 refers to the year of publication for Sergunin\'s work."</data>\n      <data key="d2">1fac0c360126310483049187b172e47d</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">584</data>\n      <data key="d5">7f85b181f1184f77aeb3ea2155cf4027</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;WARS OF CONSCIOUSNESS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Wars of consciousness is a theoretical concept discussed and critiqued in Sergunin\'s work."</data>\n      <data key="d2">1fac0c360126310483049187b172e47d</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">585</data>\n      <data key="d5">d148b2b2033048618f1a090a492a40a5</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;INFORMATION-PSYCHOLOGICAL WARFARE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">**INFORMATION-PSYCHOLOGICAL WARFARE**\n\nInformation-psychological warfare is a novel and powerful form of warfare that aims to alter the consciousness of a country through information manipulation. It seeks to erode trust in institutions and potentially lead to revolutions, as seen in color revolutions. This militarized tactic is presented as a wide-ranging attack against Russia, significantly influencing public opinion and national consciousness. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">54e5f6035998ada7e8e6f4188995aec5,6d851878f594b6523f6edc86b22c8beb,98d0fa6298be2a61d9cff2a2acb23924,b119839b954a74bbdae1b5dc8eedc114,cf62fdb14a3fc4c98b15edb2ffdb6dd6</data>\n      <data key="d6">1</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">3</data>\n      <data key="d4">586</data>\n      <data key="d5">4d839a10353e4144a26563b0966721d5</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;COMMUNIST PARTY&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The **Communist Party** held significant influence over the Soviet Union\'s understanding of war.  Under Stalin\'s control, the party shaped military theorizing based on Marxist-Leninist principles, influencing Soviet military doctrine and strategy. The Communist Party was responsible for shaping the understanding of war within the military, establishing views and ideology that served as the foundation for Soviet military science. This influence stemmed from the party\'s established ideology, which heavily impacted Soviet military thought and practice. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">39b41cfcdca61ad353853416d904417f,3cd3649d4d82b16c6d105090d8081f6e,8493f884b789159d96b7dab3a7202396,8c7cf0e88b403959479bde7eb44c8654,b4cf9c163a2ba0d0db3385c6741457ac,cc801e9b36ee6b6cbcb589ad5d6eb592,d1330c3cbc7e7877db9ba902371af4d9</data>\n      <data key="d6">9</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">587</data>\n      <data key="d5">521a862bb196488389f17c0b0f4b6f4d</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;VLADIMIR LENIN&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Vladimir Lenin was a key figure in establishing the Soviet Union and its ideology, which significantly influenced Soviet military science. He played a crucial role in shaping the authoritative framework for understanding war within the Soviet Union, introducing the distinction between the nature and character of war into Soviet military theory.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">70ffa305d793f894aff7641666c1ab03,8c7cf0e88b403959479bde7eb44c8654,b4cf9c163a2ba0d0db3385c6741457ac</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">588</data>\n      <data key="d5">22ea3328fb6343f4ad2862495ea27640</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;LEON TROTSKY&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Leon Trotsky was a historical figure associated with the concept of \'permanent revolution\'.  He played a significant role in shaping the Soviet Union\'s military and understanding of war. As a commissar, Trotsky helped establish the framework for Soviet military science alongside Vladimir Lenin, who contributed to setting the framework for understanding war in the Soviet Union. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">8c7cf0e88b403959479bde7eb44c8654,b4cf9c163a2ba0d0db3385c6741457ac,dccb84a71d03372398587d309d2898aa</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">589</data>\n      <data key="d5">3f9a2a2c1c0a424e8b4980ea9d48bdbe</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;BOLSHEVIKS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The Bolsheviks were a political party that came to power during the Russian Revolution.  Their strategy encompassed military, economic, political, and social measures. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">14442faf092eaecae58a72c1a981a33b,9521960b1adb4fffde0f8bca2df87bcb,e005b0c7d358f09c339e2b912c0584c7</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">590</data>\n      <data key="d5">aa2ec452728a4703ae1bdabe85b6c079</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;OPPONENTS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Opponents of the Bolsheviks are contrasted with them, implying a conflict or differing viewpoints."</data>\n      <data key="d2">e005b0c7d358f09c339e2b912c0584c7</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">591</data>\n      <data key="d5">c5ddb31e0a9c4b2683e4631283dd505b</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;HARRIET SCOTT&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Harriet Scott is a veteran Soviet military analyst who contributed to understanding Soviet strategy."</data>\n      <data key="d2">e005b0c7d358f09c339e2b912c0584c7</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">592</data>\n      <data key="d5">07d8eeb549044ac88d2e788c146a0ef1</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;WILLIAM SCOTT&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"William Scott is a veteran Soviet military analyst who collaborated with Harriet Scott."</data>\n      <data key="d2">e005b0c7d358f09c339e2b912c0584c7</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">593</data>\n      <data key="d5">47df2815030c4f1c99facd5cf2482526</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;RUSSIAN GOVERNMENT&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The **RUSSIAN GOVERNMENT** views Color Revolutions as a central threat to its stability and power. This perception has led the government to increase criticism of the West, particularly after the Orange Revolution. The Russian government is also perceived as being threatened by these revolutions, and it makes it difficult for international monitors to work within its borders. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">5eebe2681ef1e72ddfec4046d181b179,931a3799d962bbcfc294a670caa94cdc,9c59a1134d84949c9c4c2d4510c2fbfb,b50799a7304451430d84c0212b504cf4,c3a70df47396b839b38318aa06ce1cab</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">594</data>\n      <data key="d5">ae521508bdc244f99c4fce4ab5214c79</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;MILITARY DOCTRINE 2000&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"The Military Doctrine of 2000 emphasizes a shift towards conventional forces with global reach and the inclusion of information warfare as a threat."</data>\n      <data key="d2">9976fb85179c1c48e3cfe309be6108c7</data>\n      <data key="d6">16</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">2</data>\n      <data key="d4">595</data>\n      <data key="d5">6315b4bf135c40358823ed7e4e4060e2</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;FOREIGN POLICY CONCEPT OF 2000&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"The Foreign Policy Concept of 2000 highlights the importance of economic, political, technological, and information factors in international relations."</data>\n      <data key="d2">9976fb85179c1c48e3cfe309be6108c7</data>\n      <data key="d6">8</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">2</data>\n      <data key="d4">596</data>\n      <data key="d5">33905debec1a45ecae1c65daac1d854c</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;ECONOMIC FACTORS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0" />\n      <data key="d1" />\n      <data key="d5">bfbe904780fe47daad1a04126b12923c</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;CONCEPT OF 2000&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The **Concept of 2000**, as presented by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, outlined Russia\'s foreign policy. This concept emphasized cooperation and highlighted the significance of economic, political, technological, and information factors in shaping international relations.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">287b17a01df64083a49c84828ae77591,9a4e544128564ba75a290bb651a8ccfc</data>\n      <data key="d6">8</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">598</data>\n      <data key="d5">0614f00e932c4cd0b53928053811ebc1</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;MILITARY FORCE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">**MILITARY FORCE** is the use of armed personnel and weaponry by a nation\'s armed forces to achieve strategic objectives. This entity is capable of defining war and unleashing precision strikes, employing both traditional methods of warfare involving armed combat and modern strategies for strategic deterrence.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">03e0008b6d13c0bb38a6f8bbfe20e996,83a9c8568bb6d6b42eda25b377e1d82a,85e4e298e365df474828bb853c808db1,98d0fa6298be2a61d9cff2a2acb23924,f773883fc42cbafe5e0268d526176d80</data>\n      <data key="d6">7</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">2</data>\n      <data key="d4">599</data>\n      <data key="d5">9ef487dd0b574b108c60a56d6a2f146c</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;SIXTH-GENERATION WARFARE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Sixth-generation Warfare is a hypothetical future form of warfare characterized by advanced technology and precision strikes conducted over long distances, primarily utilizing long-range precision-guided missiles.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">a1fc196183277908b1cc6e1504847875,f773883fc42cbafe5e0268d526176d80</data>\n      <data key="d6">7</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">2</data>\n      <data key="d4">600</data>\n      <data key="d5">4067269e7f6943cdbc299ce02b7eadbd</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;INFORMATION&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">**INFORMATION** is described as a destructive weapon, comparable to traditional weaponry. It is also characterized as data and knowledge utilized for the purpose of influence and manipulation.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">e9bdf690c31ee5e48a35b6b8921ca988,f773883fc42cbafe5e0268d526176d80</data>\n      <data key="d6">7</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">2</data>\n      <data key="d4">601</data>\n      <data key="d5">094a736ba43c4da48c556437f47f88d1</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;MAJ. Gulin argues that war should not be confined to physical violence but encompass social violence as well, recognizing the significant impact of non-physical forms of conflict. \n</data>\n      <data key="d5">5197a3fb02ef4677abd1900aa87e4efa</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;IGOR SERGEYEV&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Igor Sergeyev is the Russian    <data key="d4">625</data>\n      <data key="d5">887f444240bb474da23cdfb6abf7a998</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;SERBIA&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"GEO"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Serbia was the location of a bombing campaign that served as a case study for Sergeyev\'s analysis.  Sergeyev viewed this campaign as a prototype of non-contact warfare, marking a significant shift in military tactics according to his observations. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">63ae1b36ecf8efb01b9a95f7abdd4033,74b1bd908c22c236bcd8a776ad40cc37,c3e2371f031b41a4526ed4e60e6b080a</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">626</data>\n      <data key="d5">5d29053f2ce74442aa1855b327ef3bb7</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;SERGEYEV&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Sergeyev is an individual who analyzes military strategies. He views the bombing of Serbia as a prototype for non-contact warfare. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">74b1bd908c22c236bcd8a776ad40cc37,c3e2371f031b41a4526ed4e60e6b080a</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">627</data>\n      <data key="d5">7e40cd12839a4577a95e33d785147a31</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;RMA&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">RMA, standing for "revolutions in military affairs," is a concept used within the Soviet-Russian tradition. It refers to a revolution in military affairs characterized by informatization and high-precision weapons.  Sergeyev believes this revolution was initiated by the Serbian campaign. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">74b1bd908c22c236bcd8a776ad40cc37,c3e2371f031b41a4526ed4e60e6b080a,f1b9a7a757fc5641eaa3632e9807574b</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">628</data>\n      <data key="d5">8fe58de8a04f4f8f807c77fb41829a3a</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;BOMBING OF SERBIA&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"The bombing of Serbia is a specific event that Sergeyev uses as evidence for his theory about non-contact warfare."</data>\n      <data key="d2">c3e2371f031b41a4526ed4e60e6b080a</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">629</data>\n      <data key="d5">a9f50861273c4bb697d868a9d049d392</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;LAWS OF WAR&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The **Laws of War** are facing potential changes as advocated by Gerasimov. His proposals suggest a shift in both the legal and ethical considerations surrounding these established rules of engagement.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">7cc72471bf4edd02ae4d6b43dd505467,dd68126420b24cd563d457fdb5356a33</data>\n      <data key="d6">3</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">630</data>\n      <data key="d5">be4820f29fd942b282049fa49697b4ed</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;HYBRID WAR&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"HYBRID WAR" is a concept being debated in both Russia and the United States. Characterized by its unique blend of military and political tactics, it is also known as "gibridnaya voina" in Russian.  While the concept is relatively recent in the Russian discourse on war, it has sparked debate on both sides of the Atlantic. Notably, Russian General Valery Gerasimov has criticized the US debate surrounding hybrid warfare as being unbalanced. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">22b661e49114bda37400701e79292197,2d96d25d0022a1193382ea88b904435a,7cc72471bf4edd02ae4d6b43dd505467,df08541749dd65fc3af06e736fdc5203,e8b2ce2c1fd2c098e0876122cefde0bb</data>\n      <data key="d6">3</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">5</data>\n      <data key="d4">631</data>\n      <data key="d5">6deaefe707f84b3dbda979dea0d095ac</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;RUSSIAN NATIONAL SECURITY DOCTRINE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"The Russian National Security Doctrine is a key document shaping Russia\'s understanding of threats and its response to them."</data>\n      <data key="d2">26123c88ed4eb5080379f3088a3359d6</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">632</data>\n      <data key="d5">d053ea9432a24fb192e8d6aa993b0caa</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;ADVERSARIES&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Adversaries are mentioned as targets of the Russian approach, suggesting a geopolitical context."</data>\n      <data key="d2">4e1b5455146da4530dbebcab63ccad40</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">633</data>\n      <data key="d5">a3e683d294ed42a28d60d09a36cbeb54</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;SOFT POWER&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Soft power is a concept mentioned in the Foreign Policy Concept and is presented as a key element of the Russian approach to international relations.  This approach emphasizes non-military influence over other nations. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">0fbf2c2d34dfce0579218bcd864902ec,4e1b5455146da4530dbebcab63ccad40,5910165c2ae0e582998b2c2de2b57f54,84b65c4d676043766aeebfc93b776ae6</data>\n      <data key="d6">8</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">3</data>\n      <data key="d4">634</data>\n      <data key="d5">39887ca8567141d5b857b87a2bca4086</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;HARD POWER&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Hard power is contrasted with soft power, indicating its role alongside military and covert operations."</data>\n      <data They tend to move away from the traditional definition of war as solely an armed struggle, suggesting a broader understanding of the concept. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">b561bc3a166d627669a12364a4a320b1,c8c68899e22ee8c693d6e73e47d38c9e</data>\n      <data key="d6">5</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">660</data>\n      <data key="d5">de3b561f5cce4c83bccb39180e362c97</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;NUCLEAR WEAPONS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"TECHNOLOGY"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Nuclear Weapons are considered a last resort option for Russia in managing escalation, capable of inflicting significant damage.  They are also described as the primary armament of the Soviet armed forces. While discussed as a potential tool of war, military analyst Gareyev argues that they do not fundamentally change the nature of warfare. \n\nThe potential use of nuclear weapons is mentioned in the context of an existential threat to Russia. Historically, Khrushchev viewed nuclear weapons as a deterrent to war, ultimately changing his perspective on the inevitability of conflict following their development.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">046f04af090c144a8bd1403c6c5879a4,5fc5a6b5aebd3d100c1491fc135bc6da,73e9dd59e90139f5e98a1ec5152660fd,75cf1c5331762502113e33f0d91f7c4d,98feec5ff3b77b05b471596a90b0968a,b561bc3a166d627669a12364a4a320b1</data>\n      <data key="d6">5</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">661</data>\n      <data key="d5">5bfefaa0fce04002851733337bed714c</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;HIROSHIMA AND NAGASAKI&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"GEO"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Hiroshima and Nagasaki are mentioned as examples of the use of nuclear weapons in service of US policy."</data>\n      <data key="d2">b561bc3a166d627669a12364a4a320b1</data>\n      <data key="d6">5</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">662</data>\n      <data key="d5">b5fed5609f154df58c6a9f74e55fc0ba</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;AREYEV&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">AREYEV is a scholar who analyzes the nature of war and its relationship to nuclear weapons. Kalinkin is an author who co-authored a paper on strategic deterrence in the context of the US global missile defense system."</data>\n      <data key="d2">38e678d44293783f648ea2e9070fbb70</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">674</data>\n      <data key="d5">70f22b1d7336492dbade94b8edefe457</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;&#1042;.&#1042;. &#1052;&#1040;&#1058;&#1042;&#1048;&#1063;&#1059;&#1050;&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">V.V. Matviyuk is an author who has written on the topic of strategic deterrence.  They co-authored a paper examining strategic deterrence in relation to the US global missile defense system, and also authored a separate text discussing strategic deterrence more broadly. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">2694371286d23cb09629b7dfe691bb73,38e678d44293783f648ea2e9070fbb70</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">675</data>\n      <data key="d5">66e098dc431146e19fc4bc2ea37efbd9</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;A.L. &#1061;&#1056;&#1071;&#1055;&#1048;&#1053;&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"A.L. &#1061;&#1088;&#1103;&#1087;&#1080;&#1085; is an author of a text discussing strategic deterrence."</data>\n      <data key="d2">2694371286d23cb09629b7dfe691bb73</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">676</data>\n      <data key="d5">932e213c57134098a07073febd51dcc2</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;D.A. &#1050;&#1040;&#1051;&#1048;&#1053;&#1050;&#1048;&#1053;&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"D.A. &#1050;&#1072;&#1083;&#1080;&#1085;&#1082;&#1080;&#1085; is an author of a text discussing strategic deterrence."</data>\n      <data key="d2">2694371286d23cb09629b7dfe691bb73</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">677</data>\n      <data key="d5">9593428ad36746ae8af6d8ce639834ef</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;&#1057;&#1058;&#1056;&#1040;&#1058;&#1045;&#1043;&#1048;&#1063;&#1045;&#1057;&#1050;&#1054;&#1045; &#1057;&#1044;&#1045;&#1056;&#1046;&#1048;&#1042;&#1040;&#1053;&#1048;&#1045;&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Strategic deterrence is the subject of the text, focusing on its challenges in the context of US global missile defense system."</data>\n      <data key="d2">2694371286d23cb09629b7dfe691bb73</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">678</data>\n      <data key="d5">1bcaeb58479d42a6963a073c09f3f397</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;&#1057;&#1064;&#1040;&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"GEO"</data>\n      <data key="d1">**SHA** \n\nSHA is a country, specifically the United States, that is developing a global missile defense system.  The deployment of this system has been mentioned on a global scale. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">2694371286d23cb09629b7dfe691bb73,d1fcf88891f6c2a0f72d55f9ab93b598</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">679</data>\n      <data key="d5">1ef0c1c59ce946668ccf1a6a4f5ab7cc</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;&#1042;&#1054;&#1045;&#1053;&#1053;&#1054;-&#1055;&#1056;&#1054;&#1052;&#1067;&#1064;&#1051;&#1045;&#1053;&#1053;&#1067;&#1049; &#1050;&#1059;&#1056;&#1068;&#1045;&#1056;&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"&#1042;&#1086;&#1077;&#1085;&#1085;&#1086;-&#1055;&#1088;&#1086;&#1084;&#1099;&#1096;&#1083;&#1077;&#1085;&#1085;&#1099;&#1081; &#1050;&#1091;&#1088;&#1100;&#1077;&#1088; is a newspaper that published &#1070;&#1088;&#1080;&#1081; &#1041;&#1072;&#1083;&#1091;&#1077;&#1074;&#1089;&#1082;&#1080;&#1081;\'s article."</data>\n      <data key="d2">ade36c9f71918172a6ce043f5b3b2dc8</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">680</data>\n      <data key="d5">d734746e3d6146f780af91827e578dfd</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;SOVIET MILITARY THEORY&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Soviet military theory is a set of ideas and doctrines about warfare developed by the Soviet Union.  It encompasses a body of knowledge regarding military strategy, tactics, and organization. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">2be40bedc401aa74026067cbca67b681,43cb0f2a8f89f287a9fa0308ed110a3f,cb8b8a24ee435442f42e5aa0feacb291</data>\n      <data key="d6">9</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">4</data>\n      <data key="d4">681</data>\n      <data key="d5">21ed913271614cbeb1b754cdbbef13af</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;FRANK HOFFMAN&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Frank Hoffman is a military analyst and strategist who originated the concept of hybrid warfare. He defined it as a blend of conventional and unconventional tactics,  a framework he developed while working in support of the US Marine Corps. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">30e43423e314a1ec92fb31a8cd093078,34024e93db186cac3094e1d8070923ab,b14b8167f871a2a2122ee05c9d77be10</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">682</data>\n      <data key="d5">1505dfebbfb04652b0ba57de1a251d67</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;JAMES MATTIS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">James Mattis is a former US Marine Corps official known for his collaboration with Frank Hoffman on the development of the threat concept known as hybrid warfare.  Together, they co-authored the original definition of this term, which has since become widely recognized within military and strategic circles. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">30e43423e314a1ec92fb31a8cd093078,34024e93db186cac3094e1d8070923ab,b14b8167f871a2a2122ee05c9d77be10</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">683</data>\n      <data key="d5">907ec65076e5494a8631efffb81b3178</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;US MARINE CORPS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The US Marine Corps is a military branch that commissioned the threat concept of "hybrid threats".  They actively seek to understand and address these complex, multifaceted challenges. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">30e43423e314a1ec92fb31a8cd093078,34024e93db186cac3094e1d8070923ab</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">684</data>\n      <data key="d5">2dc7f6b230db452190a09643ca3d5ec0</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;MIKRYUKOV&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">MIKRYUKOV is an author and expert on information warfare. He published work on hybrid warfare in 2010 and believes that information warfare has entered a new stage due to the emergence of advanced technologies. MIKRYUKOV sees potential in this evolving field and argues for its continued development alongside technological advancements.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">5599962db5be274ac157280f1faa4590,f07be9fd08a9903ad5197e3c7a250ca0,f9cd1d8b7cbb13deeabb75de223a5c6c</data>\n      <data key="d6">16</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">685</data>\n      <data key="d5">c20ecfc93b3a4875ade5c92cfe4b94a1</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;GULF WAR&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The **Gulf War** was a significant historical event that profoundly impacted military thinking, particularly in Russia.  \n\nThe conflict demonstrated the decisive advantage held by technologically superior forces, exemplified by the US military\'s defeat of Iraqi troops equipped with Soviet technology. This victory served as a shock to Russian theorists, who witnessed the effectiveness of advanced weaponry and tactics against numerically larger armies adhering to traditional Soviet doctrines. \n\nThe Gulf War is widely recognized as a pivotal moment in the evolution of warfare, highlighting the crucial role of information-technical warfare.  It showcased the use of information technologies as weapons, influencing Russian thinking on network-centric warfare and demonstrating the potential for "contactless war," though not the first instance of such warfare. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">12575d1b6f02a59280ed0326b418f907,2ced16684237fb065035dffff5afc8b4,3d2c478ea1bd96c710021bcff36cbddb,5599962db5be274ac157280f1faa4590,b8fd807f07f8a2af89aa236339a7bc45,cf62fdb14a3fc4c98b15edb2ffdb6dd6,d0c05f8ec94cd42a4727a66ae84be4dd,da02795f9d537326bfadcd006a8bcc92,e9def1a80602f476ecce04216e4a8a03,f07be9fd08a9903ad5197e3c7a250ca0,f6f3bf4797ee25c5c62c11e81fb4fa83</data>\n      <data key="d6">1</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">4</data>\n      <data key="d4">686</data>\n      <data key="d5">4bc7dc91ede345dfb63d7d4f7ac3554f</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;INFORMATION AS WEAPON&quot;">\n      <data key="d0" />\n      <data key="d1" />\n      <data key="d2">5599962db5be274ac157280f1faa4590</data>\n      <data key="d6">7</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">687</data>\n      <data key="d5">0b2b815c9f834aaaac0c341097def9ba</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;BOGDANOV &amp; CHEKINOV&quot;">\n      <data key="d0" />\n      <data key="d1" />\n      <data key="d2">5599962db5be274ac157280f1faa4590</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">688</data>\n      <data key="d5">424ae71c56024094a02e6fd9bfcfbb04</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;ASYMMETRICAL ACTIONS TO MAINTAIN RUSSIA\'S MILITARY SECURITY&quot;">\n      <data key="d0" />\n      <data key="d1" />\n      <data key="d2">5599962db5be274ac157280f1faa4590</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">689</data>\n      <data key="d5">400d10f2ee1d49be9a66efa34dada0e6</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;INFORMATION TECHNOLOGIES AS WEAPONS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0" />\n      <data key="d1" />\n      <data key="d2">5599962db5be274ac157280f1faa4590</data>\n      <data key="d6">1</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">690</data>\n      <data key="d5">91deb9f152264e958d106d481ff2e1ee</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;INFORMATION OPERATIONS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Information Operations is a key focus of Chekinov and Bogdanov\'s work, as they believe it to be capable of achieving strategic goals.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">29a46f13633e4ddfb2338626c0e0a4c8,406ecd4768447aa06d26731538246770</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">691</data>\n      <data key="d5">586cf02da9494088aed9b3419725638f</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;WESTERN COUNTRIES&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Western Countries employ a variety of approaches to achieve their political ambitions.  In addition to traditional military action, they are also known to utilize newer strategies such as "color revolutions," which represent a departure from conventional warfare tactics. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">0130a2e44046b07aa1a2eac85562f8aa,3a60589a99ac9cde8a25daf1571620f6</data>\n      <data key="d6">3</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">692</data>\n      <data key="d5">229d85a2783e4a2991f17d2ab5750af7</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;FRUNZE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Frunze is a Soviet military theorist and commissar who believed in perpetual conflict between the proletarian state and the bourgeois world. He agreed with the idea that all aspects of social life are absorbed by war, reflecting his strong conviction about the inherent antagonism between these two societal forces.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">14442faf092eaecae58a72c1a981a33b,342381013c3f61db48a3a2b2bc77370c,53a9ea72d5933a1785f5d7146aa759c3,6b7d21eb26a4ec94c42acbaaf3707f2e</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">693</data>\n      <data key="d5">b7f97d1909a3433abef8ca8e9334fafa</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;PROLETARIAT&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"The proletariat refers to the working class, central to Lenin\'s vision of revolution and the end of war."</data>\n      <data key="d2">6b7d21eb26a4ec94c42acbaaf3707f2e</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">694</data>\n      <data key="d5">b7fdfffc38b94bf7872eabe9b022c8fd</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;BOURGEOISIE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The bourgeoisie is a social class identified as the capitalist class, representing the driving force behind imperialist wars according to Lenin.  They are also viewed as an antagonistic force to the socialist state. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">6b7d21eb26a4ec94c42acbaaf3707f2e,b161f86472b14d8aafd5240f60c4d0ea</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">695</data>\n      <data key="d5">6242e0c237a348908d0256ea790a0211</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;MILITARY PROGRAMME OF THE PROLETARIAN REVOLUTION&quot;">\n      <data key="d0" />\n      <data key="d1" />\n      <data key="d2">6b7d21eb26a4ec94c42acbaaf3707f2e</data>\n      <data key="d6">9</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">696</data>\n      <data key="d5">7cc9f26737e1442595e53253e98015ef</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;PROLETARIAN STATE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The Proletarian State is a political system characterized by its inherent conflict with the bourgeois world, as believed by Frunze.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">342381013c3f61db48a3a2b2bc77370c,53a9ea72d5933a1785f5d7146aa759c3</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">697</data>\n      <data key="d5">1868fec1493643208dbdcad7bc97dfa0</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;BOURGEOIS WORLD&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"The bourgeois world is a term used by Frunze to describe capitalist societies that are opposed to the proletarian state."</data>\n      <data key="d2">53a9ea72d5933a1785f5d7146aa759c3</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">698</data>\n      <data key="d5">a87aa935dccf49cd98b40fb5afe7ad5c</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;EU-RUSSIA SUMMIT&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"The EU-Russia summit was where Putin stated he didn\'t see the US or EU working against Russia."</data>\n      <data key="d2">b50799a7304451430d84c0212b504cf4</data>\n      <data key="d6">0</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">699</data>\n      <data key="d5">36870a3393f6413e9bf647168eb6977a</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;NGO LAW&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">NGO LAW  in Russia was revised by Medvedev in 2005. This revision significantly reduced the ability of NGOs to operate within Russia. The adoption of this law is considered a significant turning point, marking a shift in Russia\'s stance on foreign involvement in domestic affairs. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">34b0078e74299e6a200a4ef43f0bdc9c,4ff9923cce9727a0cb4b60f7ec70b2cc,b50799a7304451430d84c0212b504cf4</data>\n      <data key="d6">0</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">3</data>\n      <data key="d4">700</data>\n      <data key="d5">4fe3ff52700c491f8cc650aadb4d7cb0</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;VALERY GALCHENKO&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Valery Galchenko is a Duma deputy who co-authored the NGO law and saw NGOs as leading to the destruction of the Russian state."</data>\n      <data key="d2">b50799a7304451430d84c0212b504cf4</data>\n      <data key="d6">0</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">701</data>\n      <data key="d5">f1f6f6435a444e388d67e16e847afca6</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;BUSH ADMINISTRATION&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The **BUSH ADMINISTRATION** was a US government body that actively promoted democracy in certain countries.  This promotion of democracy was sometimes viewed by critics as a geopolitical tool. The administration was also a key actor in criticizing Russia for its human rights and democratic failings, highlighting these issues publicly.  However, there are also suggestions that the Bush administration may have been interested in exaggerating the role of foreign actors in revolutions to further their own agenda. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">0a20fca212149a5c275431feaaf62872,34b0078e74299e6a200a4ef43f0bdc9c,4ff9923cce9727a0cb4b60f7ec70b2cc,d42e19095522f9d2df7dc1499cedc5ca,f04349eccb7697c6652f0d01b6622514</data>\n      <data key="d6">6</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">702</data>\n      <data key="d5">0af2ca1c090843ea92679fd14c1fbc9a</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;MEDVEDEV&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Dmitry Medvedev is a Russian leader who attempted to improve Russia\'s image regarding human rights and democracy. He is identified as a figure who expressed concerns about foreign interference, specifically mentioning foreign governments\' attempts to influence Russian elections.  Medvedev also disagreed with Vladimir Putin\'s characterization of the Western intervention in Libya, denouncing Putin\'s language about the Western involvement. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">47cbbe56d55fbd552f238ecfef64e24b,4ff9923cce9727a0cb4b60f7ec70b2cc,80977716c22c59d3eca92f04f08f0a53,85e5e3514a004553e41c0c93fc4c5f0a,e0d765d0aa64f3c5fa134e12f9523747,f04349eccb7697c6652f0d01b6622514</data>\n      <data key="d6">0</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">703</data>\n      <data key="d5">1b06d3e53ffd4771952fbef04d1e666c</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;NGW&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">## NGW (New Generation Warfare)\n\nNGW (New Generation Warfare) is a Russian military doctrine that emphasizes information warfare as the primary battlefield. It represents a Russian understanding of modern warfare, focusing on orchestrating both military and non-military measures to manipulate an adversary\'s perception, decision-making, and behavior. This strategy aims to influence an adversary\'s will and ultimately achieve strategic objectives through informational struggle. \n\nNGW is often discussed alongside the Gerasimov Doctrine and is seen as a response to Western "hybrid campaigns." While initially popular, the concept of Non-Government Warfare (NGW) appears to have faded from Russian military thought.  The Russian National Guard of Warfare is considered a key player in implementing NGW strategies during the invasion and informational warfare campaigns. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">0a127d33c040b6f998a650ee92decc96,1ac7aca91700a150878fc2f36ce37117,30e696da641c144eac33994ba0518ccf,39936b87b632c096c061641c0490c2af,3b97d2180490b928c0221d51d99009d6,6fe4faca1e39cc57f7c84b772a87fd4d,7ae0f631f330850ca53d02c933c953ce,a23b246cf13383b48af523769cd9247f,a3a7513f41e4fd6cb9e4f0decdbc615d,d3952715a838bf4f4761245756a4372e,d5d750ae9aeb32d27e411be522f87d48,e97880df6b33eecb3147aea6e798be7d,ea564c655112d9ce5437348086fd1116,fa6f1322c861f018219ae4741df2bae1</data>\n      <data key="d6">10</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">3</data>\n      <data key="d4">704</data>\n      <data key="d5">b8e966b34cba4b11b9995106767212ba</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;HOLISTIC NATURE OF RUSSIAN MENTALITY&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"This refers to the overarching perspective that encompasses various aspects of reality as interconnected."</data>\n      <data key="d2">1c8fed726b2eb22fb2e268caa1aa9993</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">705</data>\n      <data key="d5">f6de923de6474d2cab6a9c2f0d81fa59</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;KOMPLEKSNYI/SISTEMNYI PODHOD&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"This is a Russian term for a holistic approach, emphasizing interconnectedness and systems thinking."</data>\n      <data key="d2">1c8fed726b2eb22fb2e268caa1aa9993</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">706</data>\n      <data key="d5">6915637e8d124fdc8473111d501e3703</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;GENERAL SYSTEMS THEORY&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"This refers to a theoretical framework that views complex systems as interconnected wholes."</data>\n      <data key="d2">1c8fed726b2eb22fb2e268caa1aa9993</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">707</data>\n      <data key="d5">2233f31929194eac89333ce8731a5584</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;NORBERT WIENER&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Norbert Wiener is a scholar considered a key figure in general systems theory.  He is frequently mentioned in the context of systems theory. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">1c8fed726b2eb22fb2e268caa1aa9993,56527e856eb124c46a60a1443da1989b,eb9fa02ce92b876649908d97ee376949</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">708</data>\n      <data key="d5">61f1dc4267314470ac820b6a46c61f7b</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;LUDWIG VON BERTALANFFY&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Ludwig von Bertalanffy is a scholar who is considered a key figure in general systems theory. id="&quot;STRATEGIC OPERATION OF GENERAL PURPOSE FORCES&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"A strategic operation of general purpose forces is a proposed military action involving conventional forces deployed across a wide area."</data>\n      <data key="d2">6e95c10bc1d7f18e26e3f7eb18bb66ee</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">750</data>\n      <data key="d5">cbc1667556f84a5eadf867a823e6986c</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;STRATEGIC SPACE OPERATION&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"A strategic space operation is a proposed military action focused on utilizing space-based assets for strategic advantage."</data>\n      <data key="d2">6e95c10bc1d7f18e26e3f7eb18bb66ee</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">751</data>\n      <data key="d5">a876d1ab79864396bc47a039225fd5c7</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;INFORMATION DIMENSION&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"The information dimension refers to the use of information warfare and cyber operations in military strategy."</data>\n      <data key="d2">6e95c10bc1d7f18e26e3f7eb18bb66ee</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">752</data>\n      <data key="d5">c09f67d4f25448c99f7c0552c30b7706</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;THEATER OF INFORMATION COMBAT&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Theater of information combat is a proposed domain of warfare focused on manipulating information and disrupting enemy communications."</data>\n      <data key="d2">6e95c10bc1d7f18e26e3f7eb18bb66ee</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">753</data>\n      <data key="d5">c0866306dc8c4da2a8a81c0c3a78b657</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;CONVENTIONAL FORCES&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Conventional forces are military units that primarily employ traditional weapons systems, such as tanks, artillery, and aircraft."</data>\n      <data key="d2">6e95c10bc1d7f18e26e3f7eb18bb66ee</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">754</data>\n      <data key="d5">3884c37eb13a4c9097ee2c5be4eeefaf</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;NUCLEAR FORCES&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Nuclear forces are military units equipped with nuclear weapons."</data>\n      <data key="d2">6e95c10bc1d7f18e26e3f7eb18bb66ee</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">755</data>\n      <data key="d5">90764eb2cab74cffb1c7d72d28b965cc</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;27 TSNII&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">27 TSNII is a Russian organization that analyzes and publishes articles on military strategy.  They specialize in analyzing Russia\'s \'strategic deterrence\' system, as evidenced by their work featured in Military Thought. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">d443a6cb4e5386264541f38044a8c249,f57761743fd7554cce9898a907d202b8</data>\n      <data key="d6">10</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">756</data>\n      <data key="d5">01abe16e67c241a887aa62abe22d155c</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;MILITARY THOUGHT&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PUBLICATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">**MILITARY THOUGHT** is a flagship publication of the General Staff (GS) in Russia. It serves as a forum for military professionals and intellectuals to discuss strategy, operational art, and force build-up.  The journal has been used by prominent figures like Yuri Baluyevsky to publish their views. Analysts from 27 TsNII, a Russian military research institute, regularly contribute to MILITARY THOUGHT, including articles on topics such as Russia\'s strategic deterrence system and informational struggle. The publication disproportionately covers both the "soft" and "hard" aspects of informational warfare, reflecting its importance in contemporary Russian military doctrine.  MILITARY THOUGHT represents the strategic ideas and doctrines held by the Russian nation. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">5eea4913c132500b62e2f7d79380593e,64eeb118488aef964197bf29f3a0adb4,8ce5f5bfef751b07721a9bdf7c956bba,cbad03251a174d87dc9c103d0a260763,d443a6cb4e5386264541f38044a8c249,f3100a3b7eda755b429622097891e3a0,f57761743fd7554cce9898a907d202b8</data>\n      <data key="d6">10</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">5</data>\n      <data key="d4">757</data>\n      <data key="d5">37049be0a2c240c6a06acf9339237b8b</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;STRATEGIC DETERRENCE SYSTEM&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Russia\'s **STRATEGIC DETERRENCE SYSTEM** is a complex network of military capabilities designed to prevent conflict and ensure national security. This system serves as the foundation for Russia\'s military strategy, which aims to deter potential adversaries through its formidable arsenal and readiness.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">d443a6cb4e5386264541f38044a8c249,f57761743fd7554cce9898a907d202b8</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">758</data>\n      <data key="d5">e785c52881704d95bf4ec03d2720f8ae</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;MILITARY SCIENCE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">**MILITARY SCIENCE** is the study of war as a whole, encompassing armed struggle and the use of both direct and indirect violence. It involves understanding the principles, strategies, and tactics employed in warfare, as well as the historical, political, and social contexts surrounding conflict.  Military Science also encompasses the study and practice of warfare, covering both direct actions like combat operations and indirect actions such as intelligence gathering and psychological warfare. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">112509ae19803edd47655e5f2fc22ae1,7567750cec0624c2e9f362f989d8b1bc,abe7dca7f715b3a56df70fa74b56aa30</data>\n      <data key="d6">5</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">759</data>\n      <data key="d5">654689c65613476b9905d7afb3809cd2</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;LONG-RANGE PRECISION WEAPONRY&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"TECHNOLOGY"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Long-range precision weaponry represents a significant threat in modern warfare."</data>\n      <data id="&quot;UNMANNED AERIAL VEHICLES (UAVS)&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"TECHNOLOGY"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"UAVs are increasingly used in modern warfare, posing new challenges and threats."</data>\n      <data key="d2">112509ae19803edd47655e5f2fc22ae1</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">761</data>\n      <data important role in modern warfare."</data>\n      <data key="d2">112509ae19803edd47655e5f2fc22ae1</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">762</data>\n      <data highly trained military units specializing in covert operations."</data>\n      <data key="d2">112509ae19803edd47655e5f2fc22ae1</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">763</data>\n      <data key="d5">bf0138ccbcc740089a55fd0c24897360</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;PRIVATE MILITARY FORCES (PMFS)&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data <data key="d4">765</data>\n      <data key="d5">909d28e443fd4e0bac189373125c8309</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;MILITARY EXERCISES&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Military exercises are described as simulations that demonstrated the potential for limited nuclear use to deter escalation."</data>\n      <data key="d2">5df832f6cec6c27ae77e370f07cac8d6</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">766</data>\n      <data key="d5">efbc2439e5034801af83ac1a0b440535</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;WESTERN SCHOLARS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Western scholars are a specific group of experts who have studied a particular historical period.  They are noted for having a different perspective on Russian strategy compared to Russian scholars. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">56527e856eb124c46a60a1443da1989b,5df832f6cec6c27ae77e370f07cac8d6</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">767</data>\n      <data key="d5">b9a2ef791a064f038cac2059ebea1138</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;PERIOD (2009-10)&quot;">\n      <data key="d0" />\n      <data key="d1" />\n      <data key="d2">5df832f6cec6c27ae77e370f07cac8d6</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">768</data>\n      <data key="d5">1ce2b24bc93442148dc2240d3c6223b1</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;MILITARY WRITINGS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Military Writings are documents that outline military strategies and tactics, providing a framework for understanding target selection in conflict. This includes details on how to choose targets effectively. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">0c1b37708d3475212b1f7c0b196ebfa4,8a6bc654ca308f2716cc1b21c9c2a7a2</data>\n      <data key="d6">0</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">769</data>\n      <data key="d5">804c1e94e7974332a817931363ddb643</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;VITALLY IMPORTANT OBJECTS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"**Vitally Important Objects** are targets that cause significant economic and population losses when damaged.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">0c1b37708d3475212b1f7c0b196ebfa4,8a6bc654ca308f2716cc1b21c9c2a7a2</data>\n      <data key="d6">0</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">770</data>\n      <data key="d5">32dc0b572ad84c75a64a2007788eb981</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;TARGETS OF SIGNIFICANT VALUE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Targets of Significant Value are military-economic targets that cause economic losses and disrupt command and control but with less loss of life."</data>\n      <data key="d2">8a6bc654ca308f2716cc1b21c9c2a7a2</data>\n      <data key="d6">0</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">771</data>\n      <data key="d5">f5c11a5ac94e40068bca8be178a6bcd6</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;&#1056;&#1054;&#1051;&#1044;&#1059;&#1043;&#1048;&#1053;&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Roldugin is an author who specializes in military strategy. He has written about choosing targets for critical objects of the enemy and contributed to a work on strategic deterrence.  He has also co-authored a work on choosing targets for military action. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">74a6b948abf6e4cbeffa17366e046b24,84dec9951e7f6a2e24693d831630a387,cecb14f6d735cc6920fdf727bfca305d,e776344e89fbb011cc110c0ef8e0e731</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">772</data>\n      <data key="d5">ea28ff7f127e4677a913952595dce2f5</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;&#1050;&#1054;&#1051;&#1054;&#1044;&#1068;&#1050;&#1054;&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Kolodkko is an author who specializes in military strategy.  They have written about choosing targets for critical enemy objects and contributed to a work on strategic deterrence. Additionally, Kolodkko has co-authored a work on selecting targets for military action. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">74a6b948abf6e4cbeffa17366e046b24,84dec9951e7f6a2e24693d831630a387,cecb14f6d735cc6920fdf727bfca305d,e776344e89fbb011cc110c0ef8e0e731</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">773</data>\n      <data key="d5">192a6d23595045f38b0d46a3d8e52fd6</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;GORBUNOV AND BOGDANOV&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Gorbunov and Bogdanov are authors who have made significant contributions to understanding the evolving nature of warfare. They are known for their theory about war, which emphasizes the increasing importance of information warfare and argues that conventional military operations will hold little significance in future conflicts.  \n\nTheir writings, including a study on 21st-century armed confrontation and the potential of non-nuclear weapons, highlight the growing influence of nonmilitary tactics in weakening states. Notably, their work from 2009 aligns with Putin\'s views on the crucial role of information technology in modern conflict, suggesting their ideas have influenced prominent political figures.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">37215a6c4810a7b385fb17417f94fbe0,4e2896fd5b6f31d006ca18e1a3299553,5497fc2e9ef0c53f1b17d4b901c85832,68e7972f85fd6fc2109534ff86630800,6c276ef5c88e4f06e651dfab52e4f31a,7aef3b8e0c0a9cd9f240dfbe12e02c38,d0795c516b3c5af83173ca70b07fb02d,d0ecd460d53c457bc525cf4f3ba940d2,ef55602335bea29d08150b6649fad897,fd24a983ae975cadc842ce8fa5eea97c</data>\n      <data key="d6">9</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">7</data>\n      <data key="d4">774</data>\n      <data key="d5">ef67c9fc60284b50aa15ac655b06a155</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;STUDY&quot;">\n      <data key="d0" />\n      <data key="d1">The STUDY is a research project that examines armed confrontations in the twenty-first century.  It focuses specifically on identifying novelties and trends within this field of conflict. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">5497fc2e9ef0c53f1b17d4b901c85832,d0795c516b3c5af83173ca70b07fb02d</data>\n      <data key="d6">9</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">775</data>\n      <data key="d5">cc8201cce1024b5192056fe8e98fda22</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;21ST CENTURY&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"GEO"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"The 21st century is the period under study by Gorbunov and Bogdanov."</data>\n      <data key="d2">5497fc2e9ef0c53f1b17d4b901c85832</data>\n      <data key="d6">9</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">776</data>\n      <data key="d5">97e097f9022540b88ab7c13d2805c25f</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;ARMED CONFRONTATION&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Armed confrontation is the subject of Gorbunov and Bogdanov\'s study."</data>\n      <data key="d2">5497fc2e9ef0c53f1b17d4b901c85832</data>\n      <data key="d6">9</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">777</data>\n      <data key="d5">829a6299a5fa4e7b8ff4020020a0be05</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;FIRST CHECHEN WAR&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The First Chechen War, a conflict between Russia and the Chechen Republic, concluded in 1996 with a cease-fire. This outcome left Russia without control of its territory, significantly impacting its perception of terrorism as a threat. The war is recognized as a pivotal historical event that shaped Russia\'s military doctrine and domestic media landscape.  \n\nThe conflict highlighted the potential for domestic media to be involved in propaganda, both against the state (as alleged during the First Chechen War) and as a tool used by the state itself. Some argue that open media coverage during the war contributed to low morale within Russian forces, leading to a sense of defeat for Russia despite achieving a ceasefire.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">0bd7b3e4a1e43992b5b9213bdd92272d,20e164d99233ce34ea8ce381d30b106c,28cb703fdc157a4e1b984d6601e37170,3db1db2951506b532f7777cda28bb8b2,46a8120d658a422a13cbf4af4bac874c,5fe78f79b74aaf92a89687fd492be682,98d0fa6298be2a61d9cff2a2acb23924</data>\n      <data key="d6">0</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">778</data>\n      <data key="d5">dde2742459c24fb4a91172aa5c1a7620</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;CHECHEN SIDE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The **Chechen Side** refers to the group opposing Russia in the conflict.  Initially driven by nationalist separatism, their ideology shifted towards jihadism and terrorism following the First Chechen War. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">0bd7b3e4a1e43992b5b9213bdd92272d,20e164d99233ce34ea8ce381d30b106c</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">779</data>\n      <data key="d5">323979a67d79498fa271acdf8cd1a0c2</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;FOREIGN INTELLIGENCE SERVICES&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Foreign Intelligence Services are identified as a threat to Russia, engaging in agent and operational-technical penetration."</data>\n      <data key="d2">6b631b800942b76a464afab8e48c63da</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">780</data>\n      <data key="d5">c7e8b188b45841a0a1bcb22f3445ea6e</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;ALEKSANDR KALISTRATOV&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Aleksandr Kalistratov is a professor at the Combined Arms Academy of the Armed Forces. He is known for offering an alternative definition of armed conflict and disagreeing with Serebryannikov\'s view on nonmilitary means.  Kalistratov was also a prominent Soviet military theorist who believed that there was broad agreement to treat armed conflict and war synonymously. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">489aeca592784f5f7be0a754beb4f575,57424d7973e0b0ad452fc6115605d61f,818993a678a84051e60563bfd33f106a,b90af97596777a0400f9c331a5d96a40</data>\n      <data key="d3">2</data>\n      <data key="d4">781</data>\n      <data key="d5">5a4ad077106a4a3f951f43d2e01499b0</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;COMBINED ARMS ACADEMY OF THE ARMED FORCES&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The Combined Arms Academy of the Armed Forces is an educational institution for military personnel where military theory is taught.  Aleksandr Kalistratov works at the academy. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">489aeca592784f5f7be0a754beb4f575,57424d7973e0b0ad452fc6115605d61f,818993a678a84051e60563bfd33f106a</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">782</data>\n      <data key="d5">a7ec8df038d7461689d28f1bdea84d9b</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;RUSSIAN THINKING&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"RUSSIAN THINKING" refers to the strategic thought and approaches employed by Russia. It encompasses the strategic and geopolitical ideas held by Russia, shaping its actions on a global scale.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">0f11f27d252b4419076b47cf4dfcb20d,cf70ea3dd32b83dd2249d0d0987956a7</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">783</data>\n      <data key="d5">8ddefa32e2ed4eaf8f76d17a676f74f3</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;MOSCOW\'S BEHAVIOR&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Moscow\'s Behavior" describes the actions and policies undertaken by the Russian government. These actions are often analyzed through the lens of strategic thinking, reflecting the influence of Russia\'s strategic vision on its governmental decisions.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">0f11f27d252b4419076b47cf4dfcb20d,cf70ea3dd32b83dd2249d0d0987956a7</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">784</data>\n      <data key="d5">95ec30ce8dbe4ca28714e3e3735da8f3</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;RUSSIAN PARADIGM&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"RUSSIAN PARADIGM" represents a new framework for understanding Russian strategy, characterized by cross-domain coercion. This paradigm refers to a unique set of beliefs, values, and approaches to strategy held by Russia.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">8c89f749cd4aa8e422be2a970f803bec,cf70ea3dd32b83dd2249d0d0987956a7</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">785</data>\n      <data key="d5">259e7f5e2ec04418937513413b6d51d1</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;DETERRENCE THEORY&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"A framework for understanding how states use threats and capabilities to prevent aggression from other actors."</data>\n      <data key="d2">cf70ea3dd32b83dd2249d0d0987956a7</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">786</data>\n      <data key="d5">2289f06dd3804a3c84371dda0bab091e</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;IDEATIONAL CONTEXTS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data  <node id="&quot;REVOLUTION&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">**REVOLUTION** is a process of overthrowing existing power structures that results in significant societal upheaval. This upheaval often involves both political and social change, and is considered a crucial concept linking class struggle and war.  The interconnectedness of these elements can potentially accelerate the revolutionary process. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">6750bb4a2ab8af556c6cade73a275a95,83b0087e03908565fbbc54e5d4e331b1,8510ea40cef51fcde12bd266cbc4b6b2,9521960b1adb4fffde0f8bca2df87bcb</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">800</data>\n      <data key="d5">179737fd23c943babdfae01ac5c6bfc3</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;ALLIES&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">**ALLIES** can refer to two distinct concepts.  \n\nThe first definition describes **ALLIES** as a group of countries that share common interests with Russia, potentially including members of NATO. This suggests a geopolitical context where nations align themselves based on shared goals or strategic considerations. \n\nThe second definition defines **ALLIES** as individuals or organizations united in support of a common cause. This broader interpretation encompasses any collective effort driven by shared objectives, regardless of nationality or organizational affiliation.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">6750bb4a2ab8af556c6cade73a275a95,f3489109e196578634fad718c775549e</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">801</data>\n      <data key="d5">65a31e4da283411fb7c971f63d606723</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;ENCYCLOPEDIA OF THE MINISTRY OF DEFENSE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"The Encyclopedia of the Ministry of Defense defined war as an extreme form of conflict resolution involving violence to achieve various goals."</data>\n      <data key="d2">287b17a01df64083a49c84828ae77591</data>\n      <data key="d6">1</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">802</data>\n      <data key="d5">de31810d43174a52aa2f31b72f4542f5</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;ORGANIZATION FOR SECURITY AND CO-OPERATION IN EUROPE (OSCE)&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The Organization for Security and Co-operation in Europe (OSCE) is an international organization that monitors elections.
