individuals who formulate, develop, and implement Russia\'s military strategies. They hold influential positions in both Russian military and political thought, shaping the country\'s strategic doctrine and guiding its military actions.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">317fb77f10175bd5aa2b7ba8103b25ad,3f38017cf23bc7563f3f91672438843d,8e19a67a1ae3b88f93b6c2d0e4c861c7,cf5dcbae87f58f73dad6c1bfbd73256a</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">872</data>\n      <data key="d5">86c2b3749a3c4342bbb3a8c70c3a76a0</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;POLICYMAKERS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Policymakers are decision-makers responsible for formulating and implementing government strategies. This includes making decisions regarding both national strategy and foreign policy.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">3f38017cf23bc7563f3f91672438843d,8e19a67a1ae3b88f93b6c2d0e4c861c7</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">873</data>\n      <data key="d5">571f65acb3134490932feeb91b01cca3</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;DEFENCE INTELLECTUALS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Defence Intellectuals are academics and experts who specialize in military strategy and theory. They contribute to the theoretical understanding of defence and security.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">3f38017cf23bc7563f3f91672438843d,8e19a67a1ae3b88f93b6c2d0e4c861c7</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">874</data>\n      <data key="d5">d3faf86c153f440eaa410305b3dc6617</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;RUSSIAN DEFENCE INTELLECTUALS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Russian Defence Intellectuals" refers to academics and experts who specialize in Russian defense policy. This group consists specifically of Russian nationals working within the field of defense.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">8e19a67a1ae3b88f93b6c2d0e4c861c7,cf5dcbae87f58f73dad6c1bfbd73256a</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">875</data>\n      <data key="d5">f85786004b0540349192d2ca05b15264</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;THEORIES OF VICTORY&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Theories of victory refer to conceptual frameworks used to define and achieve success in military conflicts."</data>\n      <data key="d2">37a79c861cb20a05659b6f1b76b007ba</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">876</data>\n      <data key="d5">cf56bfc9fa7d47fe9cb553dd09f2b412</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;OPERATIONAL ART&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Operational art is a military concept that involves planning and executing complex operations at a strategic level.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">37a79c861cb20a05659b6f1b76b007ba,818993a678a84051e60563bfd33f106a</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">877</data>\n      <data key="d5">a077dbcd38b644f6929cf05272c2fb9d</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;STRATEGIC THEORY&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Strategic theory encompasses frameworks and principles used to guide military planning and decision-making."</data>\n      <data key="d2">37a79c861cb20a05659b6f1b76b007ba</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">878</data>\n      <data key="d5">d2659a32b9de406eb750a35d078c9774</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;VLADIMIR SLIPCHENKO&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Vladimir Slipchenko is a military theorist and deputy head of the Academy of Military Science. He is widely recognized as an authoritative figure in military theory, known for his work on warfare taxonomy which serves as the foundational framework for modern Russian military theorists.  His expertise in warfare extends to the concept of sixth-generation warfare. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">5cd9f4f78cb2dfdfcb512cc36ac0202f,85213ddae01bd7251e1f31b060d869f0,897b3e3eedf4e832571846d6ff67fabe</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">879</data>\n      <data key="d5">0b26876307ad4cc48839b61a21a1d03a</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;SIXTH GENERATION WARFARE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Sixth Generation Warfare refers to a new type of warfare characterized by long-range precision-guided missiles and minimal direct contact between soldiers. This shift, starting in the 1990s,  is marked by the use of precision weapons, information warfare tactics, and the strategic goal of crippling the enemy\'s economy.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">897b3e3eedf4e832571846d6ff67fabe,dcdc940fd2d0b50a2cd9e38ec0d2d76f,fb8a4e3d89439bd18b6f6ecae81d6d7c</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">880</data>\n      <data key="d5">c68e6c694a554256846d12178ddb12dc</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;MCIS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"MCIS is the venue where Gerasimov presented his views on \'soft power\' and color revolutions."</data>\n      <data key="d2">84b65c4d676043766aeebfc93b776ae6</data>\n      <data key="d6">3</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">881</data>\n      <data key="d5">ff25ce2e8ace4bdcb765c863b483852b</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;GEN. He argues that there are three distinct meanings of the term "hybrid warfare."  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">8118246d7d78d2f1bb03239a4d6597c7,92816f700222281e949f32015361b596</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">883</data>\n      <data key="d5">62e8f5f04cd04384b246291cef3a9e4d</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;RUSSIAN HYBRID WARFARE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"BOOK"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"**Russian Hybrid Warfare**" is a concept and approach to warfare developed by Ofer Fridman, as explored in his book of the same name.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">8118246d7d78d2f1bb03239a4d6597c7,92816f700222281e949f32015361b596</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">884</data>\n      <data key="d5">c04abbd5e59b4c64b023908f6db05498</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;MATTIS AND HOFFMAN&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Mattis and Hoffman are authors who first defined hybrid warfare as focusing on military problems."</data>\n      <data key="d2">8118246d7d78d2f1bb03239a4d6597c7</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">885</data>\n      <data key="d5">6bb9bed2e39c4e31a81f12479af3d16c</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;KENNAN&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Kennan is a figure mentioned by Fridman who conceptualized hybrid war as solely based on non-military means."</data>\n      <data key="d2">8118246d7d78d2f1bb03239a4d6597c7</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">886</data>\n      <data key="d5">26c926c6016d4639b05427f01ba629f5</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;WESTERN&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">**WESTERN** refers to a geopolitical bloc or cultural sphere whose military thought is analyzed in the text. This group of countries or entities is primarily focused on their analytical engagement with Russian military thought, and are generally aligned with Western values and perspectives. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">32d948fc460c6d1bb1d9682bfd136dd3,3db1db2951506b532f7777cda28bb8b2,d760565312fa739ff154c8ebd38fe95d</data>\n      <data key="d6">16</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">2</data>\n      <data key="d4">887</data>\n      <data key="d5">8f6872eeb81b432b91405d327636113c</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;RUSSIAN ACADEMY OF MISSILE AND ARTILLERY SCIENCES&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"The Russian Academy of Missile and Artillery Sciences is an organization headed by Vasily Burenok."</data>\n      <data key="d2">3060e5a3570413999878edce8065dc2b</data>\n      <data key="d6">8</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">888</data>\n      <data key="d5">ac80a99fda2b488285d29596dd4d1471</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;NORTH AFRICA&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"GEO"</data>\n      <data key="d1">North Africa is a region where information warfare tactics were employed. They dedicate significant time to developing deterrence postures for specific contingencies. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">1ada0fbd5cbd2b629b6d11e082bf88fc,8c89f749cd4aa8e422be2a970f803bec</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">892</data>\n      <data key="d5">029d1a8c3b184aa5bb21228f40cd12fd</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;GREAT POWER INTERREGNUM&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The **GREAT POWER INTERREGNUM** is a period of relative peace and stability between major powers that has existed since World War II. This lack of focus on conflict management stems from the relative absence of large-scale conflicts between these powerful nations, contributing to a sense of security and reduced urgency in addressing potential international disputes.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">1ada0fbd5cbd2b629b6d11e082bf88fc,9ac9e1e3f7a69c768d48db77a9b7a3c8</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">893</data>\n      <data key="d5">a1ebc53a0bc74a0eb6dbdd18cf3c88cd</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;POST-COLD WAR PERIOD&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The **POST-COLD WAR PERIOD** is defined as the era following the dissolution of the Soviet Union. This period witnessed a significant shift in global power dynamics.  However, it was also marked by a lack of focus on escalation management and war termination strategies. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">1ada0fbd5cbd2b629b6d11e082bf88fc,9ac9e1e3f7a69c768d48db77a9b7a3c8</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">894</data>\n      <data key="d4">898</data>\n      <data key="d5">3f8b5b2727924ba0b62e6286063b6861</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;MILITARY ANALYST&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">A Military Analyst is a professional who provides insights and advice on strategic targets, including both quantifiable and non-quantifiable assets.  They suggest targeting options that may extend beyond purely military objectives, such as influencing decision-making through the targeting of non-military assets like summer homes and cultural centers. Military analysts are recognized as experts in providing strategic advice, particularly in the realm of unconventional warfare. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">941d7903cf338bd149d976e02ef360e3,94a0dceab22bcc64f5cda721c8fea3a9,ff26a07c83518bf86bdee8bad2f2f78c</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">899</data>\n      <data key="d5">bb5010633113442eaf814852995cfa22</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;DECISION-MAKERS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Decision-makers are individuals who hold positions of authority and influence within a state\'s political system.  Due to their power to make decisions that significantly impact both populations and leadership, they are the targets of reflexive control. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">941d7903cf338bd149d976e02ef360e3,ff26a07c83518bf86bdee8bad2f2f78c</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">900</data>\n      <data <data key="d4">902</data>\n      <data key="d5">9e12f514d26d48dfab65807568a6cff9</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;MONUMENTS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"GEO"</data>\n      <data key="d2">94a0dceab22bcc64f5cda721c8fea3a9</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">904</data>\n      <data key="d5">87718ef799a34104b6ef9c2df6621cbc</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;GENERAL STAFF (GS)&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"The General Staff (GS) is the primary military planning and advising body in Russia."</data>\n AND POLICY** refers to the ideas and approaches used by Russia in formulating its military and foreign policy.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">64eeb118488aef964197bf29f3a0adb4,6fe4faca1e39cc57f7c84b772a87fd4d</data>\n      <data key="d6">10</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">4</data>\n      <data is a platform for discussion and analysis focused on military strategy, operational art, force build-up, and combat experiences. It brings together senior military brass, industry professionals, scientists, and defense intellectuals to share insights and perspectives.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">005076b081ea6183b501c25101a8aa32,6fe4faca1e39cc57f7c84b772a87fd4d</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">908</data>\n      <data key="d5">59bcc2ec512c4c1ba44272446b419230</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;SENIOR MILITARY BRASS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Senior military officers from various branches of the armed forces participate in the forum."</data>\n      <data key="d2">005076b081ea6183b501c25101a8aa32</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">909</data>\n      <data key="d5">8f39ae56f8b54b1b94faf04dbd0b9d11</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;SERVICES, CORPS, GS DEPARTMENTS, INDUSTRY, SCIENTIFIC-TECHNOLOGICAL INSTITUTES AND DEFENCE INTELLECTUALS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"These represent diverse sectors involved in military affairs and contribute to the forum\'s discussions."</data>\n      <data key="d2">005076b081ea6183b501c25101a8aa32</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">910</data>\n      <data key="d5">f3018b934ac241639a33c925c24bc507</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;JOURNAL&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"The journal acts as a publication disseminating insights and perspectives from the forum."</data>\n      <data key="d2">005076b081ea6183b501c25101a8aa32</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">911</data>\n      <data key="d5">ddedfd5179e64700adced4803c75cdba</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;GS MILITARY-STRATEGIC ANALYSIS CENTER&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The GS Military-Strategic Analysis Center is a think tank operating within the Russian government. It presents this perspective, analyzing war through the lens of class struggle and power dynamics.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">c224c7a93362b03f8db7d3e34d1bffc1,e54ed249cf4a821abfd0eec3959426c8</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">927</data>\n      <data key="d5">f4370806deb84d0eb7e85e742e7d4bbf</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;SOVIET VIEW&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"The Soviet view on war emphasizes its instrumental role in furthering government policy, seeing both peace and war as tools."</data>\n      <data key="d2">e54ed249cf4a821abfd0eec3959426c8</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">928</data>\n      <data key="d5">c92392d168c2443e8ed7b04992d0c92b</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;WESTERN UNDERSTANDING&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"The Western understanding of war often contrasts with the Soviet view, potentially perceiving it as a chaotic event with unclear purposes."</data>\n      <data key="d2">e54ed249cf4a821abfd0eec3959426c8</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">929</data>\n      <data key="d5">b5800c807edd4087a2420007272d15d0</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;PETER VIGOR&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Peter Vigor is an author who analyzes and compares different perspectives on war, particularly the Soviet and Western views."</data>\n      <data key="d2">e54ed249cf4a821abfd0eec3959426c8</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">930</data>\n      <data key="d5">aa247540e90d4a7abc5bca6fafaaffa1</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;PEACE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0" />\n      <data key="d1">**PEACE** is a concept that holds significant weight in Soviet thought. <data key="d1">"The Strategic Rocket Forces are a part of Russia\'s military, responsible for nuclear deterrence."</data>\n      <data key="d2">8c9af93ed8ee0b5b14df8c35220e2526</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">1066</data>\n      <data key="d5">b3bf669489ae4913bb60ddfe50e41697</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;INTERNAL AFFAIRS&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Internal Affairs is mentioned as a potential agency responsible for information influence on the population, contrasting with the military\'s role."</data>\n      <data key="d2">10779701d4d4bad771a7c8e3bdf664e0</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">1067</data>\n      <data key="d5">0eba9d55a3ff46298665a0c292e2237f</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;SECURITY AGENCIES&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Security agencies are mentioned alongside Internal Affairs as potentially responsible for countering information influence."</data>\n      <data key="d2">10779701d4d4bad771a7c8e3bdf664e0</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">1068</data>\n      <data key="d5">55e3f4a200eb4619ae2b6efb645464d1</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;PERSSON&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Persson is cited as an expert source providing insights into the Russian view of war and national security."</data>\n      <data key="d2">497a16d8349c548069afaf4be6732760</data>\n      <data key="d6">0</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">1069</data>\n      <data key="d5">c44324c171674d00a743413042e9b944</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;EUROMAIDAN REVOLT&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The **Euromaidan Revolt** was a specific color revolution that occurred in Ukraine from 2013 to 2014. Characterized by violence, the revolt is widely recognized as a significant historical event that preceded Russia\'s invasion of Ukraine.  Some view the Euromaidan Revolt as further evidence of Western states successfully using color revolutions as a tool, while others emphasize its role as a catalyst for the subsequent Russian aggression. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">09d7c6af55f6f4b82f041f3f22e4670b,127b37863425efc735533b75512a27a3,465274671b741f3ad76a316d27207a5f,66363736a89b60d4a0809ceb037cbec1,d0c05f8ec94cd42a4727a66ae84be4dd,e0bc114dfaebe00d71bbcf19b4d41f1d</data>\n      <data key="d6">2</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">2</data>\n      <data key="d4">1070</data>\n      <data key="d5">4bdaba79a3274241ab98e27aeaf98f57</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;ANDR KALISTRATOV&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Andr Kalistratov is a military theorist who views war as a social armed struggle, specifically within the context of a class society.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">3d90ffe5fbb2fe4d1036ef242b8830be,e8d8461aeecbc6801361ca4fa5c3e2e2</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">1071</data>\n      <data key="d5">7c8c464ed7044a7896adfeb35f58a04d</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;OREKHOV AND CHEKINOV&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Orekhov and Chekinov are authors who specialize in researching and writing about the evolution and nature of warfare. Their work focuses on comparing warfare in the nineteenth and twenty-first centuries, examining the impact of information technology on modern conflict, and exploring the defining characteristics of war in the 21st century.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">54841d8827acc62d9af1b1f976a8c99f,cb9c7871784fe7e0541e9f25929b9435,e41fa526af28ae23029d009662aa4c4d,f196fc7516d60a5e95b2a477d1f0b3f7</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">1072</data>\n      <data key="d5">5fa2eec73bec481b85eba22ea7a2a927</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;VLADIMIR KVACHKOV&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Vladimir Kvachkov is a GRU colonel and fellow at the Center for Military-Strategic Studies who wrote about modern warfare."</data>\n      <data key="d2">54841d8827acc62d9af1b1f976a8c99f</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">1073</data>\n      <data key="d5">e6aa5eedca984c56b5fa5e179127951d</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;AFGHAN WAR&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"The Afghan war is presented as another example of a conflict that transcends traditional definitions of war."</data>\n      <data key="d2">990f73c5f878701d1f0eda068b4141f2</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">1074</data>\n      <data key="d5">1c4bd4ba4ef64a93acd55faa8fd97ca9</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;CHECHNYA&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"GEO"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Chechnya was a region that was de facto independent at the time, where "restoring constitutional order" was a key objective in the conflict. This highlights the non-military aspects of the conflict alongside the political and territorial dimensions.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">990f73c5f878701d1f0eda068b4141f2,b0c5dde408f78d03b151ddc3b1617dda</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">1075</data>\n      <data key="d5">5b85c70d578c4d67b5cb4743552bd559</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;MARXIST-LENINIST THOUGHT&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Marxist-Leninist thought is a key ideological framework that connects class struggle, war, and revolution. It provides a crucial understanding of the relationship between these three concepts.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">8510ea40cef51fcde12bd266cbc4b6b2,9521960b1adb4fffde0f8bca2df87bcb</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">1076</data>\n      <data key="d5">956113fb770840c38bce65bb5832f988</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;FIRST WORLD WAR&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The First World War influenced the perception of war\'s potential to accelerate revolution.  It is mentioned as an event that strengthened the belief that war could speed up the revolutionary process. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">14442faf092eaecae58a72c1a981a33b,8510ea40cef51fcde12bd266cbc4b6b2,9521960b1adb4fffde0f8bca2df87bcb</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">1077</data>\n      <data key="d5">785bb55e79954b0c84a4a53cd7f0b454</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;RUSSIAN REVOLUTION&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The **Russian Revolution** saw the Bolsheviks come to power. This event is often cited as an example of how war can accelerate revolutionary movements, highlighting the link between war and revolution.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">14442faf092eaecae58a72c1a981a33b,8510ea40cef51fcde12bd266cbc4b6b2,9521960b1adb4fffde0f8bca2df87bcb</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">1078</data>\n      <data key="d5">1239281fd3774b91a99358c9c1e6ee1c</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;SECOND WORLD WAR&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The Second World War solidified the Soviet Union\'s control over Central Europe. This historical event also served as the context for ev\'s early military career. The war further exemplifies the link between war and revolution, as seen in the Soviet Union\'s strengthened position in Central Europe following the conflict. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">00ec4986199087f35da0fdf6a3fbe289,14442faf092eaecae58a72c1a981a33b,8510ea40cef51fcde12bd266cbc4b6b2,9521960b1adb4fffde0f8bca2df87bcb,ac3935048eeae245ddfa4be2101163b4</data>\n      <data key="d6">3</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">1079</data>\n      <data key="d5">32b29a842b224f4c99fa1d5c764efc9a</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;BOLSHEVIK REGIME&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The Bolshevik Regime was a fledgling government that faced both internal struggles and foreign interventions, making its existence precarious.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">7457059c696ee5838f2b9889b1412e1f,dcb36e1f25d08b0eeffb649bc3a7860f</data>\n      <data key="d6">9</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">1080</data>\n      <data key="d5">f5ae7dc11fd64822a3a15e7d3839031a</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;&#1040;&#1053;&#1040;&#1057;&#1058;&#1040;&#1057;&#1048;&#1071; He argues that while violence remains central to war, information warfare is increasingly important. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">672950e46eaf1ef3e60e7be1bb7dfebb,cb292470c7cc7ca5b848504c1662c302</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">1087</data>\n      <data key="d5">3be77a7b57e34c55acc1f1dfbc64ee10</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;RUSSIAN MILITARY DEBATE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"The Russian military debate refers to discussions and disagreements within the Russian military regarding the nature of war and its conduct."</data>\n      <data key="d2">cb292470c7cc7ca5b848504c1662c302</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">1088</data>\n      <data key="d5">751c564f8ff6444d9d4c8de4a677e655</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;ECONOMY&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"CONCEPT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"The economy is presented as a crucial factor in national power and a potential target in warfare."</data>\n      <data key="d2">1a860ae7b783d3a1eb78fb862dd64138</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">1089</data>\n      <data key="d5">96963c158fb64680bded290f442ff9aa</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;VLADIMIR PUTIN&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Vladimir Putin is the President of Russia and believes that his regime\'s survival is threatened by Western subversion."</data>\n      <data key="d2">48992c1ff17a8a786ad467a773402407</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">1090</data>\n      <data key="d5">bdbfbde5dd244447a2a0674b30ae3e8f</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;SERGEI LAVROV&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">Sergei Lavrov is the Foreign Minister of Russia. He views sanctions imposed by the U.S. and EU as an attempt to create "regime change" in Russia, perceiving them as more than just economic penalties. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">48992c1ff17a8a786ad467a773402407,5140c89116bf2a284b9b14b06732515a,b6478283fa7c46af4ca180dfbfe4fb8b,bb79f01fab18fe7d28c221337b6e09c0</data>\n      <data key="d6">0</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">1091</data>\n      <data key="d5">f970bfe31db74929abff6ea38e5d18e6</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;HEAD OF RUSSIA\'S SECOND-LARGEST BANK&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"The head of Russia\'s second-largest bank is quoted as viewing the sanctions as \'economic war\'."</data>\n      <data key="d2">b6478283fa7c46af4ca180dfbfe4fb8b</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">1092</data>\n      <data key="d5">6f0c2a8b79e6406a8ab7a20864ae2ce2</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;MALYSHEV&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">MALYSHEV is a military theorist and expert on war who serves as the chief of the Strategy Department at the General Staff Academy.  He analyzes the changing nature of war, arguing that while its scope has expanded, armed warfare remains its defining element. Despite these evolving trends, Malyshev advocates for a more traditional view of war in his work. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">48406587f16687aac4c95e6b442fc461,7e482cb10632a3cf72d58679114ee7f7,ffc35334e36b0fecb9fab734e90d5cc9</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">1093</data>\n      <data key="d5">7b09e60e33f44ffdab9c656c5b9c1d50</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;ALEKSANDR VLADIMIROV&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Aleksandr Vladimirov is a retired major general and president of the board of Russian military experts for the Russian International Affairs Council."</data>\n      <data key="d2">ffc35334e36b0fecb9fab734e90d5cc9</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">1094</data>\n      <data key="d5">8b7beab7c0a143aea7bffc31df7528d5</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;RUSSIAN INTERNATIONAL AFFAIRS COUNCIL&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The Russian International Affairs Council is an organization led by and employing Aleksandr Vladimirov.  Aleksandr Vladimirov also works for the council. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">10c2107510ca030511e787a41f8386e6,222621f5436da920cdc65605cbbc1a27,ffc35334e36b0fecb9fab734e90d5cc9</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">1095</data>\n      <data key="d5">d03eb34a0612420680555ab9f10d03d5</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;KONSEPTUALNYYE OSNOVY NATSIONALNOY STRATEGII ROSSII&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"BOOK"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Konseptualnyye osnovy natsionalnoy strategii Rossii" is a book published in 2007.  Written by Aleksandr Vladimirov, it focuses on the conceptual foundations of Russian national strategy. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d2">10c2107510ca030511e787a41f8386e6,222621f5436da920cdc65605cbbc1a27,ffc35334e36b0fecb9fab734e90d5cc9</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">1096</data>\n      <data key="d5">b066746cdff7440c8a3591f0c098201d</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;OSNOVY OBSHCHEY TEORII VOINY&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"BOOK"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Osnovy obshchey teorii voiny" is a collection of texts published in 2013.  The publication includes "Konseptualnyye osnovy natsionalnoy strategii Rossii" and foundational works on war theory by Aleksandr Vladimirov. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">10c2107510ca030511e787a41f8386e6,222621f5436da920cdc65605cbbc1a27,ffc35334e36b0fecb9fab734e90d5cc9</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">1097</data>\n      <data of the board of Russian military experts for the Russian International Affairs Council.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">10c2107510ca030511e787a41f8386e6,222621f5436da920cdc65605cbbc1a27</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">1098</data>\n      <data key="d5">c59e3e931b0f4cf888c2eb70857ee753</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;INVASION OF UKRAINE&quot;">\n      <data key="d0" />\n      <data key="d1">The Invasion of Ukraine is considered a potential trigger for calls for revolution within Russian military thought and practice.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">09d7c6af55f6f4b82f041f3f22e4670b,ef9b79c1a74e5e82e587612a6b3f3ada</data>\n      <data key="d6">2</data>\n      <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">3</data>\n      <data key="d4">1099</data>\n      <data key="d5">305b80bb4df5488b8a34129daeeae0c7</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;2007&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"2007 refers to a year when Brezkun published work on hybrid warfare."</data>\n      <data key="d2">f9cd1d8b7cbb13deeabb75de223a5c6c</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">1100</data>\n      <data key="d5">66fa0de756da440bad8da583306410c4</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;2018&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"EVENT"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"2018 refers to a year when Fridman published work on the origins of hybrid warfare."</data>\n      <data key="d2">f9cd1d8b7cbb13deeabb75de223a5c6c</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">1101</data>\n id="&quot;STRATEGIC DETERRENCE FORCES&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">The **STRATEGIC DETERRENCE FORCES** are a military entity that may be involved in the integration of conventional and nuclear weapons capabilities.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">3b41834f1aeafcdbc929c57f206725a1,9faec8504bfb0d46421bb8e60eb2c5dd</data>\n      <data key="d3">2</data>\n      <data key="d4">1143</data>\n      <data key="d5">245a56f01d1b48a7b4d88ed0e354155a</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;CONVENTIONAL-NUCLEAR INTEGRATION&quot;">\n      <data key="d0" />\n      <data key="d1">Conventional-nuclear integration refers to the use of both conventional and nuclear weapons in strategic operations.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">3b41834f1aeafcdbc929c57f206725a1,9faec8504bfb0d46421bb8e60eb2c5dd</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">1144</data>\n      <data key="d5">d3aa564fb4eb430a8ca6813ca76bfff6</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;ADVERSARY\'S&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"ORGANIZATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"Adversary\'s refers to opposing entities or groups, likely nations or organizations."</data>\n      <data key="d2">a1cbb5a09e483e3cc680f9262e2348ed</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">1145</data>\n      <data key="d5">d9b948357d96419ca135065ce1c360ef</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;INTERNATIONAL SPHERES&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"LOCATION"</data>\n      <data key="d1">"International spheres encompass global political and diplomatic arenas."</data>\n      <data key="d2">a1cbb5a09e483e3cc680f9262e2348ed</data>\n      <data key="d3">0</data>\n      <data key="d4">1146</data>\n      <data key="d5">20a79ddd91ba48e4bb7bc194c79baaf6</data>\n    </node>\n    <node id="&quot;SURKOV&quot;">\n      <data key="d0">"PERSON"</data>\n      <data key="d1">**SURKOV** is a Russian political strategist who is closely associated with Vladimir Putin and considered part of the Russian leadership. He is known for developing and promoting the concept of "sovereign democracy," which emphasizes national sovereignty and limits foreign influence.  \n\nSurkov also coined the term "orange technologies" to describe Western-backed strategies aimed at undermining Russia\'s sovereignty through non-violent means, such as protests and civil disobedience. He warned about the threat these technologies posed, connecting them to the concept of "soft capture," where external actors exert influence without direct control.  \n\nWhile Surkov advocated for cooperation with the West, he also highlighted the role of foreign NGOs in color revolutions, viewing them as key players in destabilizing regimes. \n</data>\n      <data key="d2">0a20fca212149a5c275431feaaf62872,10fdbc155d8eeafb67522412fec1e0df,156ff7f250aed5b5236d9aad856e4fa7,34b0078e74299e6a200a4ef43f0bdc9c,3747b8d7981bef88cd93023a9282583b,90103cb4f23e3f665cb8e7a0b7cc6bf1,e8769bf3ae70aa7e94e61f0244ae3e87,fbc7a2df818769e5a910c5bb3976be37</data>\n <data key="d7">0</data>\n      <data key="d3">1</data>\n      <data key="d4">1510</data>\n      <data key="d5">444ab529d10c47f19ef33e931489b8b8</data>\n    </node>\n    <edge source="&quot;RUSSIA&quot;" target="&quot;SECOND CHECHEN WAR&quot;">\n      <data key="d9">3.0</data>\n      <data key="d10">During the Second Chechen War, Russia implemented stricter control over broadcasting and utilized loyal journalists. This strategy was a direct response to perceived losses in public support during the First Chechen War. Despite the challenges and complexities of the conflict, Russia ultimately survived the Second Chechen War. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d11">46a8120d658a422a13cbf4af4bac874c,52788eb4a502bd9fae3098a9fead4ce8,d1270b1668a34228056151a7c64babb1</data>\n      <data key="d12">0ffea4c3c86849ab828036b67b58acdc</data>\n      <data key="d13">0</data>\n      <data key="d14">0</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;RUSSIA&quot;" target="&quot;VALERY GERASIMOV&quot;">\n      <data key="d9">1.0</data>\n      <data key="d10">"Valery Gerasimov is the Chief of the General Staff of Russia."</data>\n      <data key="d11">2ed01d91a2d5804af478b65fbd4fff17</data>\n      <data key="d12">65b488142164407a81b496b4820ef556</data>\n      <data key="d13">1</data>\n      <data key="d14">0</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;RUSSIA&quot;" target="&quot;GAREYEV&quot;">\n      <data key="d9">2.0</data>\n      <data key="d10">Russian expert Gareyev identifies "information and other subversive activities" as a significant threat to Russia. He specifically analyzes the danger posed by "soft power" in this context.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d11">2ed01d91a2d5804af478b65fbd4fff17,84b65c4d676043766aeebfc93b776ae6</data>\n      <data key="d12">b3b006f8629b44df81a266c1e4d81d3f</data>\n      <data key="d13">2</data>\n      <data key="d14">0</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;RUSSIA&quot;" target="&quot;MILITARY DOCTRINE&quot;">\n      <data key="d9">2.0</data>\n      <data key="d10">Russia\'s Military Doctrine is a document that outlines the country\'s strategic goals and military capabilities.  It emphasizes the protection of Russia\'s sovereignty and borders, viewing them as potential threats. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d11">c57764869d0b7caa0abcd0a9e7b856aa,df2540cf569ce35f7b90708e5da0b01d</data>\n      <data key="d12">2a48f66b6a424b9ebf38562836fe1c82</data>\n      <data key="d13">3</data>\n      <data key="d14">0</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;RUSSIA&quot;" target="&quot;INFORMATION WARFARE&quot;">\n      <data key="d9">3.0</data>\n      <data key="d10">Russia views **Information Warfare** as a crucial element of its contemporary military strategy.  They have broadened the definition of war to encompass not only traditional combat but also the manipulation of information to achieve strategic objectives. Russia aims to undermine Western unity and democratic processes through targeted campaigns in **information warfare**. This expansive approach encompasses influencing social and state stability, fostering patriotism, and shaping public consciousness on a mass scale. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d11">225b0cff903c251046636fb4bfe2e8ff,3db1db2951506b532f7777cda28bb8b2,94ad18024a3545fd895f5193db1fd0c5</data>\n      <data key="d12">54e486668fa94feda285f377fb05d14d</data>\n      <data key="d13">4</data>\n      <data key="d14">0</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;RUSSIA&quot;" target="&quot;WEST&quot;">\n      <data key="d9">2.0</data>\n      <data key="d10">Russia actively engages in an information struggle against the West, seeking to weaken their unity and erode confidence in democratic institutions.  This campaign is part of a broader strategy where Russia is perceived as holding a competitive advantage over the West by operating effectively across multiple domains. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data While the **Arab Spring** is often cited as an example of a Color Revolution, it\'s important to note that its nature was complex and evolved over time. Initially, the **Arab Spring** was widely seen as a series of successful nonviolent uprisings, aligning with the typical characteristics of Color Revolutions. However,  the movement also witnessed significant violence in various countries, complicating its categorization and highlighting the diverse trajectories these revolutions can take. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d11">127b37863425efc735533b75512a27a3,c06a4e03818e9f2586a6cd014a2408b7</data>\n      <data key="d12">2192d6436ca840a1bce77dbf9fd354af</data>\n      <data key="d13">136</data>\n      <data key="d14">0</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;ARAB SPRING&quot;" target="&quot;CHEKINOV &amp; BOGDANOV&quot;">\n      <data key="d9">1.0</data>\n      <data key="d10">"Chekinov and Bogdanov viewed the Arab Spring as a sign of a new age of war."</data>\n      <data key="d11">e216e7f3ed5bf3208c1f51eaa41603b8</data>\n      <data key="d12">ef5e0bbdb3774a22900cf45e9b8863ad</data>\n      <data key="d13">137</data>\n      <data key="d14">0</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;ARAB SPRING&quot;" target="&quot;WAR&quot;">\n      <data key="d9">2.0</data>\n      <data key="d10">According to Valery Gerasimov, **Arab Spring**-style revolts could be a typical form of **war** in the 21st century. STRATEGIYA (MILITARY STRATEGY)&quot;">\n      <data key="d9">1.0</data>\n      <data key="d10">"Sokolovsky wrote Voyennaya Strategiya, where he refuted claims about the nature of war."</data>\n      <data key="d11">2cb92533547d702e1894fcea545257ee</data>\n      <data key="d12">9211b015bb074bcd89ae6c75ec10e6da</data>\n      <data key="d13">191</data>\n      <data key="d14">0</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;SOKOLOVSKY&quot;" target="&quot;WAR&quot;">\n      <data key="d9">3.0</data>\n      <data key="d10">Sokolovsky is a scholar who defines war narrowly, focusing solely on armed violence. He has also been known to refute claims about the nature of war that go beyond this definition. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d11">2cb92533547d702e1894fcea545257ee,313dc3be1190b1a10a2579c621091156,7be505fea57e0dbd921a3c195dd29aac</data>\n      <data key="d12">cbc280dac03a4c19bb6737e3789c928f</data>\n      <data key="d13">192</data>\n      <data key="d14">0</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;NIKOLSKY&quot;" target="&quot;WAR&quot;">\n      <data key="d9">1.0</data>\n      <data key="d10">"Nikolsky argued that war had ceased to be an instrument of policy."</data>\n      <data key="d11">2cb92533547d702e1894fcea545257ee</data>\n      <data key="d12">166cfa435aac4465943f59c2d04a0da1</data>\n      <data key="d13">193</data>\n      <data key="d14">0</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;TALENSKY&quot;" target="&quot;WAR&quot;">\n      <data key="d9">1.0</data>\n      <data key="d10">"Talensky argued that war had ceased to be an instrument of policy."</data>\n      <data key="d11">2cb92533547d702e1894fcea545257ee</data>\n      <data key="d12">44bced1d9b184aa29376cf3b0cdac625</data>\n      <data key="d13">194</data>\n      <data key="d14">0</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;GARTHOFF&quot;" target="&quot;WAR&quot;">\n      <data key="d9">1.0</data>\n      <data key="d10">"Garthoff provided evidence for the claim that war had ceased to be an instrument of policy."</data>\n      <data key="d11">2cb92533547d702e1894fcea545257ee</data>\n      <data key="d12">ca58c4e2fae84899a780ff379e1927eb</data>\n      <data key="d13">195</data>\n      <data key="d14">0</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;WAR&quot;" target="&quot;KVACHKOV&quot;">\n      <data key="d9">1.0</data>\n      <data key="d10">"Kvachkov proposes a definition of war that includes non-military means."</data>\n      <data key="d11">c4d611eafc5e900466e378a2742c03bf</data>\n      <data key="d12">2060ce64f028490798a3ed69832e048d</data>\n      <data key="d13">196</data>\n      <data key="d14">0</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;WAR&quot;" target="&quot;SEREBRYANNIKOV&quot;">\n      <data key="d9">2.0</data>\n      <data key="d10">Serebryannikov believes that armed conflict should be the defining characteristic of war, advocating for a clear distinction between war and peace.  He argues against blurring these lines, emphasizing the importance of military action in defining a state of war. However, his conclusions share similarities with Kvachkov\'s definition of war, which encompasses both military and non-military means. \n</data>\n      <data key="d11">48e310bd8a37fd938fc512819430d5f7,c4d611eafc5e900466e378a2742c03bf</data>\n      <data key="d12">fa8fa48e2a7542fc8ff2c43c35e1b32b</data>\n      <data key="d13">197</data>\n      <data key="d14">0</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;WAR&quot;" target="&quot;GAREYEV&quot;">\n      <data key="d9">3.0</data>\n      <data key="d10">According to Gareyev, **War** is defined as an armed struggle and the use of military violence.  While Gareyev maintains that armed conflict is the defining factor of war, he also acknowledges the growing significance of non-military means in modern warfare.  Gareyev\'s definition of war extends beyond traditional notions of armed conflict, encompassing a broader understanding of the concept. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d11">7567750cec0624c2e9f362f989d8b1bc,c4d611eafc5e900466e378a2742c03bf,c8c68899e22ee8c693d6e73e47d38c9e</data>\n      <data key="d12">a37bd07ff1694b6c90572399f084e1ec</data>\n      <data key="d13">198</data>\n      <data key="d14">0</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;WAR&quot;" target="&quot;CLAUSEWITZ&quot;">\n      <data key="d9">5.0</data>\n      <data key="d10">Carl von Clausewitz is a prominent figure whose ideas about war continue to be analyzed and discussed.  He believed that **war is the continuation of politics by other means**. This definition, articulated by Clausewitz, is frequently referenced by scholars such as Kvachkov, Gareyev, Gorbunov, and Bogdanov in their examinations of war\'s nature and strategies for achieving victory.  Clausewitz\'s theories emphasize the importance of either destroying the enemy or weakening their resolve to resist as key factors in securing victory on the battlefield. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d11">37215a6c4810a7b385fb17417f94fbe0,4e2896fd5b6f31d006ca18e1a3299553,7aef3b8e0c0a9cd9f240dfbe12e02c38,bfa15fcd5d4a19aa65f946d1af780d5f,c4d611eafc5e900466e378a2742c03bf</data>\n      <data key="d12">826e32d5ea1d455f8ae2d3b77cd2b41e</data>\n      <data key="d13">199</data>\n      <data key="d14">0</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;WAR&quot;" target="&quot;MODERN CONDITIONS&quot;">\n      <data key="d9">1.0</data>\n      <data key="d10">"Modern conditions are said to have transformed the nature of war."</data>\n      <data key="d11">a5ccc3b4de720472fb0ba6dbc764cdba</data>\n      <data key="d12">1a3bd511e04d4929a45a36fb80127353</data>\n      <data key="d13">200</data>\n      <data key="d14">0</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;WAR&quot;" target="&quot;ARMED STRUGGLE&quot;">\n      <data key="d9">2.0</data>\n      <data key="d10">War and armed struggle are closely related concepts.  The Ministry of Defense identifies armed struggle as the primary element of war. However, it\'s acknowledged that in modern warfare, armed conflict may not always be the most crucial factor. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d11">2836f2f0365794d9fae3abfa350f2311,a5ccc3b4de720472fb0ba6dbc764cdba</data>\n      <data key="d12">d0cd49577d6a49f4a21fdc389aa84805</data>\n      <data key="d13">201</data>\n      <data key="d14">0</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;WAR&quot;" target="&quot;MILITARY THEORISTS&quot;">\n      <data key="d9">1.0</data>\n      <data key="d10">"Military theorists study and analyze war, including its various aspects such as nonmilitary means."</data>\n      <data key="d11">30386c4e76d744b895d430847b713f0a</data>\n      <data key="d12">aa667f462aae45a8a700d83a68c1982f</data>\n      <data key="d13">202</data>\n      <data key="d14">0</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;WAR&quot;" target="&quot;KALISTRATOV&quot;">\n      <data key="d9">2.0</data>\n      <data key="d10">Kalistratov proposes a broader definition of WAR, encompassing elements beyond traditional notions of armed violence.  He suggests that war extends into various domains, highlighting its multifaceted nature. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d11">313dc3be1190b1a10a2579c621091156,7be505fea57e0dbd921a3c195dd29aac</data>\n      <data key="d12">37f40795969a42b3b50e61b76a96fa07</data>\n      <data key="d13">203</data>\n      <data key="d14">0</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;WAR&quot;" target="&quot;PAVEL KAZARIN&quot;">\n      <data key="d9">1.0</data>\n      <data key="d10">"Kazarin argues that war should be understood as a sum of its total features, including economic and information warfare."</data>\n      <data key="d11">cfae2a9660e62a12a25d2678a2931f34</data>\n      <data key="d12">6db48bd5e4ce4337aaac4648376ed07d</data>\n      <data key="d13">204</data>\n      <data key="d14">0</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;WAR&quot;" target="&quot;BURENOK&quot;">\n      <data key="d9">1.0</data>\n      <data key="d10">"Burenok believes that war has changed, focusing on influencing minds rather than physical conflict."</data>\n      <data key="d11">3060e5a3570413999878edce8065dc2b</data>\n      <data key="d12">422e6a449e7e4ce69182113a6493a4e5</data>\n      <data key="d13">205</data>\n      <data key="d14">0</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;WAR&quot;" target="&quot;PEACE&quot;">\n      <data key="d9">2.0</data>\n      <data key="d10">According to Gerasimov, the lines separating **war** and **peace** are becoming increasingly indistinct.  This perspective aligns with Lenin\'s view, which presents **peace** as an extension of political maneuvering. \n</data>\n      <data key="d11">8501d99fb9d704c9315278702413ee9e,beabdeed11a36088777fbee158b3a3f5</data>\n      <data key="d12">68511afc6e204c0b996d76cb75de081c</data>\n      <data key="d13">206</data>\n      <data key="d14">0</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;WAR&quot;" target="&quot;CARL VON CLAUSEWITZ&quot;">\n      <data key="d9">1.0</data>\n      <data key="d10">"Clausewitz believed that all wars are political in purpose."</data>\n      <data key="d11">c0ae1b35d101dd5c80796ebcaaa52998</data>\n      <data key="d12">050f02fbf9e64d08b108c5b921581335</data>\n      <data key="d13">207</data>\n      <data key="d14">0</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;WAR&quot;" target="&quot;MARX AND ENGELS&quot;">\n      <data key="d9">2.0</data>\n      <data key="d10">Marx and Engels viewed war as a continuation of political struggles between powers and classes, holding a different perspective on the subject compared to Lenin.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d11">342381013c3f61db48a3a2b2bc77370c,b1b64ef207d42a2b81118c978ce1f222</data>\n      <data key="d12">97367a34fd6b4451b6be397496d646ea</data>\n      <data key="d13">208</data>\n      <data key="d14">0</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;WAR&quot;" target="&quot;LENIN&quot;">\n      <data key="d9">2.0</data>\n      <data key="d10">Lenin redefined the concept of war, emphasizing its deep connection to a country\'s internal policies. He viewed war not merely as external conflict but as a reflection of pre-war internal politics.  This perspective presented a paradox for Lenin: he believed war was an inherently evil phenomenon that could only be eradicated through further acts of war. \n</data>\n      <data key="d11">3cd3649d4d82b16c6d105090d8081f6e,b1b64ef207d42a2b81118c978ce1f222</data>\n      <data key="d12">80da3caff5344d56b6ca12660594949a</data>\n      <data key="d13">209</data>\n      <data key="d14">0</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;WAR&quot;" target="&quot;TROTSKY&quot;">\n      <data key="d9">1.0</data>\n      <data key="d10">"Trotsky saw violence as the defining feature of war, even in the context of technological advancements."</data>\n      <data key="d11">b1b64ef207d42a2b81118c978ce1f222</data>\n      <data key="d12">e7efb7b459ae4ed4aa412cd20d808970</data>\n      <data key="d13">210</data>\n      <data key="d14">0</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;WAR&quot;" target="&quot;CHEKINOV AND BOGDANOV&quot;">\n      <data key="d9">1.0</data>\n      <data key="d12">f0cc756b32314a1aae3e3cbb507850a2</data>\n      <data key="d13">211</data>\n      <data key="d14">0</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;WAR&quot;" target="&quot;M-LENINIZM O VOINE I ARMII&quot;">\n      <data key="d9">1.0</data>\n      <data key="d10">"The book m-Leninizm o voine i armii defines war as the continuation of politics by means of armed force, emphasizing armed struggle as the defining factor."</data>\n      <data key="d11">d62c24f2a958cdd90af90b2fee315132</data>\n      <data key="d12">f3082b58c8a54c538cf3a0110296955b</data>\n      <data key="d11">d62c24f2a958cdd90af90b2fee315132</data>\n      <data key="d12">c5f2254b67c04ad4add88875e5623e5a</data>\n      <data key="d13">213</data>\n      <data key="d14">0</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;WAR&quot;" target="&quot;COEXISTENCE&quot;">\n      <data key="d9">1.0</data>\n      <data key="d10">"Khrushchev saw coexistence as the continuation of the struggle between social systems, but without resorting to war."</data>\n      <data key="d11">d62c24f2a958cdd90af90b2fee315132</data>\n      <data key="d12">6e151c66c5574df39a7f243858e2ad3f</data>\n      <data key="d13">214</data>\n      <data key="d14">0</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;WAR&quot;" target="&quot;GORBUNOV AND BOGDANOV&quot;">\n      <data key="d9">2.0</data>\n      <data key="d10">WAR is a concept that Gorbunov and Bogdanov extensively analyze and discuss in their work.  They explore the evolving nature of war, delving into both traditional military strategies and the increasing importance of nonmilitary approaches within the realm of conflict. \n</data>\n      <data key="d11">37215a6c4810a7b385fb17417f94fbe0,7aef3b8e0c0a9cd9f240dfbe12e02c38</data>\n      <data key="d12">166366ae9ec842ec9a1deeb13c94026e</data>\n      <data key="d13">215</data>\n      <data key="d14">0</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;WAR&quot;" target="&quot;SUN TZU&quot;">\n      <data key="d9">1.0</data>\n      <data key="d10">"Sun Tzu\'s ideas on warfare are used by Gorbunov and Bogdanov to support their arguments about the evolving nature of conflict."</data>\n      <data key="d11">37215a6c4810a7b385fb17417f94fbe0</data>\n      <data key="d12">cdecc293edb847ae92c3bf8ff39d1e9a</data>\n      <data key="d13">216</data>\n      <data key="d14">0</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;WAR&quot;" target="&quot;MARXIST-LENINIST&quot;">\n      <data key="d9">1.0</data>\n      <data key="d10">"Marxist-Leninist ideology views war as caused by economic factors driven by the ruling class."</data>\n      <data key="d11">ce0f551566143f746d8ff46f4a021065</data>\n      <data key="d12">3a615d980a124616a659136b4fd277b7</data>\n      <data key="d13">217</data>\n      <data key="d14">0</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;WAR&quot;" target="&quot;B. K. KANEVSKY&quot;">\n      <data key="d9">1.0</data>\n      <data key="d10">"B. K. Kanevsky argued that war includes nonmilitary means such as economic, diplomatic, intelligence, technological, and ideological."</data>\n      <data key="d11">39786aa4012dd6b57506633a91deaeca</data>\n      <data key="d12">a9b46d1f9ef747b69d6211386b5aaa20</data>\n      <data key="d13">218</data>\n      <data key="d14">0</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;WAR&quot;" target="&quot;P. N. SHABARDIN&quot;">\n      <data key="d9">1.0</data>\n      <data key="d10">"P. N. Shabardin argued that war includes nonmilitary means such as economic, diplomatic, intelligence, technological, and ideological."</data>\n      <data key="d11">39786aa4012dd6b57506633a91deaeca</data>\n      <data key="d12">891a6dbec2ef4a039efaca78040b00c1</data>\n      <data key="d13">219</data>\n      <data key="d14">0</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;MARXISM-LENINISM&quot;" target="&quot;MILITARY STRATEGY&quot;">\n      <data key="d9">2.0</data>\n      <data key="d10">Marxism-Leninism served as both the ideological and methodological foundation for military strategy in the Soviet Union.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d11">bd18c35385f699b28185f0270112773f,f543dfa25bae5f5d9d2649da77965967</data>\n      <data key="d12">981d45442a11448097acebc6080da414</data>\n      <data key="d13">220</data>\n      <data key="d14">0</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;MARXISM-LENINISM&quot;" target="&quot;SOVIET MILITARY SCIENCE&quot;">\n      <data key="d9">3.0</data>\n      <data key="d10">**Marxism-Leninism** serves as the foundational ideology for **Soviet Military Science**.  All aspects of war and societal science within the Soviet Union are rooted in Marxism-Leninism, directly influencing the development and principles guiding Soviet military strategy and doctrine. This ideological framework became the driving force behind scientific advancements and research within the realm of Soviet military science. \n</data>\n      <data key="d11">2a4b75db8fdd23483fc6c4f097c7f56f,645ce27900f66a0b633be93f0e5d6399,e90da29be1148d9844e3ed777db08bf6</data>\n      <data key="d12">fad1c8144b504954bea46ede106d93ec</data>\n      <data key="d13">221</data>\n      <data key="d14">0</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;SOVIET IDEOLOGY&quot;" target="&quot;NATIONAL SECURITY CONCEPT&quot;">\n      <data key="d9">2.0</data>\n      <data key="d10">The disappearance of **Soviet Ideology** led to the introduction of new security policy documents, including the **National Security Concept**.  This shift in thinking signaled a move away from the previous ideological framework and towards new approaches to national security. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d11">bd18c35385f699b28185f0270112773f,f543dfa25bae5f5d9d2649da77965967</data>\n      <data key="d12">53edb7e587204ed48e523c6f1f8f4056</data>\n      <data key="d13">222</data>\n      <data key="d14">0</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;SOVIET IDEOLOGY&quot;" target="&quot;SOVIET WAY&quot;">\n      <data key="d9">1.0</data>\n      <data key="d10">"The Soviet way is a manifestation or application of Soviet ideology."</data>\n      <data key="d11">65a1bf9e5672afc1a7011ffa78b1c211</data>\n      <data key="d12">f386b02e36884167a5db1a12ee6fcb1a</data>\n      <data key="d13">223</data>\n      <data key="d14">0</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;SOVIET IDEOLOGY&quot;" target="&quot;JUST AND UNJUST WARS&quot;">\n      <data key="d9">1.0</data>\n      <data key="d10">"The classification of just and unjust wars is a central tenet within Soviet ideology."</data>\n      <data key="d11">65a1bf9e5672afc1a7011ffa78b1c211</data>\n      <data key="d12">2809d8a73b71495ca4220571dd54ba1e</data>\n      <data key="d13">224</data>\n      <data key="d14">0</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;MINISTRY OF DEFENSE&quot;" target="&quot;MILITARY DOCTRINE&quot;">\n      <data key="d9">4.0</data>\n      <data key="d10">The **Ministry of Defense** is responsible for creating, publishing, and providing information about the **Military Doctrine**. The doctrine itself was drafted exclusively by the Ministry of Defense.  \n</data>\n      <data key="d11">7357dc206ba88482f202ea79850252f2,9d9628ed6f319fa3c7a74e5a5971aad6,bd18c35385f699b28185f0270112773f,df2540cf569ce35f7b90708e5da0b01d</data>\n      <data key="d12">49f82fa775fb466bb9ae3db14db5b29a</data>\n      <data key="d13">225</data>\n      <data key="d14">0</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;MINISTRY OF DEFENSE&quot;" target="&quot;DOCTRINE&quot;">\n      <data key="d9">2.0</data>\n      <data key="d10">The MINISTRY OF DEFENSE is responsible for both creating and revising DOCTRINE.  They are the author and issuer of all doctrines. \n</data>\n      <data key="d11">0da7185a3277e6969d5f94e97613b636,390e6b6bbf2dbf4ee3678f7e9b5afaed</data>\n      <data Power** is presented as a tool used for political pressure and interference.  The concept of Soft Power is explored and discussed in detail within the **Foreign Policy Concept** document itself. \n\n\n</data>\n      <data key="d11">0fbf2c2d34dfce0579218bcd864902ec,5910165c2ae0e582998b2c2de2b57f54</data>\n      <data key="d12">4a2fa382e77946d2be8e95edc04c6a64</data>\n      <data key="d13">268</data>\n      <data key="d14">0</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;FOREIGN POLICY CONCEPT&quot;" target="&quot;GLOBAL SECURITY ARCHITECTURE&quot;">\n      <data key="d9">1.0</data>\n      <data key="d10">"The Foreign Policy Concept states that new types of weapons erode global security architecture."</data>\n      <data key="d11">5910165c2ae0e582998b2c2de2b57f54</data>\n      <data key="d12">cd015281a069460e844faeb327b7d65f</data>\n      <data key="d13">269</data>\n      <data key="d14">0</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;SOVIET MILITARY ENCYCLOPEDIA&quot;" target="&quot;KHRUSHCHEV&quot;">\n      <data key="d9">1.0</data>\n      <data key="d10">"The Soviet Military Encyclopedia maintains Khrushchev\'s notion of war as avoidable."</data>\n      <data key="d11">ce0f551566143f746d8ff46f4a021065</data>\n      <data key="d12">c7a9fbf22a054056bf4f4562eaecfc08</data>\n      <data key="d13">270</data>\n      <data key="d14">0</data>\n    </edge>\n    <edge source="&quot;CHEKINOV&quot;" target="&quot;BOGDANOV&quot;">\n      <data key="d9">4.0</data>\n      <data key="d10">Chekinov and Bogdanov are academics who share a close professional relationship. """
- size: 105
- columns: community,full_content,level,rank,title,rank_explanation,summary,findings,full_content_json,id
- sample_input:
[{'community': '58', 'full_content': "# Russian Military Thought Community\n\nThe Russian Military Thought Community centers around individuals like Putin, Gorbunov, Bogdanov, Kvachkov, Serebryannikov, and Clausewitz. This community emphasizes the study of armed conflict, drawing inspiration from historical figures like Sun Tzu while analyzing modern warfare in the 21st century.  Key themes include the nature of war, its classification, and the use of both military and nonmilitary means.\n\n## Putin aligns with Gorbunov and Bogdanov's views on conflict.\n\nVladimir Putin's political ideology appears to be influenced by the writings of Russian military theorists Gorbunov and Bogdanov. This is evident in his policies and statements regarding international relations and armed conflict. [Data: Community (23)]  Further research into Putin's public pronouncements and policy decisions could reveal a more explicit connection to their theories.\n\n## Kvachkov critiques Clausewitz's definition of war.\n\nMilitary theorist Kvachkov challenges the traditional understanding of war as presented by Carl von Clausewitz.  He proposes a broader definition that encompasses not only armed warfare but also nonmilitary means of achieving strategic objectives. [Data: Community (303, 18)] This suggests a shift in thinking within Russian military circles towards a more comprehensive approach to conflict.\n\n## Gorbunov and Bogdanov draw upon Sun Tzu's ideas.\n\nThe writings of Gorbunov and Bogdanov demonstrate a clear influence from the ancient Chinese military strategist Sun Tzu. They incorporate his principles of strategy, deception, and adaptability into their analysis of modern warfare.
